00001 /* stb_image - v2.15 - public domain image loader - http://nothings.org/stb_image.h
00002                                      no warranty implied; use at your own risk
00003 
00004    Do this:
00005       #define STB_IMAGE_IMPLEMENTATION
00006    before you include this file in *one* C or C++ file to create the implementation.
00007 
00008    // i.e. it should look like this:
00009    #include ...
00010    #include ...
00011    #include ...
00012    #define STB_IMAGE_IMPLEMENTATION
00013    #include "stb_image.h"
00014 
00015    You can #define STBI_ASSERT(x) before the #include to avoid using assert.h.
00016    And #define STBI_MALLOC, STBI_REALLOC, and STBI_FREE to avoid using malloc,realloc,free
00017 
00018 
00019    QUICK NOTES:
00020       Primarily of interest to game developers and other people who can
00021           avoid problematic images and only need the trivial interface
00022 
00023       JPEG baseline & progressive (12 bpc/arithmetic not supported, same as stock IJG lib)
00024       PNG 1/2/4/8/16-bit-per-channel
00025 
00026       TGA (not sure what subset, if a subset)
00027       BMP non-1bpp, non-RLE
00028       PSD (composited view only, no extra channels, 8/16 bit-per-channel)
00029 
00030       GIF (*comp always reports as 4-channel)
00031       HDR (radiance rgbE format)
00032       PIC (Softimage PIC)
00033       PNM (PPM and PGM binary only)
00034 
00035       Animated GIF still needs a proper API, but here's one way to do it:
00036           http://gist.github.com/urraka/685d9a6340b26b830d49
00037 
00038       - decode from memory or through FILE (define STBI_NO_STDIO to remove code)
00039       - decode from arbitrary I/O callbacks
00040       - SIMD acceleration on x86/x64 (SSE2) and ARM (NEON)
00041 
00042    Full documentation under "DOCUMENTATION" below.
00043 
00044 
00045 LICENSE
00046 
00047   See end of file for license information.
00048

00053       2.13  (2016-12-04) experimental 16-bit API, only for PNG so far; fixes
00054       2.12  (2016-04-02) fix typo in 2.11 PSD fix that caused crashes
00055       2.11  (2016-04-02) 16-bit PNGS; enable SSE2 in non-gcc x64

00062       2.07  (2015-09-13) partial animated GIF support

00064                          minor bugs, code cleanup, and compiler warnings

00104 #ifndef STBI_INCLUDE_STB_IMAGE_H
00105 #define STBI_INCLUDE_STB_IMAGE_H

00107 // DOCUMENTATION
00108 //
00109 // Limitations:
00110 //    - no 16-bit-per-channel PNG
00111 //    - no 12-bit-per-channel JPEG
00112 //    - no JPEGs with arithmetic coding
00113 //    - no 1-bit BMP
00114 //    - GIF always returns *comp=4
00115 //
00116 // Basic usage (see HDR discussion below for HDR usage):
00117 //    int x,y,n;
00118 //    unsigned char *data = stbi_load(filename, &x, &y, &n, 0);
00119 //    // ... process data if not NULL ...
00120 //    // ... x = width, y = height, n = # 8-bit components per pixel ...
00121 //    // ... replace '0' with '1'..'4' to force that many components per pixel
00122 //    // ... but 'n' will always be the number that it would have been if you said 0
00123 //    stbi_image_free(data)
00124 //
00125 // Standard parameters:
00126 //    int *x                 -- outputs image width in pixels
00127 //    int *y                 -- outputs image height in pixels
00128 //    int *channels_in_file  -- outputs # of image components in image file
00129 //    int desired_channels   -- if non-zero, # of image components requested in result
00130 //
00131 // The return value from an image loader is an 'unsigned char *' which points
00132 // to the pixel data, or NULL on an allocation failure or if the image is
00133 // corrupt or invalid. The pixel data consists of *y scanlines of *x pixels,
00134 // with each pixel consisting of N interleaved 8-bit components; the first
00135 // pixel pointed to is top-left-most in the image. There is no padding between
00136 // image scanlines or between pixels, regardless of format. The number of
00137 // components N is 'req_comp' if req_comp is non-zero, or *comp otherwise.
00138 // If req_comp is non-zero, *comp has the number of components that _would_
00139 // have been output otherwise. E.g. if you set req_comp to 4, you will always
00140 // get RGBA output, but you can check *comp to see if it's trivially opaque
00141 // because e.g. there were only 3 channels in the source image.
00142 //
00143 // An output image with N components has the following components interleaved
00144 // in this order in each pixel:
00145 //
00146 //     N=#comp     components
00147 //       1           grey
00148 //       2           grey, alpha
00149 //       3           red, green, blue
00150 //       4           red, green, blue, alpha
00151 //
00152 // If image loading fails for any reason, the return value will be NULL,
00153 // and *x, *y, *comp will be unchanged. The function stbi_failure_reason()
00154 // can be queried for an extremely brief, end-user unfriendly explanation
00155 // of why the load failed. Define STBI_NO_FAILURE_STRINGS to avoid
00156 // compiling these strings at all, and STBI_FAILURE_USERMSG to get slightly
00157 // more user-friendly ones.
00158 //
00159 // Paletted PNG, BMP, GIF, and PIC images are automatically depalettized.
00160 //
00161 // ===========================================================================
00162 //
00163 // Philosophy
00164 //
00165 // stb libraries are designed with the following priorities:
00166 //
00167 //    1. easy to use
00168 //    2. easy to maintain
00169 //    3. good performance
00170 //
00171 // Sometimes I let "good performance" creep up in priority over "easy to maintain",
00172 // and for best performance I may provide less-easy-to-use APIs that give higher
00173 // performance, in addition to the easy to use ones. Nevertheless, it's important
00174 // to keep in mind that from the standpoint of you, a client of this library,
00175 // all you care about is #1 and #3, and stb libraries DO NOT emphasize #3 above all.
00176 //
00177 // Some secondary priorities arise directly from the first two, some of which
00178 // make more explicit reasons why performance can't be emphasized.
00179 //
00180 //    - Portable ("ease of use")
00181 //    - Small source code footprint ("easy to maintain")
00182 //    - No dependencies ("ease of use")
00183 //
00184 // ===========================================================================
00185 //
00186 // I/O callbacks
00187 //
00188 // I/O callbacks allow you to read from arbitrary sources, like packaged
00189 // files or some other source. Data read from callbacks are processed
00190 // through a small internal buffer (currently 128 bytes) to try to reduce
00191 // overhead.
00192 //
00193 // The three functions you must define are "read" (reads some bytes of data),
00194 // "skip" (skips some bytes of data), "eof" (reports if the stream is at the end).
00195 //
00196 // ===========================================================================
00197 //
00198 // SIMD support
00199 //
00200 // The JPEG decoder will try to automatically use SIMD kernels on x86 when
00201 // supported by the compiler. For ARM Neon support, you must explicitly
00202 // request it.
00203 //
00204 // (The old do-it-yourself SIMD API is no longer supported in the current
00205 // code.)
00206 //
00207 // On x86, SSE2 will automatically be used when available based on a run-time
00208 // test; if not, the generic C versions are used as a fall-back. On ARM targets,
00209 // the typical path is to have separate builds for NEON and non-NEON devices
00210 // (at least this is true for iOS and Android). Therefore, the NEON support is
00211 // toggled by a build flag: define STBI_NEON to get NEON loops.
00212 //
00213 // If for some reason you do not want to use any of SIMD code, or if
00214 // you have issues compiling it, you can disable it entirely by
00215 // defining STBI_NO_SIMD.
00216 //
00217 // ===========================================================================
00218 //
00219 // HDR image support   (disable by defining STBI_NO_HDR)
00220 //
00221 // stb_image now supports loading HDR images in general, and currently
00222 // the Radiance .HDR file format, although the support is provided
00223 // generically. You can still load any file through the existing interface;
00224 // if you attempt to load an HDR file, it will be automatically remapped to
00225 // LDR, assuming gamma 2.2 and an arbitrary scale factor defaulting to 1;
00226 // both of these constants can be reconfigured through this interface:
00227 //
00228 //     stbi_hdr_to_ldr_gamma(2.2f);
00229 //     stbi_hdr_to_ldr_scale(1.0f);
00230 //
00231 // (note, do not use _inverse_ constants; stbi_image will invert them
00232 // appropriately).
00233 //
00234 // Additionally, there is a new, parallel interface for loading files as
00235 // (linear) floats to preserve the full dynamic range:
00236 //
00237 //    float *data = stbi_loadf(filename, &x, &y, &n, 0);
00238 //
00239 // If you load LDR images through this interface, those images will
00240 // be promoted to floating point values, run through the inverse of
00241 // constants corresponding to the above:
00242 //
00243 //     stbi_ldr_to_hdr_scale(1.0f);
00244 //     stbi_ldr_to_hdr_gamma(2.2f);
00245 //
00246 // Finally, given a filename (or an open file or memory block--see header
00247 // file for details) containing image data, you can query for the "most
00248 // appropriate" interface to use (that is, whether the image is HDR or
00249 // not), using:
00250 //
00251 //     stbi_is_hdr(char *filename);
00252 //
00253 // ===========================================================================
00254 //
00255 // iPhone PNG support:
00256 //
00257 // By default we convert iphone-formatted PNGs back to RGB, even though
00258 // they are internally encoded differently. You can disable this conversion
00259 // by by calling stbi_convert_iphone_png_to_rgb(0), in which case
00260 // you will always just get the native iphone "format" through (which
00261 // is BGR stored in RGB).
00262 //
00263 // Call stbi_set_unpremultiply_on_load(1) as well to force a divide per
00264 // pixel to remove any premultiplied alpha *only* if the image file explicitly
00265 // says there's premultiplied data (currently only happens in iPhone images,
00266 // and only if iPhone convert-to-rgb processing is on).
00267 //
00268 // ===========================================================================
00269 //
00270 // ADDITIONAL CONFIGURATION
00271 //
00272 //  - You can suppress implementation of any of the decoders to reduce
00273 //    your code footprint by #defining one or more of the following
00274 //    symbols before creating the implementation.
00275 //
00276 //        STBI_NO_JPEG
00277 //        STBI_NO_PNG
00278 //        STBI_NO_BMP
00279 //        STBI_NO_PSD
00280 //        STBI_NO_TGA
00281 //        STBI_NO_GIF
00282 //        STBI_NO_HDR
00283 //        STBI_NO_PIC
00284 //        STBI_NO_PNM   (.ppm and .pgm)
00285 //
00286 //  - You can request *only* certain decoders and suppress all other ones
00287 //    (this will be more forward-compatible, as addition of new decoders
00288 //    doesn't require you to disable them explicitly):
00289 //
00290 //        STBI_ONLY_JPEG
00291 //        STBI_ONLY_PNG
00292 //        STBI_ONLY_BMP
00293 //        STBI_ONLY_PSD
00294 //        STBI_ONLY_TGA
00295 //        STBI_ONLY_GIF
00296 //        STBI_ONLY_HDR
00297 //        STBI_ONLY_PIC
00298 //        STBI_ONLY_PNM   (.ppm and .pgm)
00299 //
00300 //   - If you use STBI_NO_PNG (or _ONLY_ without PNG), and you still
00301 //     want the zlib decoder to be available, #define STBI_SUPPORT_ZLIB
00302 //
00303

00335 //
00336 // PRIMARY API - works on images of any type
00337 //
00338 
00339 //
00340 // load image by filename, open file, or memory buffer
00341 //
00342 
00343 typedef struct
00344 {
00345    int      (*read)  (void *user,char *data,int size);   // fill 'data' with 'size' bytes.  return number of bytes actually read
00346    void     (*skip)  (void *user,int n);                 // skip the next 'n' bytes, or 'unget' the last -n bytes if negative
00347    int      (*eof)   (void *user);                       // returns nonzero if we are at end of file/data
00348 } stbi_io_callbacks;

00624 #if _MSC_VER >= 1400  // not VC6
00625 #include <intrin.h> // __cpuid
00626 static int stbi__cpuid3(void)
00627 {
00628    int info[4];
00629    __cpuid(info,1);
00630    return info[3];
00631 }
00632 #else
00633 static int stbi__cpuid3(void)
00634 {
00635    int res;
00636    __asm {
00637       mov  eax,1
00638       cpuid
00639       mov  res,edx
00640    }
00641    return res;
00642 }
00643 #endif
00644 
00645 #define STBI_SIMD_ALIGN(type, name) __declspec(align(16)) type name
00646 
00647 static int stbi__sse2_available()
00648 {
00649    int info3 = stbi__cpuid3();
00650    return ((info3 >> 26) & 1) != 0;
00651 }
00652 #else // assume GCC-style if not VC++
00653 #define STBI_SIMD_ALIGN(type, name) type name __attribute__((aligned(16)))
00654 
00655 static int stbi__sse2_available()
00656 {
00657    // If we're even attempting to compile this on GCC/Clang, that means
00658    // -msse2 is on, which means the compiler is allowed to use SSE2
00659    // instructions at will, and so are we.
00660    return 1;
00661 }
00662 #endif
00663 #endif

00684 // stbi__context structure is our basic context used by all images, so it
00685 // contains all the IO context, plus some basic image information
00686 typedef struct
00687 {
00688    stbi__uint32 img_x, img_y;
00689    int img_n, img_out_n;
00690 
00691    stbi_io_callbacks io;
00692    void *io_user_data;
00693 
00694    int read_from_callbacks;
00695    int buflen;
00696    stbi_uc buffer_start[128];
00697 
00698    stbi_uc *img_buffer, *img_buffer_end;
00699    stbi_uc *img_buffer_original, *img_buffer_original_end;
00700 } stbi__context;
00701 
00702 
00703 static void stbi__refill_buffer(stbi__context *s);
00704 
00705 // initialize a memory-decode context
00706 static void stbi__start_mem(stbi__context *s, stbi_uc const *buffer, int len)
00707 {
00708    s->io.read = NULL;
00709    s->read_from_callbacks = 0;
00710    s->img_buffer = s->img_buffer_original = (stbi_uc *) buffer;
00711    s->img_buffer_end = s->img_buffer_original_end = (stbi_uc *) buffer+len;
00712 }
00713 
00714 // initialize a callback-based context
00715 static void stbi__start_callbacks(stbi__context *s, stbi_io_callbacks *c, void *user)
00716 {
00717    s->io = *c;
00718    s->io_user_data = user;
00719    s->buflen = sizeof(s->buffer_start);
00720    s->read_from_callbacks = 1;
00721    s->img_buffer_original = s->buffer_start;
00722    stbi__refill_buffer(s);
00723    s->img_buffer_original_end = s->img_buffer_end;
00724 }
00725 
00726 #ifndef STBI_NO_STDIO
00727 
00728 static int stbi__stdio_read(void *user, char *data, int size)
00729 {
00730    return (int) fread(data,1,size,(FILE*) user);
00731 }
00732 
00733 static void stbi__stdio_skip(void *user, int n)
00734 {
00735    fseek((FILE*) user, n, SEEK_CUR);
00736 }
00737 
00738 static int stbi__stdio_eof(void *user)
00739 {
00740    return feof((FILE*) user);
00741 }
00742 
00743 static stbi_io_callbacks stbi__stdio_callbacks =
00744 {
00745    stbi__stdio_read,
00746    stbi__stdio_skip,
00747    stbi__stdio_eof,
00748 };
00749 
00750 static void stbi__start_file(stbi__context *s, FILE *f)
00751 {
00752    stbi__start_callbacks(s, &stbi__stdio_callbacks, (void *) f);
00753 }

00759 static void stbi__rewind(stbi__context *s)
00760 {
00761    // conceptually rewind SHOULD rewind to the beginning of the stream,
00762    // but we just rewind to the beginning of the initial buffer, because
00763    // we only use it after doing 'test', which only ever looks at at most 92 bytes
00764    s->img_buffer = s->img_buffer_original;
00765    s->img_buffer_end = s->img_buffer_original_end;
00766 }

00871 
00872 // stb_image uses ints pervasively, including for offset calculations.
00873 // therefore the largest decoded image size we can support with the
00874 // current code, even on 64-bit targets, is INT_MAX. this is not a
00875 // significant limitation for the intended use case.
00876 //
00877 // we do, however, need to make sure our size calculations don't
00878 // overflow. hence a few helper functions for size calculations that
00879 // multiply integers together, making sure that they're non-negative
00880 // and no overflow occurs.
00881 
00882 // return 1 if the sum is valid, 0 on overflow.
00883 // negative terms are considered invalid.
00884 static int stbi__addsizes_valid(int a, int b)
00885 {
00886    if (b < 0) return 0;
00887    // now 0 <= b <= INT_MAX, hence also
00888    // 0 <= INT_MAX - b <= INTMAX.
00889    // And "a + b <= INT_MAX" (which might overflow) is the
00890    // same as a <= INT_MAX - b (no overflow)
00891    return a <= INT_MAX - b;
00892 }
00893 
00894 // returns 1 if the product is valid, 0 on overflow.
00895 // negative factors are considered invalid.
00896 static int stbi__mul2sizes_valid(int a, int b)
00897 {
00898    if (a < 0 || b < 0) return 0;
00899    if (b == 0) return 1; // mul-by-0 is always safe
00900    // portable way to check for no overflows in a*b
00901    return a <= INT_MAX/b;
00902 }
00903 
00904 // returns 1 if "a*b + add" has no negative terms/factors and doesn't overflow
00905 static int stbi__mad2sizes_valid(int a, int b, int add)
00906 {
00907    return stbi__mul2sizes_valid(a, b) && stbi__addsizes_valid(a*b, add);
00908 }
00909 
00910 // returns 1 if "a*b*c + add" has no negative terms/factors and doesn't overflow
00911 static int stbi__mad3sizes_valid(int a, int b, int c, int add)
00912 {
00913    return stbi__mul2sizes_valid(a, b) && stbi__mul2sizes_valid(a*b, c) &&
00914       stbi__addsizes_valid(a*b*c, add);
00915 }
00916 
00917 // returns 1 if "a*b*c*d + add" has no negative terms/factors and doesn't overflow
00918 static int stbi__mad4sizes_valid(int a, int b, int c, int d, int add)
00919 {
00920    return stbi__mul2sizes_valid(a, b) && stbi__mul2sizes_valid(a*b, c) &&
00921       stbi__mul2sizes_valid(a*b*c, d) && stbi__addsizes_valid(a*b*c*d, add);
00922 }
00923 
00924 // mallocs with size overflow checking
00925 static void *stbi__malloc_mad2(int a, int b, int add)
00926 {
00927    if (!stbi__mad2sizes_valid(a, b, add)) return NULL;
00928    return stbi__malloc(a*b + add);
00929 }
00930 
00931 static void *stbi__malloc_mad3(int a, int b, int c, int add)
00932 {
00933    if (!stbi__mad3sizes_valid(a, b, c, add)) return NULL;
00934    return stbi__malloc(a*b*c + add);
00935 }
00936 
00937 static void *stbi__malloc_mad4(int a, int b, int c, int d, int add)
00938 {
00939    if (!stbi__mad4sizes_valid(a, b, c, d, add)) return NULL;
00940    return stbi__malloc(a*b*c*d + add);
00941 }

00944 // stbi__errpf - error returning pointer to float
00945 // stbi__errpuc - error returning pointer to unsigned char

00947 #ifdef STBI_NO_FAILURE_STRINGS
00948    #define stbi__err(x,y)  0
00949 #elif defined(STBI_FAILURE_USERMSG)
00950    #define stbi__err(x,y)  stbi__err(y)
00951 #else

00953 #endif

00978 static void *stbi__load_main(stbi__context *s, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp, stbi__result_info *ri, int bpc)
00979 {
00980    memset(ri, 0, sizeof(*ri)); // make sure it's initialized if we add new fields
00981    ri->bits_per_channel = 8; // default is 8 so most paths don't have to be changed
00982    ri->channel_order = STBI_ORDER_RGB; // all current input & output are this, but this is here so we can add BGR order
00983    ri->num_channels = 0;
00984 
00985    #ifndef STBI_NO_JPEG
00986    if (stbi__jpeg_test(s)) return stbi__jpeg_load(s,x,y,comp,req_comp, ri);
00987    #endif
00988    #ifndef STBI_NO_PNG
00989    if (stbi__png_test(s))  return stbi__png_load(s,x,y,comp,req_comp, ri);
00990    #endif
00991    #ifndef STBI_NO_BMP
00992    if (stbi__bmp_test(s))  return stbi__bmp_load(s,x,y,comp,req_comp, ri);
00993    #endif
00994    #ifndef STBI_NO_GIF
00995    if (stbi__gif_test(s))  return stbi__gif_load(s,x,y,comp,req_comp, ri);
00996    #endif
00997    #ifndef STBI_NO_PSD
00998    if (stbi__psd_test(s))  return stbi__psd_load(s,x,y,comp,req_comp, ri, bpc);
00999    #endif
01000    #ifndef STBI_NO_PIC
01001    if (stbi__pic_test(s))  return stbi__pic_load(s,x,y,comp,req_comp, ri);
01002    #endif
01003    #ifndef STBI_NO_PNM
01004    if (stbi__pnm_test(s))  return stbi__pnm_load(s,x,y,comp,req_comp, ri);
01005    #endif
01006    #ifndef STBI_NO_DDS
01007    if (stbi__dds_test(s))  return stbi__dds_load(s,x,y,comp,req_comp);
01008    #endif
01009    #ifndef STBI_NO_PVR
01010    if (stbi__pvr_test(s))  return stbi__pvr_load(s,x,y,comp,req_comp);
01011    #endif
01012    #ifndef STBI_NO_PKM
01013    if (stbi__pkm_test(s))  return stbi__pkm_load(s,x,y,comp,req_comp);
01014    #endif
01015 
01016    #ifndef STBI_NO_HDR
01017    if (stbi__hdr_test(s)) {
01018       float *hdr = stbi__hdr_load(s, x,y,comp,req_comp, ri);
01019       return stbi__hdr_to_ldr(hdr, *x, *y, req_comp ? req_comp : *comp);
01020    }
01021    #endif
01022 
01023    #ifndef STBI_NO_TGA
01024    // test tga last because it's a crappy test!
01025    if (stbi__tga_test(s))
01026       return stbi__tga_load(s,x,y,comp,req_comp, ri);
01027    #endif
01028 
01029    return stbi__errpuc("unknown image type", "Image not of any known type, or corrupt");
01030 }
01031 
01032 static stbi_uc *stbi__convert_16_to_8(stbi__uint16 *orig, int w, int h, int channels)
01033 {
01034    int i;
01035    int img_len = w * h * channels;
01036    stbi_uc *reduced;
01037 
01038    reduced = (stbi_uc *) stbi__malloc(img_len);
01039    if (reduced == NULL) return stbi__errpuc("outofmem", "Out of memory");
01040 
01041    for (i = 0; i < img_len; ++i)
01042       reduced[i] = (stbi_uc)((orig[i] >> 8) & 0xFF); // top half of each byte is sufficient approx of 16->8 bit scaling
01043 
01044    STBI_FREE(orig);
01045    return reduced;
01046 }
01047 
01048 static stbi__uint16 *stbi__convert_8_to_16(stbi_uc *orig, int w, int h, int channels)
01049 {
01050    int i;
01051    int img_len = w * h * channels;
01052    stbi__uint16 *enlarged;
01053 
01054    enlarged = (stbi__uint16 *) stbi__malloc(img_len*2);
01055    if (enlarged == NULL) return (stbi__uint16 *) stbi__errpuc("outofmem", "Out of memory");
01056 
01057    for (i = 0; i < img_len; ++i)
01058       enlarged[i] = (stbi__uint16)((orig[i] << 8) + orig[i]); // replicate to high and low byte, maps 0->0, 255->0xffff
01059 
01060    STBI_FREE(orig);
01061    return enlarged;
01062 }
01063 
01064 static unsigned char *stbi__load_and_postprocess_8bit(stbi__context *s, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp)
01065 {
01066    stbi__result_info ri;
01067    void *result = stbi__load_main(s, x, y, comp, req_comp, &ri, 8);
01068 
01069    if (result == NULL)
01070       return NULL;
01071 
01072    if (ri.bits_per_channel != 8) {
01073       STBI_ASSERT(ri.bits_per_channel == 16);
01074       result = stbi__convert_16_to_8((stbi__uint16 *) result, *x, *y, req_comp == 0 ? *comp : req_comp);
01075       ri.bits_per_channel = 8;
01076    }
01077 
01078    // @TODO: move stbi__convert_format to here
01079 
01080    if (stbi__vertically_flip_on_load) {
01081       int w = *x, h = *y;
01082       int channels = req_comp ? req_comp : *comp;
01083       int row,col,z;
01084       stbi_uc *image = (stbi_uc *) result;
01085 
01086       // @OPTIMIZE: use a bigger temp buffer and memcpy multiple pixels at once
01087       for (row = 0; row < (h>>1); row++) {
01088          for (col = 0; col < w; col++) {
01089             for (z = 0; z < channels; z++) {
01090                stbi_uc temp = image[(row * w + col) * channels + z];
01091                image[(row * w + col) * channels + z] = image[((h - row - 1) * w + col) * channels + z];
01092                image[((h - row - 1) * w + col) * channels + z] = temp;
01093             }
01094          }
01095       }
01096    }
01097 
01098    return (unsigned char *) result;
01099 }
01100 
01101 static stbi__uint16 *stbi__load_and_postprocess_16bit(stbi__context *s, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp)
01102 {
01103    stbi__result_info ri;
01104    void *result = stbi__load_main(s, x, y, comp, req_comp, &ri, 16);
01105 
01106    if (result == NULL)
01107       return NULL;
01108 
01109    if (ri.bits_per_channel != 16) {
01110       STBI_ASSERT(ri.bits_per_channel == 8);
01111       result = stbi__convert_8_to_16((stbi_uc *) result, *x, *y, req_comp == 0 ? *comp : req_comp);
01112       ri.bits_per_channel = 16;
01113    }
01114 
01115    // @TODO: move stbi__convert_format16 to here
01116    // @TODO: special case RGB-to-Y (and RGBA-to-YA) for 8-bit-to-16-bit case to keep more precision
01117 
01118    if (stbi__vertically_flip_on_load) {
01119       int w = *x, h = *y;
01120       int channels = req_comp ? req_comp : *comp;
01121       int row,col,z;
01122       stbi__uint16 *image = (stbi__uint16 *) result;
01123 
01124       // @OPTIMIZE: use a bigger temp buffer and memcpy multiple pixels at once
01125       for (row = 0; row < (h>>1); row++) {
01126          for (col = 0; col < w; col++) {
01127             for (z = 0; z < channels; z++) {
01128                stbi__uint16 temp = image[(row * w + col) * channels + z];
01129                image[(row * w + col) * channels + z] = image[((h - row - 1) * w + col) * channels + z];
01130                image[((h - row - 1) * w + col) * channels + z] = temp;
01131             }
01132          }
01133       }
01134    }
01135 
01136    return (stbi__uint16 *) result;
01137 }
01138 
01139 #ifndef STBI_NO_HDR
01140 static void stbi__float_postprocess(float *result, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp)
01141 {
01142    if (stbi__vertically_flip_on_load && result != NULL) {
01143       int w = *x, h = *y;
01144       int depth = req_comp ? req_comp : *comp;
01145       int row,col,z;
01146       float temp;
01147 
01148       // @OPTIMIZE: use a bigger temp buffer and memcpy multiple pixels at once
01149       for (row = 0; row < (h>>1); row++) {
01150          for (col = 0; col < w; col++) {
01151             for (z = 0; z < depth; z++) {
01152                temp = result[(row * w + col) * depth + z];
01153                result[(row * w + col) * depth + z] = result[((h - row - 1) * w + col) * depth + z];
01154                result[((h - row - 1) * w + col) * depth + z] = temp;
01155             }
01156          }
01157       }
01158    }
01159 }
01160 #endif

01165 {
01166    FILE *f;
01167 #if defined(_MSC_VER) && _MSC_VER >= 1400
01168    if (0 != fopen_s(&f, filename, mode))
01169       f=0;
01170 #else
01171    f = fopen(filename, mode);
01172 #endif
01173    return f;
01174 }

01177 STBIDEF stbi_uc *stbi_load(char const *filename, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp)
01178 {
01179    FILE *f = stbi__fopen(filename, "rb");
01180    unsigned char *result;
01181    if (!f) return stbi__errpuc("can't fopen", "Unable to open file");
01182    result = stbi_load_from_file(f,x,y,comp,req_comp);
01183    fclose(f);
01184    return result;
01185 }
01186 
01187 STBIDEF stbi_uc *stbi_load_from_file(FILE *f, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp)
01188 {
01189    unsigned char *result;
01190    stbi__context s;
01191    stbi__start_file(&s,f);
01192    result = stbi__load_and_postprocess_8bit(&s,x,y,comp,req_comp);
01193    if (result) {
01194       // need to 'unget' all the characters in the IO buffer
01195       fseek(f, - (int) (s.img_buffer_end - s.img_buffer), SEEK_CUR);
01196    }
01197    return result;
01198 }

01206    if (result) {
01207       // need to 'unget' all the characters in the IO buffer
01208       fseek(f, - (int) (s.img_buffer_end - s.img_buffer), SEEK_CUR);
01209    }

01240 #ifndef STBI_NO_LINEAR
01241 static float *stbi__loadf_main(stbi__context *s, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp)
01242 {
01243    unsigned char *data;
01244    #ifndef STBI_NO_HDR
01245    if (stbi__hdr_test(s)) {
01246       stbi__result_info ri;
01247       float *hdr_data = stbi__hdr_load(s,x,y,comp,req_comp, &ri);
01248       if (hdr_data)
01249          stbi__float_postprocess(hdr_data,x,y,comp,req_comp);
01250       return hdr_data;
01251    }
01252    #endif
01253    data = stbi__load_and_postprocess_8bit(s, x, y, comp, req_comp);
01254    if (data)
01255       return stbi__ldr_to_hdr(data, *x, *y, req_comp ? req_comp : *comp);
01256    return stbi__errpf("unknown image type", "Image not of any known type, or corrupt");
01257 }

01263    return stbi__loadf_main(&s,x,y,comp,req_comp);
01264 }

01269    stbi__start_callbacks(&s, (stbi_io_callbacks *) clbk, user);

01361 
01363 //
01364 // Common code used by all image loaders
01365 //
01366 
01367 enum
01368 {
01369    STBI__SCAN_load=0,
01370    STBI__SCAN_type,
01371    STBI__SCAN_header
01372 };
01373 
01374 static void stbi__refill_buffer(stbi__context *s)
01375 {
01376    int n = (s->io.read)(s->io_user_data,(char*)s->buffer_start,s->buflen);
01377    if (n == 0) {
01378       // at end of file, treat same as if from memory, but need to handle case
01379       // where s->img_buffer isn't pointing to safe memory, e.g. 0-byte file
01380       s->read_from_callbacks = 0;
01381       s->img_buffer = s->buffer_start;
01382       s->img_buffer_end = s->buffer_start+1;
01383       *s->img_buffer = 0;
01384    } else {
01385       s->img_buffer = s->buffer_start;
01386       s->img_buffer_end = s->buffer_start + n;
01387    }
01388 }
01389 
01390 stbi_inline static stbi_uc stbi__get8(stbi__context *s)
01391 {
01392    if (s->img_buffer < s->img_buffer_end)
01393       return *s->img_buffer++;
01394    if (s->read_from_callbacks) {
01395       stbi__refill_buffer(s);
01396       return *s->img_buffer++;
01397    }
01398    return 0;
01399 }
01400 
01401 stbi_inline static int stbi__at_eof(stbi__context *s)
01402 {
01403    if (s->io.read) {
01404       if (!(s->io.eof)(s->io_user_data)) return 0;
01405       // if feof() is true, check if buffer = end
01406       // special case: we've only got the special 0 character at the end
01407       if (s->read_from_callbacks == 0) return 1;
01408    }
01409 
01410    return s->img_buffer >= s->img_buffer_end;
01411 }
01412 
01413 static void stbi__skip(stbi__context *s, int n)
01414 {
01415    if (n < 0) {
01416       s->img_buffer = s->img_buffer_end;
01417       return;
01418    }
01419    if (s->io.read) {
01420       int blen = (int) (s->img_buffer_end - s->img_buffer);
01421       if (blen < n) {
01422          s->img_buffer = s->img_buffer_end;
01423          (s->io.skip)(s->io_user_data, n - blen);
01424          return;
01425       }
01426    }
01427    s->img_buffer += n;
01428 }
01429 
01430 static int stbi__getn(stbi__context *s, stbi_uc *buffer, int n)
01431 {
01432    if (s->io.read) {
01433       int blen = (int) (s->img_buffer_end - s->img_buffer);
01434       if (blen < n) {
01435          int res, count;
01436 
01437          memcpy(buffer, s->img_buffer, blen);
01438 
01439          count = (s->io.read)(s->io_user_data, (char*) buffer + blen, n - blen);
01440          res = (count == (n-blen));
01441          s->img_buffer = s->img_buffer_end;
01442          return res;
01443       }
01444    }
01445 
01446    if (s->img_buffer+n <= s->img_buffer_end) {
01447       memcpy(buffer, s->img_buffer, n);
01448       s->img_buffer += n;
01449       return 1;
01450    } else
01451       return 0;
01452 }
01453 
01454 static int stbi__get16be(stbi__context *s)
01455 {
01456    int z = stbi__get8(s);
01457    return (z << 8) + stbi__get8(s);
01458 }
01459 
01460 static stbi__uint32 stbi__get32be(stbi__context *s)
01461 {
01462    stbi__uint32 z = stbi__get16be(s);
01463    return (z << 16) + stbi__get16be(s);
01464 }
01465 
01466 #if defined(STBI_NO_BMP) && defined(STBI_NO_TGA) && defined(STBI_NO_GIF)
01467 // nothing
01468 #else
01469 static int stbi__get16le(stbi__context *s)
01470 {
01471    int z = stbi__get8(s);
01472    return z + (stbi__get8(s) << 8);
01473 }
01474 #endif
01475 
01476 #ifndef STBI_NO_BMP
01477 static stbi__uint32 stbi__get32le(stbi__context *s)
01478 {
01479    stbi__uint32 z = stbi__get16le(s);
01480    return z + (stbi__get16le(s) << 16);
01481 }
01482 #endif
01483 
01484 #define STBI__BYTECAST(x)  ((stbi_uc) ((x) & 255))  // truncate int to byte without warnings
01485 
01486 
01488 //
01489 //  generic converter from built-in img_n to req_comp
01490 //    individual types do this automatically as much as possible (e.g. jpeg
01491 //    does all cases internally since it needs to colorspace convert anyway,
01492 //    and it never has alpha, so very few cases ). png can automatically
01493 //    interleave an alpha=255 channel, but falls back to this for other cases
01494 //
01495 //  assume data buffer is malloced, so malloc a new one and free that one
01496 //  only failure mode is malloc failing
01497 
01498 static stbi_uc stbi__compute_y(int r, int g, int b)
01499 {
01500    return (stbi_uc) (((r*77) + (g*150) +  (29*b)) >> 8);
01501 }
01502 
01503 static unsigned char *stbi__convert_format(unsigned char *data, int img_n, int req_comp, unsigned int x, unsigned int y)
01504 {
01505    int i,j;
01506    unsigned char *good;
01507 
01508    if (req_comp == img_n) return data;
01509    STBI_ASSERT(req_comp >= 1 && req_comp <= 4);
01510 
01511    good = (unsigned char *) stbi__malloc_mad3(req_comp, x, y, 0);
01512    if (good == NULL) {
01513       STBI_FREE(data);
01514       return stbi__errpuc("outofmem", "Out of memory");
01515    }
01516 
01517    for (j=0; j < (int) y; ++j) {
01518       unsigned char *src  = data + j * x * img_n   ;
01519       unsigned char *dest = good + j * x * req_comp;
01520 
01521       #define STBI__COMBO(a,b)  ((a)*8+(b))
01522       #define STBI__CASE(a,b)   case STBI__COMBO(a,b): for(i=x-1; i >= 0; --i, src += a, dest += b)
01523       // convert source image with img_n components to one with req_comp components;
01524       // avoid switch per pixel, so use switch per scanline and massive macros
01525       switch (STBI__COMBO(img_n, req_comp)) {
01526          STBI__CASE(1,2) { dest[0]=src[0], dest[1]=255;                                     } break;
01527          STBI__CASE(1,3) { dest[0]=dest[1]=dest[2]=src[0];                                  } break;
01528          STBI__CASE(1,4) { dest[0]=dest[1]=dest[2]=src[0], dest[3]=255;                     } break;
01529          STBI__CASE(2,1) { dest[0]=src[0];                                                  } break;
01530          STBI__CASE(2,3) { dest[0]=dest[1]=dest[2]=src[0];                                  } break;
01531          STBI__CASE(2,4) { dest[0]=dest[1]=dest[2]=src[0], dest[3]=src[1];                  } break;
01532          STBI__CASE(3,4) { dest[0]=src[0],dest[1]=src[1],dest[2]=src[2],dest[3]=255;        } break;
01533          STBI__CASE(3,1) { dest[0]=stbi__compute_y(src[0],src[1],src[2]);                   } break;
01534          STBI__CASE(3,2) { dest[0]=stbi__compute_y(src[0],src[1],src[2]), dest[1] = 255;    } break;
01535          STBI__CASE(4,1) { dest[0]=stbi__compute_y(src[0],src[1],src[2]);                   } break;
01536          STBI__CASE(4,2) { dest[0]=stbi__compute_y(src[0],src[1],src[2]), dest[1] = src[3]; } break;
01537          STBI__CASE(4,3) { dest[0]=src[0],dest[1]=src[1],dest[2]=src[2];                    } break;
01538          default: STBI_ASSERT(0);
01539       }
01540       #undef STBI__CASE
01541    }
01542 
01543    STBI_FREE(data);
01544    return good;
01545 }
01546 
01547 static stbi__uint16 stbi__compute_y_16(int r, int g, int b)
01548 {
01549    return (stbi__uint16) (((r*77) + (g*150) +  (29*b)) >> 8);
01550 }
01551 
01552 static stbi__uint16 *stbi__convert_format16(stbi__uint16 *data, int img_n, int req_comp, unsigned int x, unsigned int y)
01553 {
01554    int i,j;
01555    stbi__uint16 *good;
01556 
01557    if (req_comp == img_n) return data;
01558    STBI_ASSERT(req_comp >= 1 && req_comp <= 4);
01559 
01560    good = (stbi__uint16 *) stbi__malloc(req_comp * x * y * 2);
01561    if (good == NULL) {
01562       STBI_FREE(data);
01563       return (stbi__uint16 *) stbi__errpuc("outofmem", "Out of memory");
01564    }
01565 
01566    for (j=0; j < (int) y; ++j) {
01567       stbi__uint16 *src  = data + j * x * img_n   ;
01568       stbi__uint16 *dest = good + j * x * req_comp;
01569 
01570       #define STBI__COMBO(a,b)  ((a)*8+(b))
01571       #define STBI__CASE(a,b)   case STBI__COMBO(a,b): for(i=x-1; i >= 0; --i, src += a, dest += b)
01572       // convert source image with img_n components to one with req_comp components;
01573       // avoid switch per pixel, so use switch per scanline and massive macros
01574       switch (STBI__COMBO(img_n, req_comp)) {
01575          STBI__CASE(1,2) { dest[0]=src[0], dest[1]=0xffff;                                     } break;
01576          STBI__CASE(1,3) { dest[0]=dest[1]=dest[2]=src[0];                                     } break;
01577          STBI__CASE(1,4) { dest[0]=dest[1]=dest[2]=src[0], dest[3]=0xffff;                     } break;
01578          STBI__CASE(2,1) { dest[0]=src[0];                                                     } break;
01579          STBI__CASE(2,3) { dest[0]=dest[1]=dest[2]=src[0];                                     } break;
01580          STBI__CASE(2,4) { dest[0]=dest[1]=dest[2]=src[0], dest[3]=src[1];                     } break;
01581          STBI__CASE(3,4) { dest[0]=src[0],dest[1]=src[1],dest[2]=src[2],dest[3]=0xffff;        } break;
01582          STBI__CASE(3,1) { dest[0]=stbi__compute_y_16(src[0],src[1],src[2]);                   } break;
01583          STBI__CASE(3,2) { dest[0]=stbi__compute_y_16(src[0],src[1],src[2]), dest[1] = 0xffff; } break;
01584          STBI__CASE(4,1) { dest[0]=stbi__compute_y_16(src[0],src[1],src[2]);                   } break;
01585          STBI__CASE(4,2) { dest[0]=stbi__compute_y_16(src[0],src[1],src[2]), dest[1] = src[3]; } break;
01586          STBI__CASE(4,3) { dest[0]=src[0],dest[1]=src[1],dest[2]=src[2];                       } break;
01587          default: STBI_ASSERT(0);
01588       }
01589       #undef STBI__CASE
01590    }
01591 
01592    STBI_FREE(data);
01593    return good;
01594 }
01595 
01596 #ifndef STBI_NO_LINEAR
01597 static float   *stbi__ldr_to_hdr(stbi_uc *data, int x, int y, int comp)
01598 {
01599    int i,k,n;
01600    float *output;
01601    if (!data) return NULL;
01602    output = (float *) stbi__malloc_mad4(x, y, comp, sizeof(float), 0);
01603    if (output == NULL) { STBI_FREE(data); return stbi__errpf("outofmem", "Out of memory"); }
01604    // compute number of non-alpha components
01605    if (comp & 1) n = comp; else n = comp-1;
01606    for (i=0; i < x*y; ++i) {
01607       for (k=0; k < n; ++k) {
01608          output[i*comp + k] = (float) (pow(data[i*comp+k]/255.0f, stbi__l2h_gamma) * stbi__l2h_scale);
01609       }
01610       if (k < comp) output[i*comp + k] = data[i*comp+k]/255.0f;
01611    }
01612    STBI_FREE(data);
01613    return output;
01614 }
01615 #endif
01616 
01617 #ifndef STBI_NO_HDR
01618 #define stbi__float2int(x)   ((int) (x))
01619 static stbi_uc *stbi__hdr_to_ldr(float   *data, int x, int y, int comp)
01620 {
01621    int i,k,n;
01622    stbi_uc *output;
01623    if (!data) return NULL;
01624    output = (stbi_uc *) stbi__malloc_mad3(x, y, comp, 0);
01625    if (output == NULL) { STBI_FREE(data); return stbi__errpuc("outofmem", "Out of memory"); }
01626    // compute number of non-alpha components
01627    if (comp & 1) n = comp; else n = comp-1;
01628    for (i=0; i < x*y; ++i) {
01629       for (k=0; k < n; ++k) {
01630          float z = (float) pow(data[i*comp+k]*stbi__h2l_scale_i, stbi__h2l_gamma_i) * 255 + 0.5f;
01631          if (z < 0) z = 0;
01632          if (z > 255) z = 255;
01633          output[i*comp + k] = (stbi_uc) stbi__float2int(z);
01634       }
01635       if (k < comp) {
01636          float z = data[i*comp+k] * 255 + 0.5f;
01637          if (z < 0) z = 0;
01638          if (z > 255) z = 255;
01639          output[i*comp + k] = (stbi_uc) stbi__float2int(z);
01640       }
01641    }
01642    STBI_FREE(data);
01643    return output;
01644 }
01645 #endif
01646 
01648 //
01649 //  "baseline" JPEG/JFIF decoder
01650 //
01651 //    simple implementation
01652 //      - doesn't support delayed output of y-dimension
01653 //      - simple interface (only one output format: 8-bit interleaved RGB)
01654 //      - doesn't try to recover corrupt jpegs
01655 //      - doesn't allow partial loading, loading multiple at once
01656 //      - still fast on x86 (copying globals into locals doesn't help x86)
01657 //      - allocates lots of intermediate memory (full size of all components)
01658 //        - non-interleaved case requires this anyway
01659 //        - allows good upsampling (see next)
01660 //    high-quality
01661 //      - upsampled channels are bilinearly interpolated, even across blocks
01662 //      - quality integer IDCT derived from IJG's 'slow'
01663 //    performance
01664 //      - fast huffman; reasonable integer IDCT
01665 //      - some SIMD kernels for common paths on targets with SSE2/NEON
01666 //      - uses a lot of intermediate memory, could cache poorly
01667 
01668 #ifndef STBI_NO_JPEG
01669 
01670 // huffman decoding acceleration
01671 #define FAST_BITS   9  // larger handles more cases; smaller stomps less cache
01672 
01673 typedef struct
01674 {
01675    stbi_uc  fast[1 << FAST_BITS];
01676    // weirdly, repacking this into AoS is a 10% speed loss, instead of a win
01677    stbi__uint16 code[256];
01678    stbi_uc  values[256];
01679    stbi_uc  size[257];
01680    unsigned int maxcode[18];
01681    int    delta[17];   // old 'firstsymbol' - old 'firstcode'
01682 } stbi__huffman;
01683 
01684 typedef struct
01685 {
01686    stbi__context *s;
01687    stbi__huffman huff_dc[4];
01688    stbi__huffman huff_ac[4];
01689    stbi__uint16 dequant[4][64];
01690    stbi__int16 fast_ac[4][1 << FAST_BITS];
01691 
01692 // sizes for components, interleaved MCUs
01693    int img_h_max, img_v_max;
01694    int img_mcu_x, img_mcu_y;
01695    int img_mcu_w, img_mcu_h;
01696 
01697 // definition of jpeg image component
01698    struct
01699    {
01700       int id;
01701       int h,v;
01702       int tq;
01703       int hd,ha;
01704       int dc_pred;
01705 
01706       int x,y,w2,h2;
01707       stbi_uc *data;
01708       void *raw_data, *raw_coeff;
01709       stbi_uc *linebuf;
01710       short   *coeff;   // progressive only
01711       int      coeff_w, coeff_h; // number of 8x8 coefficient blocks
01712    } img_comp[4];
01713 
01714    stbi__uint32   code_buffer; // jpeg entropy-coded buffer
01715    int            code_bits;   // number of valid bits
01716    unsigned char  marker;      // marker seen while filling entropy buffer
01717    int            nomore;      // flag if we saw a marker so must stop
01718 
01719    int            progressive;
01720    int            spec_start;
01721    int            spec_end;
01722    int            succ_high;
01723    int            succ_low;
01724    int            eob_run;
01725    int            jfif;
01726    int            app14_color_transform; // Adobe APP14 tag
01727    int            rgb;
01728 
01729    int scan_n, order[4];
01730    int restart_interval, todo;
01731 
01732 // kernels
01733    void (*idct_block_kernel)(stbi_uc *out, int out_stride, short data[64]);
01734    void (*YCbCr_to_RGB_kernel)(stbi_uc *out, const stbi_uc *y, const stbi_uc *pcb, const stbi_uc *pcr, int count, int step);
01735    stbi_uc *(*resample_row_hv_2_kernel)(stbi_uc *out, stbi_uc *in_near, stbi_uc *in_far, int w, int hs);
01736 } stbi__jpeg;
01737 
01738 static int stbi__build_huffman(stbi__huffman *h, int *count)
01739 {
01740    int i,j,k=0,code;
01741    // build size list for each symbol (from JPEG spec)
01742    for (i=0; i < 16; ++i)
01743       for (j=0; j < count[i]; ++j)
01744          h->size[k++] = (stbi_uc) (i+1);
01745    h->size[k] = 0;
01746 
01747    // compute actual symbols (from jpeg spec)
01748    code = 0;
01749    k = 0;
01750    for(j=1; j <= 16; ++j) {
01751       // compute delta to add to code to compute symbol id
01752       h->delta[j] = k - code;
01753       if (h->size[k] == j) {
01754          while (h->size[k] == j)
01755             h->code[k++] = (stbi__uint16) (code++);
01756          if (code-1 >= (1 << j)) return stbi__err("bad code lengths","Corrupt JPEG");
01757       }
01758       // compute largest code + 1 for this size, preshifted as needed later
01759       h->maxcode[j] = code << (16-j);
01760       code <<= 1;
01761    }
01762    h->maxcode[j] = 0xffffffff;
01763 
01764    // build non-spec acceleration table; 255 is flag for not-accelerated
01765    memset(h->fast, 255, 1 << FAST_BITS);
01766    for (i=0; i < k; ++i) {
01767       int s = h->size[i];
01768       if (s <= FAST_BITS) {
01769          int c = h->code[i] << (FAST_BITS-s);
01770          int m = 1 << (FAST_BITS-s);
01771          for (j=0; j < m; ++j) {
01772             h->fast[c+j] = (stbi_uc) i;
01773          }
01774       }
01775    }
01776    return 1;
01777 }
01778 
01779 // build a table that decodes both magnitude and value of small ACs in
01780 // one go.
01781 static void stbi__build_fast_ac(stbi__int16 *fast_ac, stbi__huffman *h)
01782 {
01783    int i;
01784    for (i=0; i < (1 << FAST_BITS); ++i) {
01785       stbi_uc fast = h->fast[i];
01786       fast_ac[i] = 0;
01787       if (fast < 255) {
01788          int rs = h->values[fast];
01789          int run = (rs >> 4) & 15;
01790          int magbits = rs & 15;
01791          int len = h->size[fast];
01792 
01793          if (magbits && len + magbits <= FAST_BITS) {
01794             // magnitude code followed by receive_extend code
01795             int k = ((i << len) & ((1 << FAST_BITS) - 1)) >> (FAST_BITS - magbits);
01796             int m = 1 << (magbits - 1);
01797             if (k < m) k += (~0U << magbits) + 1;
01798             // if the result is small enough, we can fit it in fast_ac table
01799             if (k >= -128 && k <= 127)
01800                fast_ac[i] = (stbi__int16) ((k << 8) + (run << 4) + (len + magbits));
01801          }
01802       }
01803    }
01804 }
01805 
01806 static void stbi__grow_buffer_unsafe(stbi__jpeg *j)
01807 {
01808    do {
01809       int b = j->nomore ? 0 : stbi__get8(j->s);
01810       if (b == 0xff) {
01811          int c = stbi__get8(j->s);
01812          while (c == 0xff) c = stbi__get8(j->s); // consume fill bytes
01813          if (c != 0) {
01814             j->marker = (unsigned char) c;
01815             j->nomore = 1;
01816             return;
01817          }
01818       }
01819       j->code_buffer |= b << (24 - j->code_bits);
01820       j->code_bits += 8;
01821    } while (j->code_bits <= 24);
01822 }
01823 
01824 // (1 << n) - 1
01825 static stbi__uint32 stbi__bmask[17]={0,1,3,7,15,31,63,127,255,511,1023,2047,4095,8191,16383,32767,65535};
01826 
01827 // decode a jpeg huffman value from the bitstream
01828 stbi_inline static int stbi__jpeg_huff_decode(stbi__jpeg *j, stbi__huffman *h)
01829 {
01830    unsigned int temp;
01831    int c,k;
01832 
01833    if (j->code_bits < 16) stbi__grow_buffer_unsafe(j);
01834 
01835    // look at the top FAST_BITS and determine what symbol ID it is,
01836    // if the code is <= FAST_BITS
01837    c = (j->code_buffer >> (32 - FAST_BITS)) & ((1 << FAST_BITS)-1);
01838    k = h->fast[c];
01839    if (k < 255) {
01840       int s = h->size[k];
01841       if (s > j->code_bits)
01842          return -1;
01843       j->code_buffer <<= s;
01844       j->code_bits -= s;
01845       return h->values[k];
01846    }
01847 
01848    // naive test is to shift the code_buffer down so k bits are
01849    // valid, then test against maxcode. To speed this up, we've
01850    // preshifted maxcode left so that it has (16-k) 0s at the
01851    // end; in other words, regardless of the number of bits, it
01852    // wants to be compared against something shifted to have 16;
01853    // that way we don't need to shift inside the loop.
01854    temp = j->code_buffer >> 16;
01855    for (k=FAST_BITS+1 ; ; ++k)
01856       if (temp < h->maxcode[k])
01857          break;
01858    if (k == 17) {
01859       // error! code not found
01860       j->code_bits -= 16;
01861       return -1;
01862    }
01863 
01864    if (k > j->code_bits)
01865       return -1;
01866 
01867    // convert the huffman code to the symbol id
01868    c = ((j->code_buffer >> (32 - k)) & stbi__bmask[k]) + h->delta[k];
01869    STBI_ASSERT((((j->code_buffer) >> (32 - h->size[c])) & stbi__bmask[h->size[c]]) == h->code[c]);
01870 
01871    // convert the id to a symbol
01872    j->code_bits -= k;
01873    j->code_buffer <<= k;
01874    return h->values[c];
01875 }
01876 
01877 // bias[n] = (-1<<n) + 1
01878 static int const stbi__jbias[16] = {0,-1,-3,-7,-15,-31,-63,-127,-255,-511,-1023,-2047,-4095,-8191,-16383,-32767};
01879 
01880 // combined JPEG 'receive' and JPEG 'extend', since baseline
01881 // always extends everything it receives.
01882 stbi_inline static int stbi__extend_receive(stbi__jpeg *j, int n)
01883 {
01884    unsigned int k;
01885    int sgn;
01886    if (j->code_bits < n) stbi__grow_buffer_unsafe(j);
01887 
01888    sgn = (stbi__int32)j->code_buffer >> 31; // sign bit is always in MSB
01889    k = stbi_lrot(j->code_buffer, n);
01890    STBI_ASSERT(n >= 0 && n < (int) (sizeof(stbi__bmask)/sizeof(*stbi__bmask)));
01891    j->code_buffer = k & ~stbi__bmask[n];
01892    k &= stbi__bmask[n];
01893    j->code_bits -= n;
01894    return k + (stbi__jbias[n] & ~sgn);
01895 }
01896 
01897 // get some unsigned bits
01898 stbi_inline static int stbi__jpeg_get_bits(stbi__jpeg *j, int n)
01899 {
01900    unsigned int k;
01901    if (j->code_bits < n) stbi__grow_buffer_unsafe(j);
01902    k = stbi_lrot(j->code_buffer, n);
01903    j->code_buffer = k & ~stbi__bmask[n];
01904    k &= stbi__bmask[n];
01905    j->code_bits -= n;
01906    return k;
01907 }
01908 
01909 stbi_inline static int stbi__jpeg_get_bit(stbi__jpeg *j)
01910 {
01911    unsigned int k;
01912    if (j->code_bits < 1) stbi__grow_buffer_unsafe(j);
01913    k = j->code_buffer;
01914    j->code_buffer <<= 1;
01915    --j->code_bits;
01916    return k & 0x80000000;
01917 }
01918 
01919 // given a value that's at position X in the zigzag stream,
01920 // where does it appear in the 8x8 matrix coded as row-major?
01921 static stbi_uc stbi__jpeg_dezigzag[64+15] =
01922 {
01923     0,  1,  8, 16,  9,  2,  3, 10,
01924    17, 24, 32, 25, 18, 11,  4,  5,
01925    12, 19, 26, 33, 40, 48, 41, 34,
01926    27, 20, 13,  6,  7, 14, 21, 28,
01927    35, 42, 49, 56, 57, 50, 43, 36,
01928    29, 22, 15, 23, 30, 37, 44, 51,
01929    58, 59, 52, 45, 38, 31, 39, 46,
01930    53, 60, 61, 54, 47, 55, 62, 63,
01931    // let corrupt input sample past end
01932    63, 63, 63, 63, 63, 63, 63, 63,
01933    63, 63, 63, 63, 63, 63, 63
01934 };
01935 
01936 // decode one 64-entry block--
01937 static int stbi__jpeg_decode_block(stbi__jpeg *j, short data[64], stbi__huffman *hdc, stbi__huffman *hac, stbi__int16 *fac, int b, stbi__uint16 *dequant)
01938 {
01939    int diff,dc,k;
01940    int t;
01941 
01942    if (j->code_bits < 16) stbi__grow_buffer_unsafe(j);
01943    t = stbi__jpeg_huff_decode(j, hdc);
01944    if (t < 0) return stbi__err("bad huffman code","Corrupt JPEG");
01945 
01946    // 0 all the ac values now so we can do it 32-bits at a time
01947    memset(data,0,64*sizeof(data[0]));
01948 
01949    diff = t ? stbi__extend_receive(j, t) : 0;
01950    dc = j->img_comp[b].dc_pred + diff;
01951    j->img_comp[b].dc_pred = dc;
01952    data[0] = (short) (dc * dequant[0]);
01953 
01954    // decode AC components, see JPEG spec
01955    k = 1;
01956    do {
01957       unsigned int zig;
01958       int c,r,s;
01959       if (j->code_bits < 16) stbi__grow_buffer_unsafe(j);
01960       c = (j->code_buffer >> (32 - FAST_BITS)) & ((1 << FAST_BITS)-1);
01961       r = fac[c];
01962       if (r) { // fast-AC path
01963          k += (r >> 4) & 15; // run
01964          s = r & 15; // combined length
01965          j->code_buffer <<= s;
01966          j->code_bits -= s;
01967          // decode into unzigzag'd location
01968          zig = stbi__jpeg_dezigzag[k++];
01969          data[zig] = (short) ((r >> 8) * dequant[zig]);
01970       } else {
01971          int rs = stbi__jpeg_huff_decode(j, hac);
01972          if (rs < 0) return stbi__err("bad huffman code","Corrupt JPEG");
01973          s = rs & 15;
01974          r = rs >> 4;
01975          if (s == 0) {
01976             if (rs != 0xf0) break; // end block
01977             k += 16;
01978          } else {
01979             k += r;
01980             // decode into unzigzag'd location
01981             zig = stbi__jpeg_dezigzag[k++];
01982             data[zig] = (short) (stbi__extend_receive(j,s) * dequant[zig]);
01983          }
01984       }
01985    } while (k < 64);
01986    return 1;
01987 }
01988 
01989 static int stbi__jpeg_decode_block_prog_dc(stbi__jpeg *j, short data[64], stbi__huffman *hdc, int b)
01990 {
01991    int diff,dc;
01992    int t;
01993    if (j->spec_end != 0) return stbi__err("can't merge dc and ac", "Corrupt JPEG");
01994 
01995    if (j->code_bits < 16) stbi__grow_buffer_unsafe(j);
01996 
01997    if (j->succ_high == 0) {
01998       // first scan for DC coefficient, must be first
01999       memset(data,0,64*sizeof(data[0])); // 0 all the ac values now
02000       t = stbi__jpeg_huff_decode(j, hdc);
02001       diff = t ? stbi__extend_receive(j, t) : 0;
02002 
02003       dc = j->img_comp[b].dc_pred + diff;
02004       j->img_comp[b].dc_pred = dc;
02005       data[0] = (short) (dc << j->succ_low);
02006    } else {
02007       // refinement scan for DC coefficient
02008       if (stbi__jpeg_get_bit(j))
02009          data[0] += (short) (1 << j->succ_low);
02010    }
02011    return 1;
02012 }
02013 
02014 // @OPTIMIZE: store non-zigzagged during the decode passes,
02015 // and only de-zigzag when dequantizing
02016 static int stbi__jpeg_decode_block_prog_ac(stbi__jpeg *j, short data[64], stbi__huffman *hac, stbi__int16 *fac)
02017 {
02018    int k;
02019    if (j->spec_start == 0) return stbi__err("can't merge dc and ac", "Corrupt JPEG");
02020 
02021    if (j->succ_high == 0) {
02022       int shift = j->succ_low;
02023 
02024       if (j->eob_run) {
02025          --j->eob_run;
02026          return 1;
02027       }
02028 
02029       k = j->spec_start;
02030       do {
02031          unsigned int zig;
02032          int c,r,s;
02033          if (j->code_bits < 16) stbi__grow_buffer_unsafe(j);
02034          c = (j->code_buffer >> (32 - FAST_BITS)) & ((1 << FAST_BITS)-1);
02035          r = fac[c];
02036          if (r) { // fast-AC path
02037             k += (r >> 4) & 15; // run
02038             s = r & 15; // combined length
02039             j->code_buffer <<= s;
02040             j->code_bits -= s;
02041             zig = stbi__jpeg_dezigzag[k++];
02042             data[zig] = (short) ((r >> 8) << shift);
02043          } else {
02044             int rs = stbi__jpeg_huff_decode(j, hac);
02045             if (rs < 0) return stbi__err("bad huffman code","Corrupt JPEG");
02046             s = rs & 15;
02047             r = rs >> 4;
02048             if (s == 0) {
02049                if (r < 15) {
02050                   j->eob_run = (1 << r);
02051                   if (r)
02052                      j->eob_run += stbi__jpeg_get_bits(j, r);
02053                   --j->eob_run;
02054                   break;
02055                }
02056                k += 16;
02057             } else {
02058                k += r;
02059                zig = stbi__jpeg_dezigzag[k++];
02060                data[zig] = (short) (stbi__extend_receive(j,s) << shift);
02061             }
02062          }
02063       } while (k <= j->spec_end);
02064    } else {
02065       // refinement scan for these AC coefficients
02066 
02067       short bit = (short) (1 << j->succ_low);
02068 
02069       if (j->eob_run) {
02070          --j->eob_run;
02071          for (k = j->spec_start; k <= j->spec_end; ++k) {
02072             short *p = &data[stbi__jpeg_dezigzag[k]];
02073             if (*p != 0)
02074                if (stbi__jpeg_get_bit(j))
02075                   if ((*p & bit)==0) {
02076                      if (*p > 0)
02077                         *p += bit;
02078                      else
02079                         *p -= bit;
02080                   }
02081          }
02082       } else {
02083          k = j->spec_start;
02084          do {
02085             int r,s;
02086             int rs = stbi__jpeg_huff_decode(j, hac); // @OPTIMIZE see if we can use the fast path here, advance-by-r is so slow, eh
02087             if (rs < 0) return stbi__err("bad huffman code","Corrupt JPEG");
02088             s = rs & 15;
02089             r = rs >> 4;
02090             if (s == 0) {
02091                if (r < 15) {
02092                   j->eob_run = (1 << r) - 1;
02093                   if (r)
02094                      j->eob_run += stbi__jpeg_get_bits(j, r);
02095                   r = 64; // force end of block
02096                } else {
02097                   // r=15 s=0 should write 16 0s, so we just do
02098                   // a run of 15 0s and then write s (which is 0),
02099                   // so we don't have to do anything special here
02100                }
02101             } else {
02102                if (s != 1) return stbi__err("bad huffman code", "Corrupt JPEG");
02103                // sign bit
02104                if (stbi__jpeg_get_bit(j))
02105                   s = bit;
02106                else
02107                   s = -bit;
02108             }
02109 
02110             // advance by r
02111             while (k <= j->spec_end) {
02112                short *p = &data[stbi__jpeg_dezigzag[k++]];
02113                if (*p != 0) {
02114                   if (stbi__jpeg_get_bit(j))
02115                      if ((*p & bit)==0) {
02116                         if (*p > 0)
02117                            *p += bit;
02118                         else
02119                            *p -= bit;
02120                      }
02121                } else {
02122                   if (r == 0) {
02123                      *p = (short) s;
02124                      break;
02125                   }
02126                   --r;
02127                }
02128             }
02129          } while (k <= j->spec_end);
02130       }
02131    }
02132    return 1;
02133 }
02134 
02135 // take a -128..127 value and stbi__clamp it and convert to 0..255
02136 stbi_inline static stbi_uc stbi__clamp(int x)
02137 {
02138    // trick to use a single test to catch both cases
02139    if ((unsigned int) x > 255) {
02140       if (x < 0) return 0;
02141       if (x > 255) return 255;
02142    }
02143    return (stbi_uc) x;
02144 }
02145 
02146 #define stbi__f2f(x)  ((int) (((x) * 4096 + 0.5)))
02147 #define stbi__fsh(x)  ((x) << 12)
02148 
02149 // derived from jidctint -- DCT_ISLOW
02150 #define STBI__IDCT_1D(s0,s1,s2,s3,s4,s5,s6,s7) \
02151    int t0,t1,t2,t3,p1,p2,p3,p4,p5,x0,x1,x2,x3; \
02152    p2 = s2;                                    \
02153    p3 = s6;                                    \
02154    p1 = (p2+p3) * stbi__f2f(0.5411961f);       \
02155    t2 = p1 + p3*stbi__f2f(-1.847759065f);      \
02156    t3 = p1 + p2*stbi__f2f( 0.765366865f);      \
02157    p2 = s0;                                    \
02158    p3 = s4;                                    \
02159    t0 = stbi__fsh(p2+p3);                      \
02160    t1 = stbi__fsh(p2-p3);                      \
02161    x0 = t0+t3;                                 \
02162    x3 = t0-t3;                                 \
02163    x1 = t1+t2;                                 \
02164    x2 = t1-t2;                                 \
02165    t0 = s7;                                    \
02166    t1 = s5;                                    \
02167    t2 = s3;                                    \
02168    t3 = s1;                                    \
02169    p3 = t0+t2;                                 \
02170    p4 = t1+t3;                                 \
02171    p1 = t0+t3;                                 \
02172    p2 = t1+t2;                                 \
02173    p5 = (p3+p4)*stbi__f2f( 1.175875602f);      \
02174    t0 = t0*stbi__f2f( 0.298631336f);           \
02175    t1 = t1*stbi__f2f( 2.053119869f);           \
02176    t2 = t2*stbi__f2f( 3.072711026f);           \
02177    t3 = t3*stbi__f2f( 1.501321110f);           \
02178    p1 = p5 + p1*stbi__f2f(-0.899976223f);      \
02179    p2 = p5 + p2*stbi__f2f(-2.562915447f);      \
02180    p3 = p3*stbi__f2f(-1.961570560f);           \
02181    p4 = p4*stbi__f2f(-0.390180644f);           \
02182    t3 += p1+p4;                                \
02183    t2 += p2+p3;                                \
02184    t1 += p2+p4;                                \
02185    t0 += p1+p3;
02186 
02187 static void stbi__idct_block(stbi_uc *out, int out_stride, short data[64])
02188 {
02189    int i,val[64],*v=val;
02190    stbi_uc *o;
02191    short *d = data;
02192 
02193    // columns
02194    for (i=0; i < 8; ++i,++d, ++v) {
02195       // if all zeroes, shortcut -- this avoids dequantizing 0s and IDCTing
02196       if (d[ 8]==0 && d[16]==0 && d[24]==0 && d[32]==0
02197            && d[40]==0 && d[48]==0 && d[56]==0) {
02198          //    no shortcut                 0     seconds
02199          //    (1|2|3|4|5|6|7)==0          0     seconds
02200          //    all separate               -0.047 seconds
02201          //    1 && 2|3 && 4|5 && 6|7:    -0.047 seconds
02202          int dcterm = d[0] << 2;
02203          v[0] = v[8] = v[16] = v[24] = v[32] = v[40] = v[48] = v[56] = dcterm;
02204       } else {
02205          STBI__IDCT_1D(d[ 0],d[ 8],d[16],d[24],d[32],d[40],d[48],d[56])
02206          // constants scaled things up by 1<<12; let's bring them back
02207          // down, but keep 2 extra bits of precision
02208          x0 += 512; x1 += 512; x2 += 512; x3 += 512;
02209          v[ 0] = (x0+t3) >> 10;
02210          v[56] = (x0-t3) >> 10;
02211          v[ 8] = (x1+t2) >> 10;
02212          v[48] = (x1-t2) >> 10;
02213          v[16] = (x2+t1) >> 10;
02214          v[40] = (x2-t1) >> 10;
02215          v[24] = (x3+t0) >> 10;
02216          v[32] = (x3-t0) >> 10;
02217       }
02218    }
02219 
02220    for (i=0, v=val, o=out; i < 8; ++i,v+=8,o+=out_stride) {
02221       // no fast case since the first 1D IDCT spread components out
02222       STBI__IDCT_1D(v[0],v[1],v[2],v[3],v[4],v[5],v[6],v[7])
02223       // constants scaled things up by 1<<12, plus we had 1<<2 from first
02224       // loop, plus horizontal and vertical each scale by sqrt(8) so together
02225       // we've got an extra 1<<3, so 1<<17 total we need to remove.
02226       // so we want to round that, which means adding 0.5 * 1<<17,
02227       // aka 65536. Also, we'll end up with -128 to 127 that we want
02228       // to encode as 0..255 by adding 128, so we'll add that before the shift
02229       x0 += 65536 + (128<<17);
02230       x1 += 65536 + (128<<17);
02231       x2 += 65536 + (128<<17);
02232       x3 += 65536 + (128<<17);
02233       // tried computing the shifts into temps, or'ing the temps to see
02234       // if any were out of range, but that was slower
02235       o[0] = stbi__clamp((x0+t3) >> 17);
02236       o[7] = stbi__clamp((x0-t3) >> 17);
02237       o[1] = stbi__clamp((x1+t2) >> 17);
02238       o[6] = stbi__clamp((x1-t2) >> 17);
02239       o[2] = stbi__clamp((x2+t1) >> 17);
02240       o[5] = stbi__clamp((x2-t1) >> 17);
02241       o[3] = stbi__clamp((x3+t0) >> 17);
02242       o[4] = stbi__clamp((x3-t0) >> 17);
02243    }
02244 }
02245 
02246 #ifdef STBI_SSE2
02247 // sse2 integer IDCT. not the fastest possible implementation but it
02248 // produces bit-identical results to the generic C version so it's
02249 // fully "transparent".
02250 static void stbi__idct_simd(stbi_uc *out, int out_stride, short data[64])
02251 {
02252    // This is constructed to match our regular (generic) integer IDCT exactly.
02253    __m128i row0, row1, row2, row3, row4, row5, row6, row7;
02254    __m128i tmp;
02255 
02256    // dot product constant: even elems=x, odd elems=y
02257    #define dct_const(x,y)  _mm_setr_epi16((x),(y),(x),(y),(x),(y),(x),(y))
02258 
02259    // out(0) = c0[even]*x + c0[odd]*y   (c0, x, y 16-bit, out 32-bit)
02260    // out(1) = c1[even]*x + c1[odd]*y
02261    #define dct_rot(out0,out1, x,y,c0,c1) \
02262       __m128i c0##lo = _mm_unpacklo_epi16((x),(y)); \
02263       __m128i c0##hi = _mm_unpackhi_epi16((x),(y)); \
02264       __m128i out0##_l = _mm_madd_epi16(c0##lo, c0); \
02265       __m128i out0##_h = _mm_madd_epi16(c0##hi, c0); \
02266       __m128i out1##_l = _mm_madd_epi16(c0##lo, c1); \
02267       __m128i out1##_h = _mm_madd_epi16(c0##hi, c1)
02268 
02269    // out = in << 12  (in 16-bit, out 32-bit)
02270    #define dct_widen(out, in) \
02271       __m128i out##_l = _mm_srai_epi32(_mm_unpacklo_epi16(_mm_setzero_si128(), (in)), 4); \
02272       __m128i out##_h = _mm_srai_epi32(_mm_unpackhi_epi16(_mm_setzero_si128(), (in)), 4)
02273 
02274    // wide add
02275    #define dct_wadd(out, a, b) \
02276       __m128i out##_l = _mm_add_epi32(a##_l, b##_l); \
02277       __m128i out##_h = _mm_add_epi32(a##_h, b##_h)
02278 
02279    // wide sub
02280    #define dct_wsub(out, a, b) \
02281       __m128i out##_l = _mm_sub_epi32(a##_l, b##_l); \
02282       __m128i out##_h = _mm_sub_epi32(a##_h, b##_h)
02283 
02284    // butterfly a/b, add bias, then shift by "s" and pack
02285    #define dct_bfly32o(out0, out1, a,b,bias,s) \
02286       { \
02287          __m128i abiased_l = _mm_add_epi32(a##_l, bias); \
02288          __m128i abiased_h = _mm_add_epi32(a##_h, bias); \
02289          dct_wadd(sum, abiased, b); \
02290          dct_wsub(dif, abiased, b); \
02291          out0 = _mm_packs_epi32(_mm_srai_epi32(sum_l, s), _mm_srai_epi32(sum_h, s)); \
02292          out1 = _mm_packs_epi32(_mm_srai_epi32(dif_l, s), _mm_srai_epi32(dif_h, s)); \
02293       }
02294 
02295    // 8-bit interleave step (for transposes)
02296    #define dct_interleave8(a, b) \
02297       tmp = a; \
02298       a = _mm_unpacklo_epi8(a, b); \
02299       b = _mm_unpackhi_epi8(tmp, b)
02300 
02301    // 16-bit interleave step (for transposes)
02302    #define dct_interleave16(a, b) \
02303       tmp = a; \
02304       a = _mm_unpacklo_epi16(a, b); \
02305       b = _mm_unpackhi_epi16(tmp, b)
02306 
02307    #define dct_pass(bias,shift) \
02308       { \
02309          /* even part */ \
02310          dct_rot(t2e,t3e, row2,row6, rot0_0,rot0_1); \
02311          __m128i sum04 = _mm_add_epi16(row0, row4); \
02312          __m128i dif04 = _mm_sub_epi16(row0, row4); \
02313          dct_widen(t0e, sum04); \
02314          dct_widen(t1e, dif04); \
02315          dct_wadd(x0, t0e, t3e); \
02316          dct_wsub(x3, t0e, t3e); \
02317          dct_wadd(x1, t1e, t2e); \
02318          dct_wsub(x2, t1e, t2e); \
02319          /* odd part */ \
02320          dct_rot(y0o,y2o, row7,row3, rot2_0,rot2_1); \
02321          dct_rot(y1o,y3o, row5,row1, rot3_0,rot3_1); \
02322          __m128i sum17 = _mm_add_epi16(row1, row7); \
02323          __m128i sum35 = _mm_add_epi16(row3, row5); \
02324          dct_rot(y4o,y5o, sum17,sum35, rot1_0,rot1_1); \
02325          dct_wadd(x4, y0o, y4o); \
02326          dct_wadd(x5, y1o, y5o); \
02327          dct_wadd(x6, y2o, y5o); \
02328          dct_wadd(x7, y3o, y4o); \
02329          dct_bfly32o(row0,row7, x0,x7,bias,shift); \
02330          dct_bfly32o(row1,row6, x1,x6,bias,shift); \
02331          dct_bfly32o(row2,row5, x2,x5,bias,shift); \
02332          dct_bfly32o(row3,row4, x3,x4,bias,shift); \
02333       }
02334 
02335    __m128i rot0_0 = dct_const(stbi__f2f(0.5411961f), stbi__f2f(0.5411961f) + stbi__f2f(-1.847759065f));
02336    __m128i rot0_1 = dct_const(stbi__f2f(0.5411961f) + stbi__f2f( 0.765366865f), stbi__f2f(0.5411961f));
02337    __m128i rot1_0 = dct_const(stbi__f2f(1.175875602f) + stbi__f2f(-0.899976223f), stbi__f2f(1.175875602f));
02338    __m128i rot1_1 = dct_const(stbi__f2f(1.175875602f), stbi__f2f(1.175875602f) + stbi__f2f(-2.562915447f));
02339    __m128i rot2_0 = dct_const(stbi__f2f(-1.961570560f) + stbi__f2f( 0.298631336f), stbi__f2f(-1.961570560f));
02340    __m128i rot2_1 = dct_const(stbi__f2f(-1.961570560f), stbi__f2f(-1.961570560f) + stbi__f2f( 3.072711026f));
02341    __m128i rot3_0 = dct_const(stbi__f2f(-0.390180644f) + stbi__f2f( 2.053119869f), stbi__f2f(-0.390180644f));
02342    __m128i rot3_1 = dct_const(stbi__f2f(-0.390180644f), stbi__f2f(-0.390180644f) + stbi__f2f( 1.501321110f));
02343 
02344    // rounding biases in column/row passes, see stbi__idct_block for explanation.
02345    __m128i bias_0 = _mm_set1_epi32(512);
02346    __m128i bias_1 = _mm_set1_epi32(65536 + (128<<17));
02347 
02348    // load
02349    row0 = _mm_load_si128((const __m128i *) (data + 0*8));
02350    row1 = _mm_load_si128((const __m128i *) (data + 1*8));
02351    row2 = _mm_load_si128((const __m128i *) (data + 2*8));
02352    row3 = _mm_load_si128((const __m128i *) (data + 3*8));
02353    row4 = _mm_load_si128((const __m128i *) (data + 4*8));
02354    row5 = _mm_load_si128((const __m128i *) (data + 5*8));
02355    row6 = _mm_load_si128((const __m128i *) (data + 6*8));
02356    row7 = _mm_load_si128((const __m128i *) (data + 7*8));
02357 
02358    // column pass
02359    dct_pass(bias_0, 10);
02360 
02361    {
02362       // 16bit 8x8 transpose pass 1
02363       dct_interleave16(row0, row4);
02364       dct_interleave16(row1, row5);
02365       dct_interleave16(row2, row6);
02366       dct_interleave16(row3, row7);
02367 
02368       // transpose pass 2
02369       dct_interleave16(row0, row2);
02370       dct_interleave16(row1, row3);
02371       dct_interleave16(row4, row6);
02372       dct_interleave16(row5, row7);
02373 
02374       // transpose pass 3
02375       dct_interleave16(row0, row1);
02376       dct_interleave16(row2, row3);
02377       dct_interleave16(row4, row5);
02378       dct_interleave16(row6, row7);
02379    }
02380 
02381    // row pass
02382    dct_pass(bias_1, 17);
02383 
02384    {
02385       // pack
02386       __m128i p0 = _mm_packus_epi16(row0, row1); // a0a1a2a3...a7b0b1b2b3...b7
02387       __m128i p1 = _mm_packus_epi16(row2, row3);
02388       __m128i p2 = _mm_packus_epi16(row4, row5);
02389       __m128i p3 = _mm_packus_epi16(row6, row7);
02390 
02391       // 8bit 8x8 transpose pass 1
02392       dct_interleave8(p0, p2); // a0e0a1e1...
02393       dct_interleave8(p1, p3); // c0g0c1g1...
02394 
02395       // transpose pass 2
02396       dct_interleave8(p0, p1); // a0c0e0g0...
02397       dct_interleave8(p2, p3); // b0d0f0h0...
02398 
02399       // transpose pass 3
02400       dct_interleave8(p0, p2); // a0b0c0d0...
02401       dct_interleave8(p1, p3); // a4b4c4d4...
02402 
02403       // store
02404       _mm_storel_epi64((__m128i *) out, p0); out += out_stride;
02405       _mm_storel_epi64((__m128i *) out, _mm_shuffle_epi32(p0, 0x4e)); out += out_stride;
02406       _mm_storel_epi64((__m128i *) out, p2); out += out_stride;
02407       _mm_storel_epi64((__m128i *) out, _mm_shuffle_epi32(p2, 0x4e)); out += out_stride;
02408       _mm_storel_epi64((__m128i *) out, p1); out += out_stride;
02409       _mm_storel_epi64((__m128i *) out, _mm_shuffle_epi32(p1, 0x4e)); out += out_stride;
02410       _mm_storel_epi64((__m128i *) out, p3); out += out_stride;
02411       _mm_storel_epi64((__m128i *) out, _mm_shuffle_epi32(p3, 0x4e));
02412    }
02413 
02414 #undef dct_const
02415 #undef dct_rot
02416 #undef dct_widen
02417 #undef dct_wadd
02418 #undef dct_wsub
02419 #undef dct_bfly32o
02420 #undef dct_interleave8
02421 #undef dct_interleave16
02422 #undef dct_pass
02423 }
02424 
02425 #endif // STBI_SSE2
02426 
02427 #ifdef STBI_NEON
02428 
02429 // NEON integer IDCT. should produce bit-identical
02430 // results to the generic C version.
02431 static void stbi__idct_simd(stbi_uc *out, int out_stride, short data[64])
02432 {
02433    int16x8_t row0, row1, row2, row3, row4, row5, row6, row7;
02434 
02435    int16x4_t rot0_0 = vdup_n_s16(stbi__f2f(0.5411961f));
02436    int16x4_t rot0_1 = vdup_n_s16(stbi__f2f(-1.847759065f));
02437    int16x4_t rot0_2 = vdup_n_s16(stbi__f2f( 0.765366865f));
02438    int16x4_t rot1_0 = vdup_n_s16(stbi__f2f( 1.175875602f));
02439    int16x4_t rot1_1 = vdup_n_s16(stbi__f2f(-0.899976223f));
02440    int16x4_t rot1_2 = vdup_n_s16(stbi__f2f(-2.562915447f));
02441    int16x4_t rot2_0 = vdup_n_s16(stbi__f2f(-1.961570560f));
02442    int16x4_t rot2_1 = vdup_n_s16(stbi__f2f(-0.390180644f));
02443    int16x4_t rot3_0 = vdup_n_s16(stbi__f2f( 0.298631336f));
02444    int16x4_t rot3_1 = vdup_n_s16(stbi__f2f( 2.053119869f));
02445    int16x4_t rot3_2 = vdup_n_s16(stbi__f2f( 3.072711026f));
02446    int16x4_t rot3_3 = vdup_n_s16(stbi__f2f( 1.501321110f));
02447 
02448 #define dct_long_mul(out, inq, coeff) \
02449    int32x4_t out##_l = vmull_s16(vget_low_s16(inq), coeff); \
02450    int32x4_t out##_h = vmull_s16(vget_high_s16(inq), coeff)
02451 
02452 #define dct_long_mac(out, acc, inq, coeff) \
02453    int32x4_t out##_l = vmlal_s16(acc##_l, vget_low_s16(inq), coeff); \
02454    int32x4_t out##_h = vmlal_s16(acc##_h, vget_high_s16(inq), coeff)
02455 
02456 #define dct_widen(out, inq) \
02457    int32x4_t out##_l = vshll_n_s16(vget_low_s16(inq), 12); \
02458    int32x4_t out##_h = vshll_n_s16(vget_high_s16(inq), 12)
02459 
02460 // wide add
02461 #define dct_wadd(out, a, b) \
02462    int32x4_t out##_l = vaddq_s32(a##_l, b##_l); \
02463    int32x4_t out##_h = vaddq_s32(a##_h, b##_h)
02464 
02465 // wide sub
02466 #define dct_wsub(out, a, b) \
02467    int32x4_t out##_l = vsubq_s32(a##_l, b##_l); \
02468    int32x4_t out##_h = vsubq_s32(a##_h, b##_h)
02469 
02470 // butterfly a/b, then shift using "shiftop" by "s" and pack
02471 #define dct_bfly32o(out0,out1, a,b,shiftop,s) \
02472    { \
02473       dct_wadd(sum, a, b); \
02474       dct_wsub(dif, a, b); \
02475       out0 = vcombine_s16(shiftop(sum_l, s), shiftop(sum_h, s)); \
02476       out1 = vcombine_s16(shiftop(dif_l, s), shiftop(dif_h, s)); \
02477    }
02478 
02479 #define dct_pass(shiftop, shift) \
02480    { \
02481       /* even part */ \
02482       int16x8_t sum26 = vaddq_s16(row2, row6); \
02483       dct_long_mul(p1e, sum26, rot0_0); \
02484       dct_long_mac(t2e, p1e, row6, rot0_1); \
02485       dct_long_mac(t3e, p1e, row2, rot0_2); \
02486       int16x8_t sum04 = vaddq_s16(row0, row4); \
02487       int16x8_t dif04 = vsubq_s16(row0, row4); \
02488       dct_widen(t0e, sum04); \
02489       dct_widen(t1e, dif04); \
02490       dct_wadd(x0, t0e, t3e); \
02491       dct_wsub(x3, t0e, t3e); \
02492       dct_wadd(x1, t1e, t2e); \
02493       dct_wsub(x2, t1e, t2e); \
02494       /* odd part */ \
02495       int16x8_t sum15 = vaddq_s16(row1, row5); \
02496       int16x8_t sum17 = vaddq_s16(row1, row7); \
02497       int16x8_t sum35 = vaddq_s16(row3, row5); \
02498       int16x8_t sum37 = vaddq_s16(row3, row7); \
02499       int16x8_t sumodd = vaddq_s16(sum17, sum35); \
02500       dct_long_mul(p5o, sumodd, rot1_0); \
02501       dct_long_mac(p1o, p5o, sum17, rot1_1); \
02502       dct_long_mac(p2o, p5o, sum35, rot1_2); \
02503       dct_long_mul(p3o, sum37, rot2_0); \
02504       dct_long_mul(p4o, sum15, rot2_1); \
02505       dct_wadd(sump13o, p1o, p3o); \
02506       dct_wadd(sump24o, p2o, p4o); \
02507       dct_wadd(sump23o, p2o, p3o); \
02508       dct_wadd(sump14o, p1o, p4o); \
02509       dct_long_mac(x4, sump13o, row7, rot3_0); \
02510       dct_long_mac(x5, sump24o, row5, rot3_1); \
02511       dct_long_mac(x6, sump23o, row3, rot3_2); \
02512       dct_long_mac(x7, sump14o, row1, rot3_3); \
02513       dct_bfly32o(row0,row7, x0,x7,shiftop,shift); \
02514       dct_bfly32o(row1,row6, x1,x6,shiftop,shift); \
02515       dct_bfly32o(row2,row5, x2,x5,shiftop,shift); \
02516       dct_bfly32o(row3,row4, x3,x4,shiftop,shift); \
02517    }
02518 
02519    // load
02520    row0 = vld1q_s16(data + 0*8);
02521    row1 = vld1q_s16(data + 1*8);
02522    row2 = vld1q_s16(data + 2*8);
02523    row3 = vld1q_s16(data + 3*8);
02524    row4 = vld1q_s16(data + 4*8);
02525    row5 = vld1q_s16(data + 5*8);
02526    row6 = vld1q_s16(data + 6*8);
02527    row7 = vld1q_s16(data + 7*8);
02528 
02529    // add DC bias
02530    row0 = vaddq_s16(row0, vsetq_lane_s16(1024, vdupq_n_s16(0), 0));
02531 
02532    // column pass
02533    dct_pass(vrshrn_n_s32, 10);
02534 
02535    // 16bit 8x8 transpose
02536    {
02537 // these three map to a single VTRN.16, VTRN.32, and VSWP, respectively.
02538 // whether compilers actually get this is another story, sadly.
02539 #define dct_trn16(x, y) { int16x8x2_t t = vtrnq_s16(x, y); x = t.val[0]; y = t.val[1]; }
02540 #define dct_trn32(x, y) { int32x4x2_t t = vtrnq_s32(vreinterpretq_s32_s16(x), vreinterpretq_s32_s16(y)); x = vreinterpretq_s16_s32(t.val[0]); y = vreinterpretq_s16_s32(t.val[1]); }
02541 #define dct_trn64(x, y) { int16x8_t x0 = x; int16x8_t y0 = y; x = vcombine_s16(vget_low_s16(x0), vget_low_s16(y0)); y = vcombine_s16(vget_high_s16(x0), vget_high_s16(y0)); }
02542 
02543       // pass 1
02544       dct_trn16(row0, row1); // a0b0a2b2a4b4a6b6
02545       dct_trn16(row2, row3);
02546       dct_trn16(row4, row5);
02547       dct_trn16(row6, row7);
02548 
02549       // pass 2
02550       dct_trn32(row0, row2); // a0b0c0d0a4b4c4d4
02551       dct_trn32(row1, row3);
02552       dct_trn32(row4, row6);
02553       dct_trn32(row5, row7);
02554 
02555       // pass 3
02556       dct_trn64(row0, row4); // a0b0c0d0e0f0g0h0
02557       dct_trn64(row1, row5);
02558       dct_trn64(row2, row6);
02559       dct_trn64(row3, row7);
02560 
02561 #undef dct_trn16
02562 #undef dct_trn32
02563 #undef dct_trn64
02564    }
02565 
02566    // row pass
02567    // vrshrn_n_s32 only supports shifts up to 16, we need
02568    // 17. so do a non-rounding shift of 16 first then follow
02569    // up with a rounding shift by 1.
02570    dct_pass(vshrn_n_s32, 16);
02571 
02572    {
02573       // pack and round
02574       uint8x8_t p0 = vqrshrun_n_s16(row0, 1);
02575       uint8x8_t p1 = vqrshrun_n_s16(row1, 1);
02576       uint8x8_t p2 = vqrshrun_n_s16(row2, 1);
02577       uint8x8_t p3 = vqrshrun_n_s16(row3, 1);
02578       uint8x8_t p4 = vqrshrun_n_s16(row4, 1);
02579       uint8x8_t p5 = vqrshrun_n_s16(row5, 1);
02580       uint8x8_t p6 = vqrshrun_n_s16(row6, 1);
02581       uint8x8_t p7 = vqrshrun_n_s16(row7, 1);
02582 
02583       // again, these can translate into one instruction, but often don't.
02584 #define dct_trn8_8(x, y) { uint8x8x2_t t = vtrn_u8(x, y); x = t.val[0]; y = t.val[1]; }
02585 #define dct_trn8_16(x, y) { uint16x4x2_t t = vtrn_u16(vreinterpret_u16_u8(x), vreinterpret_u16_u8(y)); x = vreinterpret_u8_u16(t.val[0]); y = vreinterpret_u8_u16(t.val[1]); }
02586 #define dct_trn8_32(x, y) { uint32x2x2_t t = vtrn_u32(vreinterpret_u32_u8(x), vreinterpret_u32_u8(y)); x = vreinterpret_u8_u32(t.val[0]); y = vreinterpret_u8_u32(t.val[1]); }
02587 
02588       // sadly can't use interleaved stores here since we only write
02589       // 8 bytes to each scan line!
02590 
02591       // 8x8 8-bit transpose pass 1
02592       dct_trn8_8(p0, p1);
02593       dct_trn8_8(p2, p3);
02594       dct_trn8_8(p4, p5);
02595       dct_trn8_8(p6, p7);
02596 
02597       // pass 2
02598       dct_trn8_16(p0, p2);
02599       dct_trn8_16(p1, p3);
02600       dct_trn8_16(p4, p6);
02601       dct_trn8_16(p5, p7);
02602 
02603       // pass 3
02604       dct_trn8_32(p0, p4);
02605       dct_trn8_32(p1, p5);
