04236 
04237 // public domain "baseline" PNG decoder   v0.10  Sean Barrett 2006-11-18
04238 //    simple implementation
04239 //      - only 8-bit samples
04240 //      - no CRC checking
04241 //      - allocates lots of intermediate memory
04242 //        - avoids problem of streaming data between subsystems
04243 //        - avoids explicit window management
04244 //    performance
04245 //      - uses stb_zlib, a PD zlib implementation with fast huffman decoding
04246 
04247 #ifndef STBI_NO_PNG
04248 typedef struct
04249 {
04250    stbi__uint32 length;
04251    stbi__uint32 type;
04252 } stbi__pngchunk;
04253 
04254 static stbi__pngchunk stbi__get_chunk_header(stbi__context *s)
04255 {
04256    stbi__pngchunk c;
04257    c.length = stbi__get32be(s);
04258    c.type   = stbi__get32be(s);
04259    return c;
04260 }
04261 
04262 static int stbi__check_png_header(stbi__context *s)
04263 {
04264    static stbi_uc png_sig[8] = { 137,80,78,71,13,10,26,10 };
04265    int i;
04266    for (i=0; i < 8; ++i)
04267       if (stbi__get8(s) != png_sig[i]) return stbi__err("bad png sig","Not a PNG");
04268    return 1;
04269 }
04270 
04271 typedef struct
04272 {
04273    stbi__context *s;
04274    stbi_uc *idata, *expanded, *out;
04275    int depth;
04276 } stbi__png;
04277 
04278 
04279 enum {
04280    STBI__F_none=0,
04281    STBI__F_sub=1,
04282    STBI__F_up=2,
04283    STBI__F_avg=3,
04284    STBI__F_paeth=4,
04285    // synthetic filters used for first scanline to avoid needing a dummy row of 0s
04286    STBI__F_avg_first,
04287    STBI__F_paeth_first
04288 };
04289 
04290 static stbi_uc first_row_filter[5] =
04291 {
04292    STBI__F_none,
04293    STBI__F_sub,
04294    STBI__F_none,
04295    STBI__F_avg_first,
04296    STBI__F_paeth_first
04297 };
04298 
04299 static int stbi__paeth(int a, int b, int c)
04300 {
04301    int p = a + b - c;
04302    int pa = abs(p-a);
04303    int pb = abs(p-b);
04304    int pc = abs(p-c);
04305    if (pa <= pb && pa <= pc) return a;
04306    if (pb <= pc) return b;
04307    return c;
04308 }
04309 
04310 static stbi_uc stbi__depth_scale_table[9] = { 0, 0xff, 0x55, 0, 0x11, 0,0,0, 0x01 };
04311 
04312 // create the png data from post-deflated data
04313 static int stbi__create_png_image_raw(stbi__png *a, stbi_uc *raw, stbi__uint32 raw_len, int out_n, stbi__uint32 x, stbi__uint32 y, int depth, int color)
04314 {
04315    int bytes = (depth == 16? 2 : 1);
04316    stbi__context *s = a->s;
04317    stbi__uint32 i,j,stride = x*out_n*bytes;
04318    stbi__uint32 img_len, img_width_bytes;
04319    int k;
04320    int img_n = s->img_n; // copy it into a local for later
04321 
04322    int output_bytes = out_n*bytes;
04323    int filter_bytes = img_n*bytes;
04324    int width = x;
04325 
04326    STBI_ASSERT(out_n == s->img_n || out_n == s->img_n+1);
04327    a->out = (stbi_uc *) stbi__malloc_mad3(x, y, output_bytes, 0); // extra bytes to write off the end into
04328    if (!a->out) return stbi__err("outofmem", "Out of memory");
04329 
04330    img_width_bytes = (((img_n * x * depth) + 7) >> 3);
04331    img_len = (img_width_bytes + 1) * y;
04332    if (s->img_x == x && s->img_y == y) {
04333       if (raw_len != img_len) return stbi__err("not enough pixels","Corrupt PNG");
04334    } else { // interlaced:
04335       if (raw_len < img_len) return stbi__err("not enough pixels","Corrupt PNG");
04336    }
04337 
04338    for (j=0; j < y; ++j) {
04339       stbi_uc *cur = a->out + stride*j;
04340       stbi_uc *prior;
04341       int filter = *raw++;
04342 
04343       if (filter > 4)
04344          return stbi__err("invalid filter","Corrupt PNG");
04345 
04346       if (depth < 8) {
04347          STBI_ASSERT(img_width_bytes <= x);
04348          cur += x*out_n - img_width_bytes; // store output to the rightmost img_len bytes, so we can decode in place
04349          filter_bytes = 1;
04350          width = img_width_bytes;
04351       }
04352       prior = cur - stride; // bugfix: need to compute this after 'cur +=' computation above
04353 
04354       // if first row, use special filter that doesn't sample previous row
04355       if (j == 0) filter = first_row_filter[filter];
04356 
04357       // handle first byte explicitly
04358       for (k=0; k < filter_bytes; ++k) {
04359          switch (filter) {
04360             case STBI__F_none       : cur[k] = raw[k]; break;
04361             case STBI__F_sub        : cur[k] = raw[k]; break;
04362             case STBI__F_up         : cur[k] = STBI__BYTECAST(raw[k] + prior[k]); break;
04363             case STBI__F_avg        : cur[k] = STBI__BYTECAST(raw[k] + (prior[k]>>1)); break;
04364             case STBI__F_paeth      : cur[k] = STBI__BYTECAST(raw[k] + stbi__paeth(0,prior[k],0)); break;
04365             case STBI__F_avg_first  : cur[k] = raw[k]; break;
04366             case STBI__F_paeth_first: cur[k] = raw[k]; break;
04367          }
04368       }
04369 
04370       if (depth == 8) {
04371          if (img_n != out_n)
04372             cur[img_n] = 255; // first pixel
04373          raw += img_n;
04374          cur += out_n;
04375          prior += out_n;
04376       } else if (depth == 16) {
04377          if (img_n != out_n) {
04378             cur[filter_bytes]   = 255; // first pixel top byte
04379             cur[filter_bytes+1] = 255; // first pixel bottom byte
04380          }
04381          raw += filter_bytes;
04382          cur += output_bytes;
04383          prior += output_bytes;
04384       } else {
04385          raw += 1;
04386          cur += 1;
04387          prior += 1;
04388       }
04389 
04390       // this is a little gross, so that we don't switch per-pixel or per-component
04391       if (depth < 8 || img_n == out_n) {
04392          int nk = (width - 1)*filter_bytes;
04393          #define STBI__CASE(f) \
04394              case f:     \
04395                 for (k=0; k < nk; ++k)
04396          switch (filter) {
04397             // "none" filter turns into a memcpy here; make that explicit.
04398             case STBI__F_none:         memcpy(cur, raw, nk); break;
04399             STBI__CASE(STBI__F_sub)          { cur[k] = STBI__BYTECAST(raw[k] + cur[k-filter_bytes]); } break;
04400             STBI__CASE(STBI__F_up)           { cur[k] = STBI__BYTECAST(raw[k] + prior[k]); } break;
04401             STBI__CASE(STBI__F_avg)          { cur[k] = STBI__BYTECAST(raw[k] + ((prior[k] + cur[k-filter_bytes])>>1)); } break;
04402             STBI__CASE(STBI__F_paeth)        { cur[k] = STBI__BYTECAST(raw[k] + stbi__paeth(cur[k-filter_bytes],prior[k],prior[k-filter_bytes])); } break;
04403             STBI__CASE(STBI__F_avg_first)    { cur[k] = STBI__BYTECAST(raw[k] + (cur[k-filter_bytes] >> 1)); } break;
04404             STBI__CASE(STBI__F_paeth_first)  { cur[k] = STBI__BYTECAST(raw[k] + stbi__paeth(cur[k-filter_bytes],0,0)); } break;
04405          }
04406          #undef STBI__CASE
04407          raw += nk;
04408       } else {
04409          STBI_ASSERT(img_n+1 == out_n);
04410          #define STBI__CASE(f) \
04411              case f:     \
04412                 for (i=x-1; i >= 1; --i, cur[filter_bytes]=255,raw+=filter_bytes,cur+=output_bytes,prior+=output_bytes) \
04413                    for (k=0; k < filter_bytes; ++k)
04414          switch (filter) {
04415             STBI__CASE(STBI__F_none)         { cur[k] = raw[k]; } break;
04416             STBI__CASE(STBI__F_sub)          { cur[k] = STBI__BYTECAST(raw[k] + cur[k- output_bytes]); } break;
04417             STBI__CASE(STBI__F_up)           { cur[k] = STBI__BYTECAST(raw[k] + prior[k]); } break;
04418             STBI__CASE(STBI__F_avg)          { cur[k] = STBI__BYTECAST(raw[k] + ((prior[k] + cur[k- output_bytes])>>1)); } break;
04419             STBI__CASE(STBI__F_paeth)        { cur[k] = STBI__BYTECAST(raw[k] + stbi__paeth(cur[k- output_bytes],prior[k],prior[k- output_bytes])); } break;
04420             STBI__CASE(STBI__F_avg_first)    { cur[k] = STBI__BYTECAST(raw[k] + (cur[k- output_bytes] >> 1)); } break;
04421             STBI__CASE(STBI__F_paeth_first)  { cur[k] = STBI__BYTECAST(raw[k] + stbi__paeth(cur[k- output_bytes],0,0)); } break;
04422          }
04423          #undef STBI__CASE
04424 
04425          // the loop above sets the high byte of the pixels' alpha, but for
04426          // 16 bit png files we also need the low byte set. we'll do that here.
04427          if (depth == 16) {
04428             cur = a->out + stride*j; // start at the beginning of the row again
04429             for (i=0; i < x; ++i,cur+=output_bytes) {
04430                cur[filter_bytes+1] = 255;
04431             }
04432          }
04433       }
04434    }
04435 
04436    // we make a separate pass to expand bits to pixels; for performance,
04437    // this could run two scanlines behind the above code, so it won't
04438    // intefere with filtering but will still be in the cache.
04439    if (depth < 8) {
04440       for (j=0; j < y; ++j) {
04441          stbi_uc *cur = a->out + stride*j;
04442          stbi_uc *in  = a->out + stride*j + x*out_n - img_width_bytes;
04443          // unpack 1/2/4-bit into a 8-bit buffer. allows us to keep the common 8-bit path optimal at minimal cost for 1/2/4-bit
04444          // png guarante byte alignment, if width is not multiple of 8/4/2 we'll decode dummy trailing data that will be skipped in the later loop
04445          stbi_uc scale = (color == 0) ? stbi__depth_scale_table[depth] : 1; // scale grayscale values to 0..255 range
04446 
04447          // note that the final byte might overshoot and write more data than desired.
04448          // we can allocate enough data that this never writes out of memory, but it
04449          // could also overwrite the next scanline. can it overwrite non-empty data
04450          // on the next scanline? yes, consider 1-pixel-wide scanlines with 1-bit-per-pixel.
04451          // so we need to explicitly clamp the final ones
04452 
04453          if (depth == 4) {
04454             for (k=x*img_n; k >= 2; k-=2, ++in) {
04455                *cur++ = scale * ((*in >> 4)       );
04456                *cur++ = scale * ((*in     ) & 0x0f);
04457             }
04458             if (k > 0) *cur++ = scale * ((*in >> 4)       );
04459          } else if (depth == 2) {
04460             for (k=x*img_n; k >= 4; k-=4, ++in) {
04461                *cur++ = scale * ((*in >> 6)       );
04462                *cur++ = scale * ((*in >> 4) & 0x03);
04463                *cur++ = scale * ((*in >> 2) & 0x03);
04464                *cur++ = scale * ((*in     ) & 0x03);
04465             }
04466             if (k > 0) *cur++ = scale * ((*in >> 6)       );
04467             if (k > 1) *cur++ = scale * ((*in >> 4) & 0x03);
04468             if (k > 2) *cur++ = scale * ((*in >> 2) & 0x03);
04469          } else if (depth == 1) {
04470             for (k=x*img_n; k >= 8; k-=8, ++in) {
04471                *cur++ = scale * ((*in >> 7)       );
04472                *cur++ = scale * ((*in >> 6) & 0x01);
04473                *cur++ = scale * ((*in >> 5) & 0x01);
04474                *cur++ = scale * ((*in >> 4) & 0x01);
04475                *cur++ = scale * ((*in >> 3) & 0x01);
04476                *cur++ = scale * ((*in >> 2) & 0x01);
04477                *cur++ = scale * ((*in >> 1) & 0x01);
04478                *cur++ = scale * ((*in     ) & 0x01);
04479             }
04480             if (k > 0) *cur++ = scale * ((*in >> 7)       );
04481             if (k > 1) *cur++ = scale * ((*in >> 6) & 0x01);
04482             if (k > 2) *cur++ = scale * ((*in >> 5) & 0x01);
04483             if (k > 3) *cur++ = scale * ((*in >> 4) & 0x01);
04484             if (k > 4) *cur++ = scale * ((*in >> 3) & 0x01);
04485             if (k > 5) *cur++ = scale * ((*in >> 2) & 0x01);
04486             if (k > 6) *cur++ = scale * ((*in >> 1) & 0x01);
04487          }
04488          if (img_n != out_n) {
04489             int q;
04490             // insert alpha = 255
04491             cur = a->out + stride*j;
04492             if (img_n == 1) {
04493                for (q=x-1; q >= 0; --q) {
04494                   cur[q*2+1] = 255;
04495                   cur[q*2+0] = cur[q];
04496                }
04497             } else {
04498                STBI_ASSERT(img_n == 3);
04499                for (q=x-1; q >= 0; --q) {
04500                   cur[q*4+3] = 255;
04501                   cur[q*4+2] = cur[q*3+2];
04502                   cur[q*4+1] = cur[q*3+1];
04503                   cur[q*4+0] = cur[q*3+0];
04504                }
04505             }
04506          }
04507       }
04508    } else if (depth == 16) {
04509       // force the image data from big-endian to platform-native.
04510       // this is done in a separate pass due to the decoding relying
04511       // on the data being untouched, but could probably be done
04512       // per-line during decode if care is taken.
04513       stbi_uc *cur = a->out;
04514       stbi__uint16 *cur16 = (stbi__uint16*)cur;
04515 
04516       for(i=0; i < x*y*out_n; ++i,cur16++,cur+=2) {
04517          *cur16 = (cur[0] << 8) | cur[1];
04518       }
04519    }
04520 
04521    return 1;
04522 }
04523 
04524 static int stbi__create_png_image(stbi__png *a, stbi_uc *image_data, stbi__uint32 image_data_len, int out_n, int depth, int color, int interlaced)
04525 {
04526    int bytes = (depth == 16 ? 2 : 1);
04527    int out_bytes = out_n * bytes;
04528    stbi_uc *final;
04529    int p;
04530    if (!interlaced)
04531       return stbi__create_png_image_raw(a, image_data, image_data_len, out_n, a->s->img_x, a->s->img_y, depth, color);
04532 
04533    // de-interlacing
04534    final = (stbi_uc *) stbi__malloc_mad3(a->s->img_x, a->s->img_y, out_bytes, 0);
04535    for (p=0; p < 7; ++p) {
04536       int xorig[] = { 0,4,0,2,0,1,0 };
04537       int yorig[] = { 0,0,4,0,2,0,1 };
04538       int xspc[]  = { 8,8,4,4,2,2,1 };
04539       int yspc[]  = { 8,8,8,4,4,2,2 };
04540       int i,j,x,y;
04541       // pass1_x[4] = 0, pass1_x[5] = 1, pass1_x[12] = 1
04542       x = (a->s->img_x - xorig[p] + xspc[p]-1) / xspc[p];
04543       y = (a->s->img_y - yorig[p] + yspc[p]-1) / yspc[p];
04544       if (x && y) {
04545          stbi__uint32 img_len = ((((a->s->img_n * x * depth) + 7) >> 3) + 1) * y;
04546          if (!stbi__create_png_image_raw(a, image_data, image_data_len, out_n, x, y, depth, color)) {
04547             STBI_FREE(final);
04548             return 0;
04549          }
04550          for (j=0; j < y; ++j) {
04551             for (i=0; i < x; ++i) {
04552                int out_y = j*yspc[p]+yorig[p];
04553                int out_x = i*xspc[p]+xorig[p];
04554                memcpy(final + out_y*a->s->img_x*out_bytes + out_x*out_bytes,
04555                       a->out + (j*x+i)*out_bytes, out_bytes);
04556             }
04557          }
04558          STBI_FREE(a->out);
04559          image_data += img_len;
04560          image_data_len -= img_len;
04561       }
04562    }
04563    a->out = final;
04564 
04565    return 1;
04566 }
04567 
04568 static int stbi__compute_transparency(stbi__png *z, stbi_uc tc[3], int out_n)
04569 {
04570    stbi__context *s = z->s;
04571    stbi__uint32 i, pixel_count = s->img_x * s->img_y;
04572    stbi_uc *p = z->out;
04573 
04574    // compute color-based transparency, assuming we've
04575    // already got 255 as the alpha value in the output
04576    STBI_ASSERT(out_n == 2 || out_n == 4);
04577 
04578    if (out_n == 2) {
04579       for (i=0; i < pixel_count; ++i) {
04580          p[1] = (p[0] == tc[0] ? 0 : 255);
04581          p += 2;
04582       }
04583    } else {
04584       for (i=0; i < pixel_count; ++i) {
04585          if (p[0] == tc[0] && p[1] == tc[1] && p[2] == tc[2])
04586             p[3] = 0;
04587          p += 4;
04588       }
04589    }
04590    return 1;
04591 }
04592 
04593 static int stbi__compute_transparency16(stbi__png *z, stbi__uint16 tc[3], int out_n)
04594 {
04595    stbi__context *s = z->s;
04596    stbi__uint32 i, pixel_count = s->img_x * s->img_y;
04597    stbi__uint16 *p = (stbi__uint16*) z->out;
04598 
04599    // compute color-based transparency, assuming we've
04600    // already got 65535 as the alpha value in the output
04601    STBI_ASSERT(out_n == 2 || out_n == 4);
04602 
04603    if (out_n == 2) {
04604       for (i = 0; i < pixel_count; ++i) {
04605          p[1] = (p[0] == tc[0] ? 0 : 65535);
04606          p += 2;
04607       }
04608    } else {
04609       for (i = 0; i < pixel_count; ++i) {
04610          if (p[0] == tc[0] && p[1] == tc[1] && p[2] == tc[2])
04611             p[3] = 0;
04612          p += 4;
04613       }
04614    }
04615    return 1;
04616 }
04617 
04618 static int stbi__expand_png_palette(stbi__png *a, stbi_uc *palette, int len, int pal_img_n)
04619 {
04620    stbi__uint32 i, pixel_count = a->s->img_x * a->s->img_y;
04621    stbi_uc *p, *temp_out, *orig = a->out;
04622 
04623    p = (stbi_uc *) stbi__malloc_mad2(pixel_count, pal_img_n, 0);
04624    if (p == NULL) return stbi__err("outofmem", "Out of memory");
04625 
04626    // between here and free(out) below, exitting would leak
04627    temp_out = p;
04628 
04629    if (pal_img_n == 3) {
04630       for (i=0; i < pixel_count; ++i) {
04631          int n = orig[i]*4;
04632          p[0] = palette[n  ];
04633          p[1] = palette[n+1];
04634          p[2] = palette[n+2];
04635          p += 3;
04636       }
04637    } else {
04638       for (i=0; i < pixel_count; ++i) {
04639          int n = orig[i]*4;
04640          p[0] = palette[n  ];
04641          p[1] = palette[n+1];
04642          p[2] = palette[n+2];
04643          p[3] = palette[n+3];
04644          p += 4;
04645       }
04646    }
04647    STBI_FREE(a->out);
04648    a->out = temp_out;
04649 
04650    STBI_NOTUSED(len);
04651 
04652    return 1;
04653 }
04654 
04655 static int stbi__unpremultiply_on_load = 0;
04656 static int stbi__de_iphone_flag = 0;
04657 
04658 STBIDEF void stbi_set_unpremultiply_on_load(int flag_true_if_should_unpremultiply)
04659 {
04660    stbi__unpremultiply_on_load = flag_true_if_should_unpremultiply;
04661 }
04662 
04663 STBIDEF void stbi_convert_iphone_png_to_rgb(int flag_true_if_should_convert)
04664 {
04665    stbi__de_iphone_flag = flag_true_if_should_convert;
04666 }
04667 
04668 static void stbi__de_iphone(stbi__png *z)
04669 {
04670    stbi__context *s = z->s;
04671    stbi__uint32 i, pixel_count = s->img_x * s->img_y;
04672    stbi_uc *p = z->out;
04673 
04674    if (s->img_out_n == 3) {  // convert bgr to rgb
04675       for (i=0; i < pixel_count; ++i) {
04676          stbi_uc t = p[0];
04677          p[0] = p[2];
04678          p[2] = t;
04679          p += 3;
04680       }
04681    } else {
04682       STBI_ASSERT(s->img_out_n == 4);
04683       if (stbi__unpremultiply_on_load) {
04684          // convert bgr to rgb and unpremultiply
04685          for (i=0; i < pixel_count; ++i) {
04686             stbi_uc a = p[3];
04687             stbi_uc t = p[0];
04688             if (a) {
04689                p[0] = p[2] * 255 / a;
04690                p[1] = p[1] * 255 / a;
04691                p[2] =  t   * 255 / a;
04692             } else {
04693                p[0] = p[2];
04694                p[2] = t;
04695             }
04696             p += 4;
04697          }
04698       } else {
04699          // convert bgr to rgb
04700          for (i=0; i < pixel_count; ++i) {
04701             stbi_uc t = p[0];
04702             p[0] = p[2];
04703             p[2] = t;
04704             p += 4;
04705          }
04706       }
04707    }
04708 }
04709 
04710 #define STBI__PNG_TYPE(a,b,c,d)  (((a) << 24) + ((b) << 16) + ((c) << 8) + (d))
04711 
04712 static int stbi__parse_png_file(stbi__png *z, int scan, int req_comp)
04713 {
04714    stbi_uc palette[1024], pal_img_n=0;
04715    stbi_uc has_trans=0, tc[3];
04716    stbi__uint16 tc16[3];
04717    stbi__uint32 ioff=0, idata_limit=0, i, pal_len=0;
04718    int first=1,k,interlace=0, color=0, is_iphone=0;
04719    stbi__context *s = z->s;
04720 
04721    z->expanded = NULL;
04722    z->idata = NULL;
04723    z->out = NULL;
04724 
04725    if (!stbi__check_png_header(s)) return 0;
04726 
04727    if (scan == STBI__SCAN_type) return 1;
04728 
04729    for (;;) {
04730       stbi__pngchunk c = stbi__get_chunk_header(s);
04731       switch (c.type) {
04732          case STBI__PNG_TYPE('C','g','B','I'):
04733             is_iphone = 1;
04734             stbi__skip(s, c.length);
04735             break;
04736          case STBI__PNG_TYPE('I','H','D','R'): {
04737             int comp,filter;
04738             if (!first) return stbi__err("multiple IHDR","Corrupt PNG");
04739             first = 0;
04740             if (c.length != 13) return stbi__err("bad IHDR len","Corrupt PNG");
04741             s->img_x = stbi__get32be(s); if (s->img_x > (1 << 24)) return stbi__err("too large","Very large image (corrupt?)");
04742             s->img_y = stbi__get32be(s); if (s->img_y > (1 << 24)) return stbi__err("too large","Very large image (corrupt?)");
04743             z->depth = stbi__get8(s);  if (z->depth != 1 && z->depth != 2 && z->depth != 4 && z->depth != 8 && z->depth != 16)  return stbi__err("1/2/4/8/16-bit only","PNG not supported: 1/2/4/8/16-bit only");
04744             color = stbi__get8(s);  if (color > 6)         return stbi__err("bad ctype","Corrupt PNG");
04745             if (color == 3 && z->depth == 16)                  return stbi__err("bad ctype","Corrupt PNG");
04746             if (color == 3) pal_img_n = 3; else if (color & 1) return stbi__err("bad ctype","Corrupt PNG");
04747             comp  = stbi__get8(s);  if (comp) return stbi__err("bad comp method","Corrupt PNG");
04748             filter= stbi__get8(s);  if (filter) return stbi__err("bad filter method","Corrupt PNG");
04749             interlace = stbi__get8(s); if (interlace>1) return stbi__err("bad interlace method","Corrupt PNG");
04750             if (!s->img_x || !s->img_y) return stbi__err("0-pixel image","Corrupt PNG");
04751             if (!pal_img_n) {
04752                s->img_n = (color & 2 ? 3 : 1) + (color & 4 ? 1 : 0);
04753                if ((1 << 30) / s->img_x / s->img_n < s->img_y) return stbi__err("too large", "Image too large to decode");
04754                if (scan == STBI__SCAN_header) return 1;
04755             } else {
04756                // if paletted, then pal_n is our final components, and
04757                // img_n is # components to decompress/filter.
04758                s->img_n = 1;
04759                if ((1 << 30) / s->img_x / 4 < s->img_y) return stbi__err("too large","Corrupt PNG");
04760                // if SCAN_header, have to scan to see if we have a tRNS
04761             }
04762             break;
04763          }
04764 
04765          case STBI__PNG_TYPE('P','L','T','E'):  {
04766             if (first) return stbi__err("first not IHDR", "Corrupt PNG");
04767             if (c.length > 256*3) return stbi__err("invalid PLTE","Corrupt PNG");
04768             pal_len = c.length / 3;
04769             if (pal_len * 3 != c.length) return stbi__err("invalid PLTE","Corrupt PNG");
04770             for (i=0; i < pal_len; ++i) {
04771                palette[i*4+0] = stbi__get8(s);
04772                palette[i*4+1] = stbi__get8(s);
04773                palette[i*4+2] = stbi__get8(s);
04774                palette[i*4+3] = 255;
04775             }
04776             break;
04777          }
04778 
04779          case STBI__PNG_TYPE('t','R','N','S'): {
04780             if (first) return stbi__err("first not IHDR", "Corrupt PNG");
04781             if (z->idata) return stbi__err("tRNS after IDAT","Corrupt PNG");
04782             if (pal_img_n) {
04783                if (scan == STBI__SCAN_header) { s->img_n = 4; return 1; }
04784                if (pal_len == 0) return stbi__err("tRNS before PLTE","Corrupt PNG");
04785                if (c.length > pal_len) return stbi__err("bad tRNS len","Corrupt PNG");
04786                pal_img_n = 4;
04787                for (i=0; i < c.length; ++i)
04788                   palette[i*4+3] = stbi__get8(s);
04789             } else {
04790                if (!(s->img_n & 1)) return stbi__err("tRNS with alpha","Corrupt PNG");
04791                if (c.length != (stbi__uint32) s->img_n*2) return stbi__err("bad tRNS len","Corrupt PNG");
04792                has_trans = 1;
04793                if (z->depth == 16) {
04794                   for (k = 0; k < s->img_n; ++k) tc16[k] = (stbi__uint16)stbi__get16be(s); // copy the values as-is
04795                } else {
04796                   for (k = 0; k < s->img_n; ++k) tc[k] = (stbi_uc)(stbi__get16be(s) & 255) * stbi__depth_scale_table[z->depth]; // non 8-bit images will be larger
04797                }
04798             }
04799             break;
04800          }
04801 
04802          case STBI__PNG_TYPE('I','D','A','T'): {
04803             if (first) return stbi__err("first not IHDR", "Corrupt PNG");
04804             if (pal_img_n && !pal_len) return stbi__err("no PLTE","Corrupt PNG");
04805             if (scan == STBI__SCAN_header) { s->img_n = pal_img_n; return 1; }
04806             if ((int)(ioff + c.length) < (int)ioff) return 0;
04807             if (ioff + c.length > idata_limit) {
04808                stbi__uint32 idata_limit_old = idata_limit;
04809                stbi_uc *p;
04810                if (idata_limit == 0) idata_limit = c.length > 4096 ? c.length : 4096;
04811                while (ioff + c.length > idata_limit)
04812                   idata_limit *= 2;
04813                STBI_NOTUSED(idata_limit_old);
04814                p = (stbi_uc *) STBI_REALLOC_SIZED(z->idata, idata_limit_old, idata_limit); if (p == NULL) return stbi__err("outofmem", "Out of memory");
04815                z->idata = p;
04816             }
04817             if (!stbi__getn(s, z->idata+ioff,c.length)) return stbi__err("outofdata","Corrupt PNG");
04818             ioff += c.length;
04819             break;
04820          }
04821 
04822          case STBI__PNG_TYPE('I','E','N','D'): {
04823             stbi__uint32 raw_len, bpl;
04824             if (first) return stbi__err("first not IHDR", "Corrupt PNG");
04825             if (scan != STBI__SCAN_load) return 1;
04826             if (z->idata == NULL) return stbi__err("no IDAT","Corrupt PNG");
04827             // initial guess for decoded data size to avoid unnecessary reallocs
04828             bpl = (s->img_x * z->depth + 7) / 8; // bytes per line, per component
04829             raw_len = bpl * s->img_y * s->img_n /* pixels */ + s->img_y /* filter mode per row */;
04830             z->expanded = (stbi_uc *) stbi_zlib_decode_malloc_guesssize_headerflag((char *) z->idata, ioff, raw_len, (int *) &raw_len, !is_iphone);
04831             if (z->expanded == NULL) return 0; // zlib should set error
04832             STBI_FREE(z->idata); z->idata = NULL;
04833             if ((req_comp == s->img_n+1 && req_comp != 3 && !pal_img_n) || has_trans)
04834                s->img_out_n = s->img_n+1;
04835             else
04836                s->img_out_n = s->img_n;
04837             if (!stbi__create_png_image(z, z->expanded, raw_len, s->img_out_n, z->depth, color, interlace)) return 0;
04838             if (has_trans) {
04839                if (z->depth == 16) {
04840                   if (!stbi__compute_transparency16(z, tc16, s->img_out_n)) return 0;
04841                } else {
04842                   if (!stbi__compute_transparency(z, tc, s->img_out_n)) return 0;
04843                }
04844             }
04845             if (is_iphone && stbi__de_iphone_flag && s->img_out_n > 2)
04846                stbi__de_iphone(z);
04847             if (pal_img_n) {
04848                // pal_img_n == 3 or 4
04849                s->img_n = pal_img_n; // record the actual colors we had
04850                s->img_out_n = pal_img_n;
04851                if (req_comp >= 3) s->img_out_n = req_comp;
04852                if (!stbi__expand_png_palette(z, palette, pal_len, s->img_out_n))
04853                   return 0;
04854             }
04855             STBI_FREE(z->expanded); z->expanded = NULL;
04856             return 1;
04857          }
04858 
04859          default:
04860             // if critical, fail
04861             if (first) return stbi__err("first not IHDR", "Corrupt PNG");
04862             if ((c.type & (1 << 29)) == 0) {
04863                #ifndef STBI_NO_FAILURE_STRINGS
04864                // not threadsafe
04865                static char invalid_chunk[] = "XXXX PNG chunk not known";
04866                invalid_chunk[0] = STBI__BYTECAST(c.type >> 24);
04867                invalid_chunk[1] = STBI__BYTECAST(c.type >> 16);
04868                invalid_chunk[2] = STBI__BYTECAST(c.type >>  8);
04869                invalid_chunk[3] = STBI__BYTECAST(c.type >>  0);
04870                #endif
04871                return stbi__err(invalid_chunk, "PNG not supported: unknown PNG chunk type");
04872             }
04873             stbi__skip(s, c.length);
04874             break;
04875       }
04876       // end of PNG chunk, read and skip CRC
04877       stbi__get32be(s);
04878    }
04879 }
04880 
04881 static void *stbi__do_png(stbi__png *p, int *x, int *y, int *n, int req_comp, stbi__result_info *ri)
04882 {
04883    void *result=NULL;
04884    if (req_comp < 0 || req_comp > 4) return stbi__errpuc("bad req_comp", "Internal error");
04885    if (stbi__parse_png_file(p, STBI__SCAN_load, req_comp)) {
04886       if (p->depth < 8)
04887          ri->bits_per_channel = 8;
04888       else
04889          ri->bits_per_channel = p->depth;
04890       result = p->out;
04891       p->out = NULL;
04892       if (req_comp && req_comp != p->s->img_out_n) {
04893          if (ri->bits_per_channel == 8)
04894             result = stbi__convert_format((unsigned char *) result, p->s->img_out_n, req_comp, p->s->img_x, p->s->img_y);
04895          else
04896             result = stbi__convert_format16((stbi__uint16 *) result, p->s->img_out_n, req_comp, p->s->img_x, p->s->img_y);
04897          p->s->img_out_n = req_comp;
04898          if (result == NULL) return result;
04899       }
04900       *x = p->s->img_x;
04901       *y = p->s->img_y;
04902       if (n) *n = p->s->img_n;
04903    }
04904    STBI_FREE(p->out);      p->out      = NULL;
04905    STBI_FREE(p->expanded); p->expanded = NULL;
04906    STBI_FREE(p->idata);    p->idata    = NULL;
04907 
04908    return result;
04909 }
04910 
04911 static void *stbi__png_load(stbi__context *s, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp, stbi__result_info *ri)
04912 {
04913    stbi__png p;
04914    p.s = s;
04915    return stbi__do_png(&p, x,y,comp,req_comp, ri);
04916 }

04929       stbi__rewind( p->s );
04930       return 0;
04931    }
04932    if (x) *x = p->s->img_x;
04933    if (y) *y = p->s->img_y;
04934    if (comp) *comp = p->s->img_n;
04935    return 1;
04936 }

04948 #ifndef STBI_NO_BMP
04949 static int stbi__bmp_test_raw(stbi__context *s)
04950 {
04951    int r;
04952    int sz;
04953    if (stbi__get8(s) != 'B') return 0;
04954    if (stbi__get8(s) != 'M') return 0;
04955    stbi__get32le(s); // discard filesize
04956    stbi__get16le(s); // discard reserved
04957    stbi__get16le(s); // discard reserved
04958    stbi__get32le(s); // discard data offset
04959    sz = stbi__get32le(s);
04960    r = (sz == 12 || sz == 40 || sz == 56 || sz == 108 || sz == 124);
04961    return r;
04962 }

04970 
04971 
04972 // returns 0..31 for the highest set bit
04973 static int stbi__high_bit(unsigned int z)
04974 {
04975    int n=0;
04976    if (z == 0) return -1;
04977    if (z >= 0x10000) n += 16, z >>= 16;
04978    if (z >= 0x00100) n +=  8, z >>=  8;
04979    if (z >= 0x00010) n +=  4, z >>=  4;
04980    if (z >= 0x00004) n +=  2, z >>=  2;
04981    if (z >= 0x00002) n +=  1, z >>=  1;
04982    return n;
04983 }
04984 
04985 static int stbi__bitcount(unsigned int a)
04986 {
04987    a = (a & 0x55555555) + ((a >>  1) & 0x55555555); // max 2
04988    a = (a & 0x33333333) + ((a >>  2) & 0x33333333); // max 4
04989    a = (a + (a >> 4)) & 0x0f0f0f0f; // max 8 per 4, now 8 bits
04990    a = (a + (a >> 8)); // max 16 per 8 bits
04991    a = (a + (a >> 16)); // max 32 per 8 bits
04992    return a & 0xff;
04993 }
04994 
04995 static int stbi__shiftsigned(int v, int shift, int bits)
04996 {
04997    int result;
04998    int z=0;
04999 
05000    if (shift < 0) v <<= -shift;
05001    else v >>= shift;
05002    result = v;
05003 
05004    z = bits;
05005    while (z < 8) {
05006       result += v >> z;
05007       z += bits;
05008    }
05009    return result;
05010 }
05011 
05012 typedef struct
05013 {
05014    int bpp, offset, hsz;
05015    unsigned int mr,mg,mb,ma, all_a;
05016 } stbi__bmp_data;
05017 
05018 static void *stbi__bmp_parse_header(stbi__context *s, stbi__bmp_data *info)
05019 {
05020    int hsz;
05021    if (stbi__get8(s) != 'B' || stbi__get8(s) != 'M') return stbi__errpuc("not BMP", "Corrupt BMP");
05022    stbi__get32le(s); // discard filesize
05023    stbi__get16le(s); // discard reserved
05024    stbi__get16le(s); // discard reserved
05025    info->offset = stbi__get32le(s);
05026    info->hsz = hsz = stbi__get32le(s);
05027    info->mr = info->mg = info->mb = info->ma = 0;
05028 
05029    if (hsz != 12 && hsz != 40 && hsz != 56 && hsz != 108 && hsz != 124) return stbi__errpuc("unknown BMP", "BMP type not supported: unknown");
05030    if (hsz == 12) {
05031       s->img_x = stbi__get16le(s);
05032       s->img_y = stbi__get16le(s);
05033    } else {
05034       s->img_x = stbi__get32le(s);
05035       s->img_y = stbi__get32le(s);
05036    }
05037    if (stbi__get16le(s) != 1) return stbi__errpuc("bad BMP", "bad BMP");
05038    info->bpp = stbi__get16le(s);
05039    if (info->bpp == 1) return stbi__errpuc("monochrome", "BMP type not supported: 1-bit");
05040    if (hsz != 12) {
05041       int compress = stbi__get32le(s);
05042       if (compress == 1 || compress == 2) return stbi__errpuc("BMP RLE", "BMP type not supported: RLE");
05043       stbi__get32le(s); // discard sizeof
05044       stbi__get32le(s); // discard hres
05045       stbi__get32le(s); // discard vres
05046       stbi__get32le(s); // discard colorsused
05047       stbi__get32le(s); // discard max important
05048       if (hsz == 40 || hsz == 56) {
05049          if (hsz == 56) {
05050             stbi__get32le(s);
05051             stbi__get32le(s);
05052             stbi__get32le(s);
05053             stbi__get32le(s);
05054          }
05055          if (info->bpp == 16 || info->bpp == 32) {
05056             if (compress == 0) {
05057                if (info->bpp == 32) {
05058                   info->mr = 0xffu << 16;
05059                   info->mg = 0xffu <<  8;
05060                   info->mb = 0xffu <<  0;
05061                   info->ma = 0xffu << 24;
05062                   info->all_a = 0; // if all_a is 0 at end, then we loaded alpha channel but it was all 0
05063                } else {
05064                   info->mr = 31u << 10;
05065                   info->mg = 31u <<  5;
05066                   info->mb = 31u <<  0;
05067                }
05068             } else if (compress == 3) {
05069                info->mr = stbi__get32le(s);
05070                info->mg = stbi__get32le(s);
05071                info->mb = stbi__get32le(s);
05072                // not documented, but generated by photoshop and handled by mspaint
05073                if (info->mr == info->mg && info->mg == info->mb) {
05074                   // ?!?!?
05075                   return stbi__errpuc("bad BMP", "bad BMP");
05076                }
05077             } else
05078                return stbi__errpuc("bad BMP", "bad BMP");
05079          }
05080       } else {
05081          int i;
05082          if (hsz != 108 && hsz != 124)
05083             return stbi__errpuc("bad BMP", "bad BMP");
05084          info->mr = stbi__get32le(s);
05085          info->mg = stbi__get32le(s);
05086          info->mb = stbi__get32le(s);
05087          info->ma = stbi__get32le(s);
05088          stbi__get32le(s); // discard color space
05089          for (i=0; i < 12; ++i)
05090             stbi__get32le(s); // discard color space parameters
05091          if (hsz == 124) {
05092             stbi__get32le(s); // discard rendering intent
05093             stbi__get32le(s); // discard offset of profile data
05094             stbi__get32le(s); // discard size of profile data
05095             stbi__get32le(s); // discard reserved
05096          }
05097       }
05098    }
05099    return (void *) 1;
05100 }
05101 
05102 
05103 static void *stbi__bmp_load(stbi__context *s, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp, stbi__result_info *ri)
05104 {
05105    stbi_uc *out;
05106    unsigned int mr=0,mg=0,mb=0,ma=0, all_a;
05107    stbi_uc pal[256][4];
05108    int psize=0,i,j,width;
05109    int flip_vertically, pad, target;
05110    stbi__bmp_data info;
05111    STBI_NOTUSED(ri);
05112 
05113    info.all_a = 255;
05114    if (stbi__bmp_parse_header(s, &info) == NULL)
05115       return NULL; // error code already set
05116 
05117    flip_vertically = ((int) s->img_y) > 0;
05118    s->img_y = abs((int) s->img_y);
05119 
05120    mr = info.mr;
05121    mg = info.mg;
05122    mb = info.mb;
05123    ma = info.ma;
05124    all_a = info.all_a;
05125 
05126    if (info.hsz == 12) {
05127       if (info.bpp < 24)
05128          psize = (info.offset - 14 - 24) / 3;
05129    } else {
05130       if (info.bpp < 16)
05131          psize = (info.offset - 14 - info.hsz) >> 2;
05132    }
05133 
05134    s->img_n = ma ? 4 : 3;
05135    if (req_comp && req_comp >= 3) // we can directly decode 3 or 4
05136       target = req_comp;
05137    else
05138       target = s->img_n; // if they want monochrome, we'll post-convert
05139 
05140    // sanity-check size
05141    if (!stbi__mad3sizes_valid(target, s->img_x, s->img_y, 0))
05142       return stbi__errpuc("too large", "Corrupt BMP");
05143 
05144    out = (stbi_uc *) stbi__malloc_mad3(target, s->img_x, s->img_y, 0);
05145    if (!out) return stbi__errpuc("outofmem", "Out of memory");
05146    if (info.bpp < 16) {
05147       int z=0;
05148       if (psize == 0 || psize > 256) { STBI_FREE(out); return stbi__errpuc("invalid", "Corrupt BMP"); }
05149       for (i=0; i < psize; ++i) {
05150          pal[i][2] = stbi__get8(s);
05151          pal[i][1] = stbi__get8(s);
05152          pal[i][0] = stbi__get8(s);
05153          if (info.hsz != 12) stbi__get8(s);
05154          pal[i][3] = 255;
05155       }
05156       stbi__skip(s, info.offset - 14 - info.hsz - psize * (info.hsz == 12 ? 3 : 4));
05157       if (info.bpp == 4) width = (s->img_x + 1) >> 1;
05158       else if (info.bpp == 8) width = s->img_x;
05159       else { STBI_FREE(out); return stbi__errpuc("bad bpp", "Corrupt BMP"); }
05160       pad = (-width)&3;
05161       for (j=0; j < (int) s->img_y; ++j) {
05162          for (i=0; i < (int) s->img_x; i += 2) {
05163             int v=stbi__get8(s),v2=0;
05164             if (info.bpp == 4) {
05165                v2 = v & 15;
05166                v >>= 4;
05167             }
05168             out[z++] = pal[v][0];
05169             out[z++] = pal[v][1];
05170             out[z++] = pal[v][2];
05171             if (target == 4) out[z++] = 255;
05172             if (i+1 == (int) s->img_x) break;
05173             v = (info.bpp == 8) ? stbi__get8(s) : v2;
05174             out[z++] = pal[v][0];
05175             out[z++] = pal[v][1];
05176             out[z++] = pal[v][2];
05177             if (target == 4) out[z++] = 255;
05178          }
05179          stbi__skip(s, pad);
05180       }
05181    } else {
05182       int rshift=0,gshift=0,bshift=0,ashift=0,rcount=0,gcount=0,bcount=0,acount=0;
05183       int z = 0;
05184       int easy=0;
05185       stbi__skip(s, info.offset - 14 - info.hsz);
05186       if (info.bpp == 24) width = 3 * s->img_x;
05187       else if (info.bpp == 16) width = 2*s->img_x;
05188       else /* bpp = 32 and pad = 0 */ width=0;
05189       pad = (-width) & 3;
05190       if (info.bpp == 24) {
05191          easy = 1;
05192       } else if (info.bpp == 32) {
05193          if (mb == 0xff && mg == 0xff00 && mr == 0x00ff0000 && ma == 0xff000000)
05194             easy = 2;
05195       }
05196       if (!easy) {
05197          if (!mr || !mg || !mb) { STBI_FREE(out); return stbi__errpuc("bad masks", "Corrupt BMP"); }
05198          // right shift amt to put high bit in position #7
05199          rshift = stbi__high_bit(mr)-7; rcount = stbi__bitcount(mr);
05200          gshift = stbi__high_bit(mg)-7; gcount = stbi__bitcount(mg);
05201          bshift = stbi__high_bit(mb)-7; bcount = stbi__bitcount(mb);
05202          ashift = stbi__high_bit(ma)-7; acount = stbi__bitcount(ma);
05203       }
05204       for (j=0; j < (int) s->img_y; ++j) {
05205          if (easy) {
05206             for (i=0; i < (int) s->img_x; ++i) {
05207                unsigned char a;
05208                out[z+2] = stbi__get8(s);
05209                out[z+1] = stbi__get8(s);
05210                out[z+0] = stbi__get8(s);
05211                z += 3;
05212                a = (easy == 2 ? stbi__get8(s) : 255);
05213                all_a |= a;
05214                if (target == 4) out[z++] = a;
05215             }
05216          } else {
05217             int bpp = info.bpp;
05218             for (i=0; i < (int) s->img_x; ++i) {
05219                stbi__uint32 v = (bpp == 16 ? (stbi__uint32) stbi__get16le(s) : stbi__get32le(s));
05220                int a;
05221                out[z++] = STBI__BYTECAST(stbi__shiftsigned(v & mr, rshift, rcount));
05222                out[z++] = STBI__BYTECAST(stbi__shiftsigned(v & mg, gshift, gcount));
05223                out[z++] = STBI__BYTECAST(stbi__shiftsigned(v & mb, bshift, bcount));
05224                a = (ma ? stbi__shiftsigned(v & ma, ashift, acount) : 255);
05225                all_a |= a;
05226                if (target == 4) out[z++] = STBI__BYTECAST(a);
05227             }
05228          }
05229          stbi__skip(s, pad);
05230       }
05231    }
05232 
05233    // if alpha channel is all 0s, replace with all 255s
05234    if (target == 4 && all_a == 0)
05235       for (i=4*s->img_x*s->img_y-1; i >= 0; i -= 4)
05236          out[i] = 255;
05237 
05238    if (flip_vertically) {
05239       stbi_uc t;
05240       for (j=0; j < (int) s->img_y>>1; ++j) {
05241          stbi_uc *p1 = out +      j     *s->img_x*target;
05242          stbi_uc *p2 = out + (s->img_y-1-j)*s->img_x*target;
05243          for (i=0; i < (int) s->img_x*target; ++i) {
05244             t = p1[i], p1[i] = p2[i], p2[i] = t;
05245          }
05246       }
05247    }
05248 
05249    if (req_comp && req_comp != target) {
05250       out = stbi__convert_format(out, target, req_comp, s->img_x, s->img_y);
05251       if (out == NULL) return out; // stbi__convert_format frees input on failure
05252    }
05253 
05254    *x = s->img_x;
05255    *y = s->img_y;
05256    if (comp) *comp = s->img_n;
05257    return out;
05258 }
05259 #endif
05260 
05261 // Targa Truevision - TGA
05262 // by Jonathan Dummer
05263 #ifndef STBI_NO_TGA
05264 // returns STBI_rgb or whatever, 0 on error
05265 static int stbi__tga_get_comp(int bits_per_pixel, int is_grey, int* is_rgb16)
05266 {
05267    // only RGB or RGBA (incl. 16bit) or grey allowed
05268    if(is_rgb16) *is_rgb16 = 0;
05269    switch(bits_per_pixel) {
05270       case 8:  return STBI_grey;
05271       case 16: if(is_grey) return STBI_grey_alpha;
05272             // else: fall-through
05273       case 15: if(is_rgb16) *is_rgb16 = 1;
05274             return STBI_rgb;
05275       case 24: // fall-through
05276       case 32: return bits_per_pixel/8;
05277       default: return 0;
05278    }
05279 }
05280 
05281 static int stbi__tga_info(stbi__context *s, int *x, int *y, int *comp)
05282 {
05283     int tga_w, tga_h, tga_comp, tga_image_type, tga_bits_per_pixel, tga_colormap_bpp;
05284     int sz, tga_colormap_type;
05285     stbi__get8(s);                   // discard Offset
05286     tga_colormap_type = stbi__get8(s); // colormap type
05287     if( tga_colormap_type > 1 ) {
05288         stbi__rewind(s);
05289         return 0;      // only RGB or indexed allowed
05290     }
05291     tga_image_type = stbi__get8(s); // image type
05292     if ( tga_colormap_type == 1 ) { // colormapped (paletted) image
05293         if (tga_image_type != 1 && tga_image_type != 9) {
05294             stbi__rewind(s);
05295             return 0;
05296         }
05297         stbi__skip(s,4);       // skip index of first colormap entry and number of entries
05298         sz = stbi__get8(s);    //   check bits per palette color entry
05299         if ( (sz != 8) && (sz != 15) && (sz != 16) && (sz != 24) && (sz != 32) ) {
05300             stbi__rewind(s);
05301             return 0;
05302         }
05303         stbi__skip(s,4);       // skip image x and y origin
05304         tga_colormap_bpp = sz;
05305     } else { // "normal" image w/o colormap - only RGB or grey allowed, +/- RLE
05306         if ( (tga_image_type != 2) && (tga_image_type != 3) && (tga_image_type != 10) && (tga_image_type != 11) ) {
05307             stbi__rewind(s);
05308             return 0; // only RGB or grey allowed, +/- RLE
05309         }
05310         stbi__skip(s,9); // skip colormap specification and image x/y origin
05311         tga_colormap_bpp = 0;
05312     }
05313     tga_w = stbi__get16le(s);
05314     if( tga_w < 1 ) {
05315         stbi__rewind(s);
05316         return 0;   // test width
05317     }
05318     tga_h = stbi__get16le(s);
05319     if( tga_h < 1 ) {
05320         stbi__rewind(s);
05321         return 0;   // test height
05322     }
05323     tga_bits_per_pixel = stbi__get8(s); // bits per pixel
05324     stbi__get8(s); // ignore alpha bits
05325     if (tga_colormap_bpp != 0) {
05326         if((tga_bits_per_pixel != 8) && (tga_bits_per_pixel != 16)) {
05327             // when using a colormap, tga_bits_per_pixel is the size of the indexes
05328             // I don't think anything but 8 or 16bit indexes makes sense
05329             stbi__rewind(s);
05330             return 0;
05331         }
05332         tga_comp = stbi__tga_get_comp(tga_colormap_bpp, 0, NULL);
05333     } else {
05334         tga_comp = stbi__tga_get_comp(tga_bits_per_pixel, (tga_image_type == 3) || (tga_image_type == 11), NULL);
05335     }
05336     if(!tga_comp) {
05337       stbi__rewind(s);
05338       return 0;
05339     }
05340     if (x) *x = tga_w;
05341     if (y) *y = tga_h;
05342     if (comp) *comp = tga_comp;
05343     return 1;                   // seems to have passed everything
05344 }
05345 
05346 static int stbi__tga_test(stbi__context *s)
05347 {
05348    int res = 0;
05349    int sz, tga_color_type;
05350    stbi__get8(s);      //   discard Offset
05351    tga_color_type = stbi__get8(s);   //   color type
05352    if ( tga_color_type > 1 ) goto errorEnd;   //   only RGB or indexed allowed
05353    sz = stbi__get8(s);   //   image type
05354    if ( tga_color_type == 1 ) { // colormapped (paletted) image
05355       if (sz != 1 && sz != 9) goto errorEnd; // colortype 1 demands image type 1 or 9
05356       stbi__skip(s,4);       // skip index of first colormap entry and number of entries
05357       sz = stbi__get8(s);    //   check bits per palette color entry
05358       if ( (sz != 8) && (sz != 15) && (sz != 16) && (sz != 24) && (sz != 32) ) goto errorEnd;
05359       stbi__skip(s,4);       // skip image x and y origin
05360    } else { // "normal" image w/o colormap
05361       if ( (sz != 2) && (sz != 3) && (sz != 10) && (sz != 11) ) goto errorEnd; // only RGB or grey allowed, +/- RLE
05362       stbi__skip(s,9); // skip colormap specification and image x/y origin
05363    }
05364    if ( stbi__get16le(s) < 1 ) goto errorEnd;      //   test width
05365    if ( stbi__get16le(s) < 1 ) goto errorEnd;      //   test height
05366    sz = stbi__get8(s);   //   bits per pixel
05367    if ( (tga_color_type == 1) && (sz != 8) && (sz != 16) ) goto errorEnd; // for colormapped images, bpp is size of an index
05368    if ( (sz != 8) && (sz != 15) && (sz != 16) && (sz != 24) && (sz != 32) ) goto errorEnd;
05369 
05370    res = 1; // if we got this far, everything's good and we can return 1 instead of 0
05371 
05372 errorEnd:
05373    stbi__rewind(s);
05374    return res;
05375 }
05376 
05377 // read 16bit value and convert to 24bit RGB
05378 static void stbi__tga_read_rgb16(stbi__context *s, stbi_uc* out)
05379 {
05380    stbi__uint16 px = (stbi__uint16)stbi__get16le(s);
05381    stbi__uint16 fiveBitMask = 31;
05382    // we have 3 channels with 5bits each
05383    int r = (px >> 10) & fiveBitMask;
05384    int g = (px >> 5) & fiveBitMask;
05385    int b = px & fiveBitMask;
05386    // Note that this saves the data in RGB(A) order, so it doesn't need to be swapped later
05387    out[0] = (stbi_uc)((r * 255)/31);
05388    out[1] = (stbi_uc)((g * 255)/31);
05389    out[2] = (stbi_uc)((b * 255)/31);
05390 
05391    // some people claim that the most significant bit might be used for alpha
05392    // (possibly if an alpha-bit is set in the "image descriptor byte")
05393    // but that only made 16bit test images completely translucent..
05394    // so let's treat all 15 and 16bit TGAs as RGB with no alpha.
05395 }
05396 
05397 static void *stbi__tga_load(stbi__context *s, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp, stbi__result_info *ri)
05398 {
05399    //   read in the TGA header stuff
05400    int tga_offset = stbi__get8(s);
05401    int tga_indexed = stbi__get8(s);
05402    int tga_image_type = stbi__get8(s);
05403    int tga_is_RLE = 0;
05404    int tga_palette_start = stbi__get16le(s);
05405    int tga_palette_len = stbi__get16le(s);
05406    int tga_palette_bits = stbi__get8(s);
05407    int tga_x_origin = stbi__get16le(s);
05408    int tga_y_origin = stbi__get16le(s);
05409    int tga_width = stbi__get16le(s);
05410    int tga_height = stbi__get16le(s);
05411    int tga_bits_per_pixel = stbi__get8(s);
05412    int tga_comp, tga_rgb16=0;
05413    int tga_inverted = stbi__get8(s);
05414    // int tga_alpha_bits = tga_inverted & 15; // the 4 lowest bits - unused (useless?)
05415    //   image data
05416    unsigned char *tga_data;
05417    unsigned char *tga_palette = NULL;
05418    int i, j;
05419    unsigned char raw_data[4] = {0};
05420    int RLE_count = 0;
05421    int RLE_repeating = 0;
05422    int read_next_pixel = 1;
05423    STBI_NOTUSED(ri);
05424 
05425    //   do a tiny bit of precessing
05426    if ( tga_image_type >= 8 )
05427    {
05428       tga_image_type -= 8;
05429       tga_is_RLE = 1;
05430    }
05431    tga_inverted = 1 - ((tga_inverted >> 5) & 1);
05432 
05433    //   If I'm paletted, then I'll use the number of bits from the palette
05434    if ( tga_indexed ) tga_comp = stbi__tga_get_comp(tga_palette_bits, 0, &tga_rgb16);
05435    else tga_comp = stbi__tga_get_comp(tga_bits_per_pixel, (tga_image_type == 3), &tga_rgb16);
05436 
05437    if(!tga_comp) // shouldn't really happen, stbi__tga_test() should have ensured basic consistency
05438       return stbi__errpuc("bad format", "Can't find out TGA pixelformat");
05439 
05440    //   tga info
05441    *x = tga_width;
05442    *y = tga_height;
05443    if (comp) *comp = tga_comp;
05444 
05445    if (!stbi__mad3sizes_valid(tga_width, tga_height, tga_comp, 0))
05446       return stbi__errpuc("too large", "Corrupt TGA");
05447 
05448    tga_data = (unsigned char*)stbi__malloc_mad3(tga_width, tga_height, tga_comp, 0);
05449    if (!tga_data) return stbi__errpuc("outofmem", "Out of memory");
05450 
05451    // skip to the data's starting position (offset usually = 0)
05452    stbi__skip(s, tga_offset );
05453 
05454    if ( !tga_indexed && !tga_is_RLE && !tga_rgb16 ) {
05455       for (i=0; i < tga_height; ++i) {
05456          int row = tga_inverted ? tga_height -i - 1 : i;
05457          stbi_uc *tga_row = tga_data + row*tga_width*tga_comp;
05458          stbi__getn(s, tga_row, tga_width * tga_comp);
05459       }
05460    } else  {
05461       //   do I need to load a palette?
05462       if ( tga_indexed)
05463       {
05464          //   any data to skip? (offset usually = 0)
05465          stbi__skip(s, tga_palette_start );
05466          //   load the palette
05467          tga_palette = (unsigned char*)stbi__malloc_mad2(tga_palette_len, tga_comp, 0);
05468          if (!tga_palette) {
05469             STBI_FREE(tga_data);
05470             return stbi__errpuc("outofmem", "Out of memory");
05471          }
05472          if (tga_rgb16) {
05473             stbi_uc *pal_entry = tga_palette;
05474             STBI_ASSERT(tga_comp == STBI_rgb);
05475             for (i=0; i < tga_palette_len; ++i) {
05476                stbi__tga_read_rgb16(s, pal_entry);
05477                pal_entry += tga_comp;
05478             }
05479          } else if (!stbi__getn(s, tga_palette, tga_palette_len * tga_comp)) {
05480                STBI_FREE(tga_data);
05481                STBI_FREE(tga_palette);
05482                return stbi__errpuc("bad palette", "Corrupt TGA");
05483          }
05484       }
05485       //   load the data
05486       for (i=0; i < tga_width * tga_height; ++i)
05487       {
05488          //   if I'm in RLE mode, do I need to get a RLE stbi__pngchunk?
05489          if ( tga_is_RLE )
05490          {
05491             if ( RLE_count == 0 )
05492             {
05493                //   yep, get the next byte as a RLE command
05494                int RLE_cmd = stbi__get8(s);
05495                RLE_count = 1 + (RLE_cmd & 127);
05496                RLE_repeating = RLE_cmd >> 7;
05497                read_next_pixel = 1;
05498             } else if ( !RLE_repeating )
05499             {
05500                read_next_pixel = 1;
05501             }
05502          } else
05503          {
05504             read_next_pixel = 1;
05505          }
05506          //   OK, if I need to read a pixel, do it now
05507          if ( read_next_pixel )
05508          {
05509             //   load however much data we did have
05510             if ( tga_indexed )
05511             {
05512                // read in index, then perform the lookup
05513                int pal_idx = (tga_bits_per_pixel == 8) ? stbi__get8(s) : stbi__get16le(s);
05514                if ( pal_idx >= tga_palette_len ) {
05515                   // invalid index
05516                   pal_idx = 0;
05517                }
05518                pal_idx *= tga_comp;
05519                for (j = 0; j < tga_comp; ++j) {
05520                   raw_data[j] = tga_palette[pal_idx+j];
05521                }
05522             } else if(tga_rgb16) {
05523                STBI_ASSERT(tga_comp == STBI_rgb);
05524                stbi__tga_read_rgb16(s, raw_data);
05525             } else {
05526                //   read in the data raw
05527                for (j = 0; j < tga_comp; ++j) {
05528                   raw_data[j] = stbi__get8(s);
05529                }
05530             }
05531             //   clear the reading flag for the next pixel
05532             read_next_pixel = 0;
05533          } // end of reading a pixel
05534 
05535          // copy data
05536          for (j = 0; j < tga_comp; ++j)
05537            tga_data[i*tga_comp+j] = raw_data[j];
05538 
05539          //   in case we're in RLE mode, keep counting down
05540          --RLE_count;
05541       }
05542       //   do I need to invert the image?
05543       if ( tga_inverted )
05544       {
05545          for (j = 0; j*2 < tga_height; ++j)
05546          {
05547             int index1 = j * tga_width * tga_comp;
05548             int index2 = (tga_height - 1 - j) * tga_width * tga_comp;
05549             for (i = tga_width * tga_comp; i > 0; --i)
05550             {
05551                unsigned char temp = tga_data[index1];
05552                tga_data[index1] = tga_data[index2];
05553                tga_data[index2] = temp;
05554                ++index1;
05555                ++index2;
05556             }
05557          }
05558       }
05559       //   clear my palette, if I had one
05560       if ( tga_palette != NULL )
05561       {
05562          STBI_FREE( tga_palette );
05563       }
05564    }
05565 
05566    // swap RGB - if the source data was RGB16, it already is in the right order
05567    if (tga_comp >= 3 && !tga_rgb16)
05568    {
05569       unsigned char* tga_pixel = tga_data;
05570       for (i=0; i < tga_width * tga_height; ++i)
05571       {
05572          unsigned char temp = tga_pixel[0];
05573          tga_pixel[0] = tga_pixel[2];
05574          tga_pixel[2] = temp;
05575          tga_pixel += tga_comp;
05576       }
05577    }
05578 
05579    // convert to target component count
05580    if (req_comp && req_comp != tga_comp)
05581       tga_data = stbi__convert_format(tga_data, tga_comp, req_comp, tga_width, tga_height);
05582 
05583    //   the things I do to get rid of an error message, and yet keep
05584    //   Microsoft's C compilers happy... [8^(
05585    tga_palette_start = tga_palette_len = tga_palette_bits =
05586          tga_x_origin = tga_y_origin = 0;
05587    //   OK, done
05588    return tga_data;
05589 }
05590 #endif
05591 
05592 // *************************************************************************************************
05593 // Photoshop PSD loader -- PD by Thatcher Ulrich, integration by Nicolas Schulz, tweaked by STB
05594 
05595 #ifndef STBI_NO_PSD
05596 static int stbi__psd_test(stbi__context *s)
05597 {
05598    int r = (stbi__get32be(s) == 0x38425053);
05599    stbi__rewind(s);
05600    return r;
05601 }
05602 
05603 static int stbi__psd_decode_rle(stbi__context *s, stbi_uc *p, int pixelCount)
05604 {
05605    int count, nleft, len;
05606 
05607    count = 0;
05608    while ((nleft = pixelCount - count) > 0) {
05609       len = stbi__get8(s);
05610       if (len == 128) {
05611          // No-op.
05612       } else if (len < 128) {
05613          // Copy next len+1 bytes literally.
05614          len++;
05615          if (len > nleft) return 0; // corrupt data
05616          count += len;
05617          while (len) {
05618             *p = stbi__get8(s);
05619             p += 4;
05620             len--;
05621          }
05622       } else if (len > 128) {
05623          stbi_uc   val;
05624          // Next -len+1 bytes in the dest are replicated from next source byte.
05625          // (Interpret len as a negative 8-bit int.)
05626          len = 257 - len;
05627          if (len > nleft) return 0; // corrupt data
05628          val = stbi__get8(s);
05629          count += len;
05630          while (len) {
05631             *p = val;
05632             p += 4;
05633             len--;
05634          }
05635       }
05636    }
05637 
05638    return 1;
05639 }
05640 
05641 static void *stbi__psd_load(stbi__context *s, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp, stbi__result_info *ri, int bpc)
05642 {
05643    int pixelCount;
05644    int channelCount, compression;
05645    int channel, i;
05646    int bitdepth;
05647    int w,h;
05648    stbi_uc *out;
05649    STBI_NOTUSED(ri);
05650 
05651    // Check identifier
05652    if (stbi__get32be(s) != 0x38425053)   // "8BPS"
05653       return stbi__errpuc("not PSD", "Corrupt PSD image");
05654 
05655    // Check file type version.
05656    if (stbi__get16be(s) != 1)
05657       return stbi__errpuc("wrong version", "Unsupported version of PSD image");
05658 
05659    // Skip 6 reserved bytes.
05660    stbi__skip(s, 6 );
05661 
05662    // Read the number of channels (R, G, B, A, etc).
05663    channelCount = stbi__get16be(s);
05664    if (channelCount < 0 || channelCount > 16)
05665       return stbi__errpuc("wrong channel count", "Unsupported number of channels in PSD image");
05666 
05667    // Read the rows and columns of the image.
05668    h = stbi__get32be(s);
05669    w = stbi__get32be(s);
05670 
05671    // Make sure the depth is 8 bits.
05672    bitdepth = stbi__get16be(s);
05673    if (bitdepth != 8 && bitdepth != 16)
05674       return stbi__errpuc("unsupported bit depth", "PSD bit depth is not 8 or 16 bit");
05675 
05676    // Make sure the color mode is RGB.
05677    // Valid options are:
05678    //   0: Bitmap
05679    //   1: Grayscale
05680    //   2: Indexed color
05681    //   3: RGB color
05682    //   4: CMYK color
05683    //   7: Multichannel
05684    //   8: Duotone
05685    //   9: Lab color
05686    if (stbi__get16be(s) != 3)
05687       return stbi__errpuc("wrong color format", "PSD is not in RGB color format");
05688 
05689    // Skip the Mode Data.  (It's the palette for indexed color; other info for other modes.)
05690    stbi__skip(s,stbi__get32be(s) );
05691 
05692    // Skip the image resources.  (resolution, pen tool paths, etc)
05693    stbi__skip(s, stbi__get32be(s) );
05694 
05695    // Skip the reserved data.
05696    stbi__skip(s, stbi__get32be(s) );
05697 
05698    // Find out if the data is compressed.
05699    // Known values:
05700    //   0: no compression
05701    //   1: RLE compressed
05702    compression = stbi__get16be(s);
05703    if (compression > 1)
05704       return stbi__errpuc("bad compression", "PSD has an unknown compression format");
05705 
05706    // Check size
05707    if (!stbi__mad3sizes_valid(4, w, h, 0))
05708       return stbi__errpuc("too large", "Corrupt PSD");
05709 
05710    // Create the destination image.
05711 
05712    if (!compression && bitdepth == 16 && bpc == 16) {
05713       out = (stbi_uc *) stbi__malloc_mad3(8, w, h, 0);
05714       ri->bits_per_channel = 16;
05715    } else
05716       out = (stbi_uc *) stbi__malloc(4 * w*h);
05717 
05718    if (!out) return stbi__errpuc("outofmem", "Out of memory");
05719    pixelCount = w*h;
05720 
05721    // Initialize the data to zero.
05722    //memset( out, 0, pixelCount * 4 );
05723 
05724    // Finally, the image data.
05725    if (compression) {
05726       // RLE as used by .PSD and .TIFF
05727       // Loop until you get the number of unpacked bytes you are expecting:
05728       //     Read the next source byte into n.
05729       //     If n is between 0 and 127 inclusive, copy the next n+1 bytes literally.
05730       //     Else if n is between -127 and -1 inclusive, copy the next byte -n+1 times.
05731       //     Else if n is 128, noop.
05732       // Endloop
05733 
05734       // The RLE-compressed data is preceeded by a 2-byte data count for each row in the data,
05735       // which we're going to just skip.
05736       stbi__skip(s, h * channelCount * 2 );
05737 
05738       // Read the RLE data by channel.
05739       for (channel = 0; channel < 4; channel++) {
05740          stbi_uc *p;
05741 
05742          p = out+channel;
05743          if (channel >= channelCount) {
05744             // Fill this channel with default data.
05745             for (i = 0; i < pixelCount; i++, p += 4)
05746                *p = (channel == 3 ? 255 : 0);
05747          } else {
05748             // Read the RLE data.
05749             if (!stbi__psd_decode_rle(s, p, pixelCount)) {
05750                STBI_FREE(out);
05751                return stbi__errpuc("corrupt", "bad RLE data");
05752             }
05753          }
05754       }
05755 
05756    } else {
05757       // We're at the raw image data.  It's each channel in order (Red, Green, Blue, Alpha, ...)
05758       // where each channel consists of an 8-bit (or 16-bit) value for each pixel in the image.
05759 
05760       // Read the data by channel.
05761       for (channel = 0; channel < 4; channel++) {
05762          if (channel >= channelCount) {
05763             // Fill this channel with default data.
05764             if (bitdepth == 16 && bpc == 16) {
05765                stbi__uint16 *q = ((stbi__uint16 *) out) + channel;
05766                stbi__uint16 val = channel == 3 ? 65535 : 0;
05767                for (i = 0; i < pixelCount; i++, q += 4)
05768                   *q = val;
05769             } else {
05770                stbi_uc *p = out+channel;
05771                stbi_uc val = channel == 3 ? 255 : 0;
05772                for (i = 0; i < pixelCount; i++, p += 4)
05773                   *p = val;
05774             }
05775          } else {
05776             if (ri->bits_per_channel == 16) {    // output bpc
05777                stbi__uint16 *q = ((stbi__uint16 *) out) + channel;
05778                for (i = 0; i < pixelCount; i++, q += 4)
05779                   *q = (stbi__uint16) stbi__get16be(s);
05780             } else {
05781                stbi_uc *p = out+channel;
05782                if (bitdepth == 16) {  // input bpc
05783                   for (i = 0; i < pixelCount; i++, p += 4)
05784                      *p = (stbi_uc) (stbi__get16be(s) >> 8);
05785                } else {
05786                   for (i = 0; i < pixelCount; i++, p += 4)
05787                      *p = stbi__get8(s);
05788                }
05789             }
05790          }
05791       }
05792    }
05793 
05794    // remove weird white matte from PSD
05795    if (channelCount >= 4) {
05796       if (ri->bits_per_channel == 16) {
05797          for (i=0; i < w*h; ++i) {
05798             stbi__uint16 *pixel = (stbi__uint16 *) out + 4*i;
05799             if (pixel[3] != 0 && pixel[3] != 65535) {
05800                float a = pixel[3] / 65535.0f;
05801                float ra = 1.0f / a;
05802                float inv_a = 65535.0f * (1 - ra);
05803                pixel[0] = (stbi__uint16) (pixel[0]*ra + inv_a);
05804                pixel[1] = (stbi__uint16) (pixel[1]*ra + inv_a);
05805                pixel[2] = (stbi__uint16) (pixel[2]*ra + inv_a);
05806             }
05807          }
05808       } else {
05809          for (i=0; i < w*h; ++i) {
05810             unsigned char *pixel = out + 4*i;
05811             if (pixel[3] != 0 && pixel[3] != 255) {
05812                float a = pixel[3] / 255.0f;
05813                float ra = 1.0f / a;
05814                float inv_a = 255.0f * (1 - ra);
05815                pixel[0] = (unsigned char) (pixel[0]*ra + inv_a);
05816                pixel[1] = (unsigned char) (pixel[1]*ra + inv_a);
05817                pixel[2] = (unsigned char) (pixel[2]*ra + inv_a);
05818             }
05819          }
05820       }
05821    }
05822 
05823    // convert to desired output format
05824    if (req_comp && req_comp != 4) {
05825       if (ri->bits_per_channel == 16)
05826          out = (stbi_uc *) stbi__convert_format16((stbi__uint16 *) out, 4, req_comp, w, h);
05827       else
05828          out = stbi__convert_format(out, 4, req_comp, w, h);
05829       if (out == NULL) return out; // stbi__convert_format frees input on failure
05830    }
05831 
05832    if (comp) *comp = 4;
05833    *y = h;
05834    *x = w;
05835 
05836    return out;
05837 }
05838 #endif
05839 
05840 // *************************************************************************************************
05841 // Softimage PIC loader
05842 // by Tom Seddon
05843 //
05844 // See http://softimage.wiki.softimage.com/index.php/INFO:_PIC_file_format
05845 // See http://ozviz.wasp.uwa.edu.au/~pbourke/dataformats/softimagepic/
05846 
05847 #ifndef STBI_NO_PIC
05848 static int stbi__pic_is4(stbi__context *s,const char *str)
05849 {
05850    int i;
05851    for (i=0; i<4; ++i)
05852       if (stbi__get8(s) != (stbi_uc)str[i])
05853          return 0;
05854 
05855    return 1;
05856 }
05857 
05858 static int stbi__pic_test_core(stbi__context *s)
05859 {
05860    int i;
05861 
05862    if (!stbi__pic_is4(s,"\x53\x80\xF6\x34"))
05863       return 0;
05864 
05865    for(i=0;i<84;++i)
05866       stbi__get8(s);
05867 
05868    if (!stbi__pic_is4(s,"PICT"))
05869       return 0;
05870 
05871    return 1;
05872 }
05873 
05874 typedef struct
05875 {
05876    stbi_uc size,type,channel;
05877 } stbi__pic_packet;
05878 
05879 static stbi_uc *stbi__readval(stbi__context *s, int channel, stbi_uc *dest)
05880 {
05881    int mask=0x80, i;
05882 
05883    for (i=0; i<4; ++i, mask>>=1) {
05884       if (channel & mask) {
05885          if (stbi__at_eof(s)) return stbi__errpuc("bad file","PIC file too short");
05886          dest[i]=stbi__get8(s);
05887       }
05888    }
05889 
05890    return dest;
05891 }
05892 
05893 static void stbi__copyval(int channel,stbi_uc *dest,const stbi_uc *src)
05894 {
05895    int mask=0x80,i;
05896 
05897    for (i=0;i<4; ++i, mask>>=1)
05898       if (channel&mask)
05899          dest[i]=src[i];
05900 }
05901 
05902 static stbi_uc *stbi__pic_load_core(stbi__context *s,int width,int height,int *comp, stbi_uc *result)
05903 {
05904    int act_comp=0,num_packets=0,y,chained;
05905    stbi__pic_packet packets[10];
05906 
05907    // this will (should...) cater for even some bizarre stuff like having data
05908     // for the same channel in multiple packets.
05909    do {
05910       stbi__pic_packet *packet;
05911 
05912       if (num_packets==sizeof(packets)/sizeof(packets[0]))
05913          return stbi__errpuc("bad format","too many packets");
05914 
05915       packet = &packets[num_packets++];
05916 
05917       chained = stbi__get8(s);
05918       packet->size    = stbi__get8(s);
05919       packet->type    = stbi__get8(s);
05920       packet->channel = stbi__get8(s);
05921 
05922       act_comp |= packet->channel;
05923 
05924       if (stbi__at_eof(s))          return stbi__errpuc("bad file","file too short (reading packets)");
05925       if (packet->size != 8)  return stbi__errpuc("bad format","packet isn't 8bpp");
05926    } while (chained);
05927 
05928    *comp = (act_comp & 0x10 ? 4 : 3); // has alpha channel?
05929 
05930    for(y=0; y<height; ++y) {
05931       int packet_idx;
05932 
05933       for(packet_idx=0; packet_idx < num_packets; ++packet_idx) {
05934          stbi__pic_packet *packet = &packets[packet_idx];
05935          stbi_uc *dest = result+y*width*4;
05936 
05937          switch (packet->type) {
05938             default:
05939                return stbi__errpuc("bad format","packet has bad compression type");
05940 
05941             case 0: {//uncompressed
05942                int x;
05943 
05944                for(x=0;x<width;++x, dest+=4)
05945                   if (!stbi__readval(s,packet->channel,dest))
05946                      return 0;
05947                break;
05948             }
05949 
05950             case 1://Pure RLE
05951                {
05952                   int left=width, i;
05953 
05954                   while (left>0) {
05955                      stbi_uc count,value[4];
05956 
05957                      count=stbi__get8(s);
05958                      if (stbi__at_eof(s))   return stbi__errpuc("bad file","file too short (pure read count)");
05959 
05960                      if (count > left)
05961                         count = (stbi_uc) left;
05962 
05963                      if (!stbi__readval(s,packet->channel,value))  return 0;
05964 
05965                      for(i=0; i<count; ++i,dest+=4)
05966                         stbi__copyval(packet->channel,dest,value);
05967                      left -= count;
05968                   }
05969                }
05970                break;
05971 
05972             case 2: {//Mixed RLE
05973                int left=width;
05974                while (left>0) {
05975                   int count = stbi__get8(s), i;
05976                   if (stbi__at_eof(s))  return stbi__errpuc("bad file","file too short (mixed read count)");
05977 
05978                   if (count >= 128) { // Repeated
05979                      stbi_uc value[4];
05980 
05981                      if (count==128)
05982                         count = stbi__get16be(s);
05983                      else
05984                         count -= 127;
05985                      if (count > left)
05986                         return stbi__errpuc("bad file","scanline overrun");
05987 
05988                      if (!stbi__readval(s,packet->channel,value))
05989                         return 0;
05990 
05991                      for(i=0;i<count;++i, dest += 4)
05992                         stbi__copyval(packet->channel,dest,value);
05993                   } else { // Raw
05994                      ++count;
05995                      if (count>left) return stbi__errpuc("bad file","scanline overrun");
05996 
05997                      for(i=0;i<count;++i, dest+=4)
05998                         if (!stbi__readval(s,packet->channel,dest))
05999                            return 0;
06000                   }
06001                   left-=count;
06002                }
06003                break;
06004             }
06005          }
06006       }
06007    }
06008 
06009    return result;
06010 }
06011 
06012 static void *stbi__pic_load(stbi__context *s,int *px,int *py,int *comp,int req_comp, stbi__result_info *ri)
06013 {
06014    stbi_uc *result;
06015    int i, x,y, internal_comp;
06016    STBI_NOTUSED(ri);
06017 
06018    if (!comp) comp = &internal_comp;
06019 
06020    for (i=0; i<92; ++i)
06021       stbi__get8(s);
06022 
06023    x = stbi__get16be(s);
06024    y = stbi__get16be(s);
06025    if (stbi__at_eof(s))  return stbi__errpuc("bad file","file too short (pic header)");
06026    if (!stbi__mad3sizes_valid(x, y, 4, 0)) return stbi__errpuc("too large", "PIC image too large to decode");
06027 
06028    stbi__get32be(s); //skip `ratio'
06029    stbi__get16be(s); //skip `fields'
06030    stbi__get16be(s); //skip `pad'
06031 
06032    // intermediate buffer is RGBA
06033    result = (stbi_uc *) stbi__malloc_mad3(x, y, 4, 0);
06034    memset(result, 0xff, x*y*4);
06035 
06036    if (!stbi__pic_load_core(s,x,y,comp, result)) {
06037       STBI_FREE(result);
06038       result=0;
06039    }
06040    *px = x;
06041    *py = y;
06042    if (req_comp == 0) req_comp = *comp;
06043    result=stbi__convert_format(result,4,req_comp,x,y);
06044 
06045    return result;
06046 }
06047 
06048 static int stbi__pic_test(stbi__context *s)
06049 {
06050    int r = stbi__pic_test_core(s);
06051    stbi__rewind(s);
06052    return r;
06053 }
06054 #endif
