06056 // *************************************************************************************************
06057 // GIF loader -- public domain by Jean-Marc Lienher -- simplified/shrunk by stb
06058 
06059 #ifndef STBI_NO_GIF
06060 typedef struct
06061 {
06062    stbi__int16 prefix;
06063    stbi_uc first;
06064    stbi_uc suffix;
06065 } stbi__gif_lzw;
06066 
06067 typedef struct
06068 {
06069    int w,h;
06070    stbi_uc *out, *old_out;             // output buffer (always 4 components)
06071    int flags, bgindex, ratio, transparent, eflags, delay;
06072    stbi_uc  pal[256][4];
06073    stbi_uc lpal[256][4];
06074    stbi__gif_lzw codes[4096];
06075    stbi_uc *color_table;
06076    int parse, step;
06077    int lflags;
06078    int start_x, start_y;
06079    int max_x, max_y;
06080    int cur_x, cur_y;
06081    int line_size;
06082 } stbi__gif;
06083 
06084 static int stbi__gif_test_raw(stbi__context *s)
06085 {
06086    int sz;
06087    if (stbi__get8(s) != 'G' || stbi__get8(s) != 'I' || stbi__get8(s) != 'F' || stbi__get8(s) != '8') return 0;
06088    sz = stbi__get8(s);
06089    if (sz != '9' && sz != '7') return 0;
06090    if (stbi__get8(s) != 'a') return 0;
06091    return 1;
06092 }
06093 
06094 static int stbi__gif_test(stbi__context *s)
06095 {
06096    int r = stbi__gif_test_raw(s);
06097    stbi__rewind(s);
06098    return r;
06099 }
06100 
06101 static void stbi__gif_parse_colortable(stbi__context *s, stbi_uc pal[256][4], int num_entries, int transp)
06102 {
06103    int i;
06104    for (i=0; i < num_entries; ++i) {
06105       pal[i][2] = stbi__get8(s);
06106       pal[i][1] = stbi__get8(s);
06107       pal[i][0] = stbi__get8(s);
06108       pal[i][3] = transp == i ? 0 : 255;
06109    }
06110 }
06111 
06112 static int stbi__gif_header(stbi__context *s, stbi__gif *g, int *comp, int is_info)
06113 {
06114    stbi_uc version;
06115    if (stbi__get8(s) != 'G' || stbi__get8(s) != 'I' || stbi__get8(s) != 'F' || stbi__get8(s) != '8')
06116       return stbi__err("not GIF", "Corrupt GIF");
06117 
06118    version = stbi__get8(s);
06119    if (version != '7' && version != '9')    return stbi__err("not GIF", "Corrupt GIF");
06120    if (stbi__get8(s) != 'a')                return stbi__err("not GIF", "Corrupt GIF");
06121 
06122    stbi__g_failure_reason = "";
06123    g->w = stbi__get16le(s);
06124    g->h = stbi__get16le(s);
06125    g->flags = stbi__get8(s);
06126    g->bgindex = stbi__get8(s);
06127    g->ratio = stbi__get8(s);
06128    g->transparent = -1;
06129 
06130    if (comp != 0) *comp = 4;  // can't actually tell whether it's 3 or 4 until we parse the comments
06131 
06132    if (is_info) return 1;
06133 
06134    if (g->flags & 0x80)
06135       stbi__gif_parse_colortable(s,g->pal, 2 << (g->flags & 7), -1);
06136 
06137    return 1;
06138 }
06139 
06140 static int stbi__gif_info_raw(stbi__context *s, int *x, int *y, int *comp)
06141 {
06142    stbi__gif* g = (stbi__gif*) stbi__malloc(sizeof(stbi__gif));
06143    if (!stbi__gif_header(s, g, comp, 1)) {
06144       STBI_FREE(g);
06145       stbi__rewind( s );
06146       return 0;
06147    }
06148    if (x) *x = g->w;
06149    if (y) *y = g->h;
06150    STBI_FREE(g);
06151    return 1;
06152 }
06153 
06154 static void stbi__out_gif_code(stbi__gif *g, stbi__uint16 code)
06155 {
06156    stbi_uc *p, *c;
06157 
06158    // recurse to decode the prefixes, since the linked-list is backwards,
06159    // and working backwards through an interleaved image would be nasty
06160    if (g->codes[code].prefix >= 0)
06161       stbi__out_gif_code(g, g->codes[code].prefix);
06162 
06163    if (g->cur_y >= g->max_y) return;
06164 
06165    p = &g->out[g->cur_x + g->cur_y];
06166    c = &g->color_table[g->codes[code].suffix * 4];
06167 
06168    if (c[3] >= 128) {
06169       p[0] = c[2];
06170       p[1] = c[1];
06171       p[2] = c[0];
06172       p[3] = c[3];
06173    }
06174    g->cur_x += 4;
06175 
06176    if (g->cur_x >= g->max_x) {
06177       g->cur_x = g->start_x;
06178       g->cur_y += g->step;
06179 
06180       while (g->cur_y >= g->max_y && g->parse > 0) {
06181          g->step = (1 << g->parse) * g->line_size;
06182          g->cur_y = g->start_y + (g->step >> 1);
06183          --g->parse;
06184       }
06185    }
06186 }
06187 
06188 static stbi_uc *stbi__process_gif_raster(stbi__context *s, stbi__gif *g)
06189 {
06190    stbi_uc lzw_cs;
06191    stbi__int32 len, init_code;
06192    stbi__uint32 first;
06193    stbi__int32 codesize, codemask, avail, oldcode, bits, valid_bits, clear;
06194    stbi__gif_lzw *p;
06195 
06196    lzw_cs = stbi__get8(s);
06197    if (lzw_cs > 12) return NULL;
06198    clear = 1 << lzw_cs;
06199    first = 1;
06200    codesize = lzw_cs + 1;
06201    codemask = (1 << codesize) - 1;
06202    bits = 0;
06203    valid_bits = 0;
06204    for (init_code = 0; init_code < clear; init_code++) {
06205       g->codes[init_code].prefix = -1;
06206       g->codes[init_code].first = (stbi_uc) init_code;
06207       g->codes[init_code].suffix = (stbi_uc) init_code;
06208    }
06209 
06210    // support no starting clear code
06211    avail = clear+2;
06212    oldcode = -1;
06213 
06214    len = 0;
06215    for(;;) {
06216       if (valid_bits < codesize) {
06217          if (len == 0) {
06218             len = stbi__get8(s); // start new block
06219             if (len == 0)
06220                return g->out;
06221          }
06222          --len;
06223          bits |= (stbi__int32) stbi__get8(s) << valid_bits;
06224          valid_bits += 8;
06225       } else {
06226          stbi__int32 code = bits & codemask;
06227          bits >>= codesize;
06228          valid_bits -= codesize;
06229          // @OPTIMIZE: is there some way we can accelerate the non-clear path?
06230          if (code == clear) {  // clear code
06231             codesize = lzw_cs + 1;
06232             codemask = (1 << codesize) - 1;
06233             avail = clear + 2;
06234             oldcode = -1;
06235             first = 0;
06236          } else if (code == clear + 1) { // end of stream code
06237             stbi__skip(s, len);
06238             while ((len = stbi__get8(s)) > 0)
06239                stbi__skip(s,len);
06240             return g->out;
06241          } else if (code <= avail) {
06242             if (first) return stbi__errpuc("no clear code", "Corrupt GIF");
06243 
06244             if (oldcode >= 0) {
06245                p = &g->codes[avail++];
06246                if (avail > 4096)        return stbi__errpuc("too many codes", "Corrupt GIF");
06247                p->prefix = (stbi__int16) oldcode;
06248                p->first = g->codes[oldcode].first;
06249                p->suffix = (code == avail) ? p->first : g->codes[code].first;
06250             } else if (code == avail)
06251                return stbi__errpuc("illegal code in raster", "Corrupt GIF");
06252 
06253             stbi__out_gif_code(g, (stbi__uint16) code);
06254 
06255             if ((avail & codemask) == 0 && avail <= 0x0FFF) {
06256                codesize++;
06257                codemask = (1 << codesize) - 1;
06258             }
06259 
06260             oldcode = code;
06261          } else {
06262             return stbi__errpuc("illegal code in raster", "Corrupt GIF");
06263          }
06264       }
06265    }
06266 }
06267 
06268 static void stbi__fill_gif_background(stbi__gif *g, int x0, int y0, int x1, int y1)
06269 {
06270    int x, y;
06271    stbi_uc *c = g->pal[g->bgindex];
06272    for (y = y0; y < y1; y += 4 * g->w) {
06273       for (x = x0; x < x1; x += 4) {
06274          stbi_uc *p  = &g->out[y + x];
06275          p[0] = c[2];
06276          p[1] = c[1];
06277          p[2] = c[0];
06278          p[3] = 0;
06279       }
06280    }
06281 }
06282 
06283 // this function is designed to support animated gifs, although stb_image doesn't support it
06284 static stbi_uc *stbi__gif_load_next(stbi__context *s, stbi__gif *g, int *comp, int req_comp)
06285 {
06286    int i;
06287    stbi_uc *prev_out = 0;
06288 
06289    if (g->out == 0 && !stbi__gif_header(s, g, comp,0))
06290       return 0; // stbi__g_failure_reason set by stbi__gif_header
06291 
06292    if (!stbi__mad3sizes_valid(g->w, g->h, 4, 0))
06293       return stbi__errpuc("too large", "GIF too large");
06294 
06295    prev_out = g->out;
06296    g->out = (stbi_uc *) stbi__malloc_mad3(4, g->w, g->h, 0);
06297    if (g->out == 0) return stbi__errpuc("outofmem", "Out of memory");
06298 
06299    switch ((g->eflags & 0x1C) >> 2) {
06300       case 0: // unspecified (also always used on 1st frame)
06301          stbi__fill_gif_background(g, 0, 0, 4 * g->w, 4 * g->w * g->h);
06302          break;
06303       case 1: // do not dispose
06304          if (prev_out) memcpy(g->out, prev_out, 4 * g->w * g->h);
06305          g->old_out = prev_out;
06306          break;
06307       case 2: // dispose to background
06308          if (prev_out) memcpy(g->out, prev_out, 4 * g->w * g->h);
06309          stbi__fill_gif_background(g, g->start_x, g->start_y, g->max_x, g->max_y);
06310          break;
06311       case 3: // dispose to previous
06312          if (g->old_out) {
06313             for (i = g->start_y; i < g->max_y; i += 4 * g->w)
06314                memcpy(&g->out[i + g->start_x], &g->old_out[i + g->start_x], g->max_x - g->start_x);
06315          }
06316          break;
06317    }
06318 
06319    for (;;) {
06320       switch (stbi__get8(s)) {
06321          case 0x2C: /* Image Descriptor */
06322          {
06323             int prev_trans = -1;
06324             stbi__int32 x, y, w, h;
06325             stbi_uc *o;
06326 
06327             x = stbi__get16le(s);
06328             y = stbi__get16le(s);
06329             w = stbi__get16le(s);
06330             h = stbi__get16le(s);
06331             if (((x + w) > (g->w)) || ((y + h) > (g->h)))
06332                return stbi__errpuc("bad Image Descriptor", "Corrupt GIF");
06333 
06334             g->line_size = g->w * 4;
06335             g->start_x = x * 4;
06336             g->start_y = y * g->line_size;
06337             g->max_x   = g->start_x + w * 4;
06338             g->max_y   = g->start_y + h * g->line_size;
06339             g->cur_x   = g->start_x;
06340             g->cur_y   = g->start_y;
06341 
06342             g->lflags = stbi__get8(s);
06343 
06344             if (g->lflags & 0x40) {
06345                g->step = 8 * g->line_size; // first interlaced spacing
06346                g->parse = 3;
06347             } else {
06348                g->step = g->line_size;
06349                g->parse = 0;
06350             }
06351 
06352             if (g->lflags & 0x80) {
06353                stbi__gif_parse_colortable(s,g->lpal, 2 << (g->lflags & 7), g->eflags & 0x01 ? g->transparent : -1);
06354                g->color_table = (stbi_uc *) g->lpal;
06355             } else if (g->flags & 0x80) {
06356                if (g->transparent >= 0 && (g->eflags & 0x01)) {
06357                   prev_trans = g->pal[g->transparent][3];
06358                   g->pal[g->transparent][3] = 0;
06359                }
06360                g->color_table = (stbi_uc *) g->pal;
06361             } else
06362                return stbi__errpuc("missing color table", "Corrupt GIF");
06363 
06364             o = stbi__process_gif_raster(s, g);
06365             if (o == NULL) return NULL;
06366 
06367             if (prev_trans != -1)
06368                g->pal[g->transparent][3] = (stbi_uc) prev_trans;
06369 
06370             return o;
06371          }
06372 
06373          case 0x21: // Comment Extension.
06374          {
06375             int len;
06376             if (stbi__get8(s) == 0xF9) { // Graphic Control Extension.
06377                len = stbi__get8(s);
06378                if (len == 4) {
06379                   g->eflags = stbi__get8(s);
06380                   g->delay = stbi__get16le(s);
06381                   g->transparent = stbi__get8(s);
06382                } else {
06383                   stbi__skip(s, len);
06384                   break;
06385                }
06386             }
06387             while ((len = stbi__get8(s)) != 0)
06388                stbi__skip(s, len);
06389             break;
06390          }
06391 
06392          case 0x3B: // gif stream termination code
06393             return (stbi_uc *) s; // using '1' causes warning on some compilers
06394 
06395          default:
06396             return stbi__errpuc("unknown code", "Corrupt GIF");
06397       }
06398    }
06399 
06400    STBI_NOTUSED(req_comp);
06401 }
06402 
06403 static void *stbi__gif_load(stbi__context *s, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp, stbi__result_info *ri)
06404 {
06405    stbi_uc *u = 0;
06406    stbi__gif* g = (stbi__gif*) stbi__malloc(sizeof(stbi__gif));
06407    memset(g, 0, sizeof(*g));
06408    STBI_NOTUSED(ri);
06409 
06410    u = stbi__gif_load_next(s, g, comp, req_comp);
06411    if (u == (stbi_uc *) s) u = 0;  // end of animated gif marker
06412    if (u) {
06413       *x = g->w;
06414       *y = g->h;
06415       if (req_comp && req_comp != 4)
06416          u = stbi__convert_format(u, 4, req_comp, g->w, g->h);
06417    }
06418    else if (g->out)
06419       STBI_FREE(g->out);
06420    STBI_FREE(g);
06421    return u;
06422 }
06423 
06424 static int stbi__gif_info(stbi__context *s, int *x, int *y, int *comp)
06425 {
06426    return stbi__gif_info_raw(s,x,y,comp);
06427 }
06428 #endif

06430 // *************************************************************************************************
06431 // Radiance RGBE HDR loader
06432 // originally by Nicolas Schulz
06433 #ifndef STBI_NO_HDR
06434 static int stbi__hdr_test_core(stbi__context *s, const char *signature)
06435 {
06436    int i;
06437    for (i=0; signature[i]; ++i)
06438       if (stbi__get8(s) != signature[i])
06439           return 0;
06440    stbi__rewind(s);
06441    return 1;
06442 }
06443 
06444 static int stbi__hdr_test(stbi__context* s)
06445 {
06446    int r = stbi__hdr_test_core(s, "#?RADIANCE\n");
06447    stbi__rewind(s);
06448    if(!r) {
06449        r = stbi__hdr_test_core(s, "#?RGBE\n");
06450        stbi__rewind(s);
06451    }
06452    return r;
06453 }
06454 
06455 #define STBI__HDR_BUFLEN  1024
06456 static char *stbi__hdr_gettoken(stbi__context *z, char *buffer)
06457 {
06458    int len=0;
06459    char c = '\0';
06460 
06461    c = (char) stbi__get8(z);
06462 
06463    while (!stbi__at_eof(z) && c != '\n') {
06464       buffer[len++] = c;
06465       if (len == STBI__HDR_BUFLEN-1) {
06466          // flush to end of line
06467          while (!stbi__at_eof(z) && stbi__get8(z) != '\n')
06468             ;
06469          break;
06470       }
06471       c = (char) stbi__get8(z);
06472    }
06473 
06474    buffer[len] = 0;
06475    return buffer;
06476 }
06477 
06478 static void stbi__hdr_convert(float *output, stbi_uc *input, int req_comp)
06479 {
06480    if ( input[3] != 0 ) {
06481       float f1;
06482       // Exponent
06483       f1 = (float) ldexp(1.0f, input[3] - (int)(128 + 8));
06484       if (req_comp <= 2)
06485          output[0] = (input[0] + input[1] + input[2]) * f1 / 3;
06486       else {
06487          output[0] = input[0] * f1;
06488          output[1] = input[1] * f1;
06489          output[2] = input[2] * f1;
06490       }
06491       if (req_comp == 2) output[1] = 1;
06492       if (req_comp == 4) output[3] = 1;
06493    } else {
06494       switch (req_comp) {
06495          case 4: output[3] = 1; /* fallthrough */
06496          case 3: output[0] = output[1] = output[2] = 0;
06497                  break;
06498          case 2: output[1] = 1; /* fallthrough */
06499          case 1: output[0] = 0;
06500                  break;
06501       }
06502    }
06503 }
06504 
06505 static float *stbi__hdr_load(stbi__context *s, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp, stbi__result_info *ri)
06506 {
06507    char buffer[STBI__HDR_BUFLEN];
06508    char *token;
06509    int valid = 0;
06510    int width, height;
06511    stbi_uc *scanline;
06512    float *hdr_data;
06513    int len;
06514    unsigned char count, value;
06515    int i, j, k, c1,c2, z;
06516    const char *headerToken;
06517    STBI_NOTUSED(ri);
06518 
06519    // Check identifier
06520    headerToken = stbi__hdr_gettoken(s,buffer);
06521    if (strcmp(headerToken, "#?RADIANCE") != 0 && strcmp(headerToken, "#?RGBE") != 0)
06522       return stbi__errpf("not HDR", "Corrupt HDR image");
06523 
06524    // Parse header
06525    for(;;) {
06526       token = stbi__hdr_gettoken(s,buffer);
06527       if (token[0] == 0) break;
06528       if (strcmp(token, "FORMAT=32-bit_rle_rgbe") == 0) valid = 1;
06529    }
06530 
06531    if (!valid)    return stbi__errpf("unsupported format", "Unsupported HDR format");
06532 
06533    // Parse width and height
06534    // can't use sscanf() if we're not using stdio!
06535    token = stbi__hdr_gettoken(s,buffer);
06536    if (strncmp(token, "-Y ", 3))  return stbi__errpf("unsupported data layout", "Unsupported HDR format");
06537    token += 3;
06538    height = (int) strtol(token, &token, 10);
06539    while (*token == ' ') ++token;
06540    if (strncmp(token, "+X ", 3))  return stbi__errpf("unsupported data layout", "Unsupported HDR format");
06541    token += 3;
06542    width = (int) strtol(token, NULL, 10);
06543 
06544    *x = width;
06545    *y = height;
06546 
06547    if (comp) *comp = 3;
06548    if (req_comp == 0) req_comp = 3;
06549 
06550    if (!stbi__mad4sizes_valid(width, height, req_comp, sizeof(float), 0))
06551       return stbi__errpf("too large", "HDR image is too large");
06552 
06553    // Read data
06554    hdr_data = (float *) stbi__malloc_mad4(width, height, req_comp, sizeof(float), 0);
06555    if (!hdr_data)
06556       return stbi__errpf("outofmem", "Out of memory");
06557 
06558    // Load image data
06559    // image data is stored as some number of sca
06560    if ( width < 8 || width >= 32768) {
06561       // Read flat data
06562       for (j=0; j < height; ++j) {
06563          for (i=0; i < width; ++i) {
06564             stbi_uc rgbe[4];
06565            main_decode_loop:
06566             stbi__getn(s, rgbe, 4);
06567             stbi__hdr_convert(hdr_data + j * width * req_comp + i * req_comp, rgbe, req_comp);
06568          }
06569       }
06570    } else {
06571       // Read RLE-encoded data
06572       scanline = NULL;
06573 
06574       for (j = 0; j < height; ++j) {
06575          c1 = stbi__get8(s);
06576          c2 = stbi__get8(s);
06577          len = stbi__get8(s);
06578          if (c1 != 2 || c2 != 2 || (len & 0x80)) {
06579             // not run-length encoded, so we have to actually use THIS data as a decoded
06580             // pixel (note this can't be a valid pixel--one of RGB must be >= 128)
06581             stbi_uc rgbe[4];
06582             rgbe[0] = (stbi_uc) c1;
06583             rgbe[1] = (stbi_uc) c2;
06584             rgbe[2] = (stbi_uc) len;
06585             rgbe[3] = (stbi_uc) stbi__get8(s);
06586             stbi__hdr_convert(hdr_data, rgbe, req_comp);
06587             i = 1;
06588             j = 0;
06589             STBI_FREE(scanline);
06590             goto main_decode_loop; // yes, this makes no sense
06591          }
06592          len <<= 8;
06593          len |= stbi__get8(s);
06594          if (len != width) { STBI_FREE(hdr_data); STBI_FREE(scanline); return stbi__errpf("invalid decoded scanline length", "corrupt HDR"); }
06595          if (scanline == NULL) {
06596             scanline = (stbi_uc *) stbi__malloc_mad2(width, 4, 0);
06597             if (!scanline) {
06598                STBI_FREE(hdr_data);
06599                return stbi__errpf("outofmem", "Out of memory");
06600             }
06601          }
06602 
06603          for (k = 0; k < 4; ++k) {
06604             int nleft;
06605             i = 0;
06606             while ((nleft = width - i) > 0) {
06607                count = stbi__get8(s);
06608                if (count > 128) {
06609                   // Run
06610                   value = stbi__get8(s);
06611                   count -= 128;
06612                   if (count > nleft) { STBI_FREE(hdr_data); STBI_FREE(scanline); return stbi__errpf("corrupt", "bad RLE data in HDR"); }
06613                   for (z = 0; z < count; ++z)
06614                      scanline[i++ * 4 + k] = value;
06615                } else {
06616                   // Dump
06617                   if (count > nleft) { STBI_FREE(hdr_data); STBI_FREE(scanline); return stbi__errpf("corrupt", "bad RLE data in HDR"); }
06618                   for (z = 0; z < count; ++z)
06619                      scanline[i++ * 4 + k] = stbi__get8(s);
06620                }
06621             }
06622          }
06623          for (i=0; i < width; ++i)
06624             stbi__hdr_convert(hdr_data+(j*width + i)*req_comp, scanline + i*4, req_comp);
06625       }
06626       if (scanline)
06627          STBI_FREE(scanline);
06628    }
06629 
06630    return hdr_data;
06631 }
06632 
06633 static int stbi__hdr_info(stbi__context *s, int *x, int *y, int *comp)
06634 {
06635    char buffer[STBI__HDR_BUFLEN];
06636    char *token;
06637    int valid = 0;
06638    int dummy;
06639 
06640    if (!x) x = &dummy;
06641    if (!y) y = &dummy;
06642    if (!comp) comp = &dummy;
06643 
06644    if (stbi__hdr_test(s) == 0) {
06645        stbi__rewind( s );
06646        return 0;
06647    }
06648 
06649    for(;;) {
06650       token = stbi__hdr_gettoken(s,buffer);
06651       if (token[0] == 0) break;
06652       if (strcmp(token, "FORMAT=32-bit_rle_rgbe") == 0) valid = 1;
06653    }
06654 
06655    if (!valid) {
06656        stbi__rewind( s );
06657        return 0;
06658    }
06659    token = stbi__hdr_gettoken(s,buffer);
06660    if (strncmp(token, "-Y ", 3)) {
06661        stbi__rewind( s );
06662        return 0;
06663    }
06664    token += 3;
06665    *y = (int) strtol(token, &token, 10);
06666    while (*token == ' ') ++token;
06667    if (strncmp(token, "+X ", 3)) {
06668        stbi__rewind( s );
06669        return 0;
06670    }
06671    token += 3;
06672    *x = (int) strtol(token, NULL, 10);
06673    *comp = 3;
06674    return 1;
06675 }
06676 #endif // STBI_NO_HDR
06677 
06678 #ifndef STBI_NO_BMP
06679 static int stbi__bmp_info(stbi__context *s, int *x, int *y, int *comp)
06680 {
06681    void *p;
06682    stbi__bmp_data info;
06683 
06684    info.all_a = 255;
06685    p = stbi__bmp_parse_header(s, &info);
06686    stbi__rewind( s );
06687    if (p == NULL)
06688       return 0;
06689    if (x) *x = s->img_x;
06690    if (y) *y = s->img_y;
06691    if (comp) *comp = info.ma ? 4 : 3;
06692    return 1;
06693 }
06694 #endif
06695 
06696 #ifndef STBI_NO_PSD
06697 static int stbi__psd_info(stbi__context *s, int *x, int *y, int *comp)
06698 {
06699    int channelCount, dummy;
06700    if (!x) x = &dummy;
06701    if (!y) y = &dummy;
06702    if (!comp) comp = &dummy;
06703    if (stbi__get32be(s) != 0x38425053) {
06704        stbi__rewind( s );
06705        return 0;
06706    }
06707    if (stbi__get16be(s) != 1) {
06708        stbi__rewind( s );
06709        return 0;
06710    }
06711    stbi__skip(s, 6);
06712    channelCount = stbi__get16be(s);
06713    if (channelCount < 0 || channelCount > 16) {
06714        stbi__rewind( s );
06715        return 0;
06716    }
06717    *y = stbi__get32be(s);
06718    *x = stbi__get32be(s);
06719    if (stbi__get16be(s) != 8) {
06720        stbi__rewind( s );
06721        return 0;
06722    }
06723    if (stbi__get16be(s) != 3) {
06724        stbi__rewind( s );
06725        return 0;
06726    }
06727    *comp = 4;
06728    return 1;
06729 }
06730 #endif
06731 
06732 #ifndef STBI_NO_PIC
06733 static int stbi__pic_info(stbi__context *s, int *x, int *y, int *comp)
06734 {
06735    int act_comp=0,num_packets=0,chained,dummy;
06736    stbi__pic_packet packets[10];
06737 
06738    if (!x) x = &dummy;
06739    if (!y) y = &dummy;
06740    if (!comp) comp = &dummy;
06741 
06742    if (!stbi__pic_is4(s,"\x53\x80\xF6\x34")) {
06743       stbi__rewind(s);
06744       return 0;
06745    }
06746 
06747    stbi__skip(s, 88);
06748 
06749    *x = stbi__get16be(s);
06750    *y = stbi__get16be(s);
06751    if (stbi__at_eof(s)) {
06752       stbi__rewind( s);
06753       return 0;
06754    }
06755    if ( (*x) != 0 && (1 << 28) / (*x) < (*y)) {
06756       stbi__rewind( s );
06757       return 0;
06758    }
06759 
06760    stbi__skip(s, 8);
06761 
06762    do {
06763       stbi__pic_packet *packet;
06764 
06765       if (num_packets==sizeof(packets)/sizeof(packets[0]))
06766          return 0;
06767 
06768       packet = &packets[num_packets++];
06769       chained = stbi__get8(s);
06770       packet->size    = stbi__get8(s);
06771       packet->type    = stbi__get8(s);
06772       packet->channel = stbi__get8(s);
06773       act_comp |= packet->channel;
06774 
06775       if (stbi__at_eof(s)) {
06776           stbi__rewind( s );
06777           return 0;
06778       }
06779       if (packet->size != 8) {
06780           stbi__rewind( s );
06781           return 0;
06782       }
06783    } while (chained);
06784 
06785    *comp = (act_comp & 0x10 ? 4 : 3);
06786 
06787    return 1;
06788 }
06789 #endif
06790 
06791 // *************************************************************************************************
06792 // Portable Gray Map and Portable Pixel Map loader
06793 // by Ken Miller
06794 //
06795 // PGM: http://netpbm.sourceforge.net/doc/pgm.html
06796 // PPM: http://netpbm.sourceforge.net/doc/ppm.html
06797 //
06798 // Known limitations:
06799 //    Does not support comments in the header section
06800 //    Does not support ASCII image data (formats P2 and P3)
06801 //    Does not support 16-bit-per-channel
06802 
06803 #ifndef STBI_NO_PNM
06804 
06805 static int      stbi__pnm_test(stbi__context *s)
06806 {
06807    char p, t;
06808    p = (char) stbi__get8(s);
06809    t = (char) stbi__get8(s);
06810    if (p != 'P' || (t != '5' && t != '6')) {
06811        stbi__rewind( s );
06812        return 0;
06813    }
06814    return 1;
06815 }
06816 
06817 static void *stbi__pnm_load(stbi__context *s, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp, stbi__result_info *ri)
06818 {
06819    stbi_uc *out;
06820    STBI_NOTUSED(ri);
06821 
06822    if (!stbi__pnm_info(s, (int *)&s->img_x, (int *)&s->img_y, (int *)&s->img_n))
06823       return 0;
06824 
06825    *x = s->img_x;
06826    *y = s->img_y;
06827    if (comp) *comp = s->img_n;
06828 
06829    if (!stbi__mad3sizes_valid(s->img_n, s->img_x, s->img_y, 0))
06830       return stbi__errpuc("too large", "PNM too large");
06831 
06832    out = (stbi_uc *) stbi__malloc_mad3(s->img_n, s->img_x, s->img_y, 0);
06833    if (!out) return stbi__errpuc("outofmem", "Out of memory");
06834    stbi__getn(s, out, s->img_n * s->img_x * s->img_y);
06835 
06836    if (req_comp && req_comp != s->img_n) {
06837       out = stbi__convert_format(out, s->img_n, req_comp, s->img_x, s->img_y);
06838       if (out == NULL) return out; // stbi__convert_format frees input on failure
06839    }
06840    return out;
06841 }
06842 
06843 static int      stbi__pnm_isspace(char c)
06844 {
06845    return c == ' ' || c == '\t' || c == '\n' || c == '\v' || c == '\f' || c == '\r';
06846 }
06847 
06848 static void     stbi__pnm_skip_whitespace(stbi__context *s, char *c)
06849 {
06850    for (;;) {
06851       while (!stbi__at_eof(s) && stbi__pnm_isspace(*c))
06852          *c = (char) stbi__get8(s);
06853 
06854       if (stbi__at_eof(s) || *c != '#')
06855          break;
06856 
06857       while (!stbi__at_eof(s) && *c != '\n' && *c != '\r' )
06858          *c = (char) stbi__get8(s);
06859    }
06860 }
06861 
06862 static int      stbi__pnm_isdigit(char c)
06863 {
06864    return c >= '0' && c <= '9';
06865 }
06866 
06867 static int      stbi__pnm_getinteger(stbi__context *s, char *c)
06868 {
06869    int value = 0;
06870 
06871    while (!stbi__at_eof(s) && stbi__pnm_isdigit(*c)) {
06872       value = value*10 + (*c - '0');
06873       *c = (char) stbi__get8(s);
06874    }
06875 
06876    return value;
06877 }
06878 
06879 static int      stbi__pnm_info(stbi__context *s, int *x, int *y, int *comp)
06880 {
06881    int maxv, dummy;
06882    char c, p, t;
06883 
06884    if (!x) x = &dummy;
06885    if (!y) y = &dummy;
06886    if (!comp) comp = &dummy;
06887 
06888    stbi__rewind(s);
06889 
06890    // Get identifier
06891    p = (char) stbi__get8(s);
06892    t = (char) stbi__get8(s);
06893    if (p != 'P' || (t != '5' && t != '6')) {
06894        stbi__rewind(s);
06895        return 0;
06896    }
06897 
06898    *comp = (t == '6') ? 3 : 1;  // '5' is 1-component .pgm; '6' is 3-component .ppm
06899 
06900    c = (char) stbi__get8(s);
06901    stbi__pnm_skip_whitespace(s, &c);
06902 
06903    *x = stbi__pnm_getinteger(s, &c); // read width
06904    stbi__pnm_skip_whitespace(s, &c);
06905 
06906    *y = stbi__pnm_getinteger(s, &c); // read height
06907    stbi__pnm_skip_whitespace(s, &c);
06908 
06909    maxv = stbi__pnm_getinteger(s, &c);  // read max value
06910 
06911    if (maxv > 255)
06912       return stbi__err("max value > 255", "PPM image not 8-bit");
06913    else
06914       return 1;
06915 }
06916 #endif
06917 
06918 static int stbi__info_main(stbi__context *s, int *x, int *y, int *comp)
06919 {
06920    #ifndef STBI_NO_JPEG
06921    if (stbi__jpeg_info(s, x, y, comp)) return 1;
06922    #endif
06923 
06924    #ifndef STBI_NO_PNG
06925    if (stbi__png_info(s, x, y, comp))  return 1;
06926    #endif
06927 
06928    #ifndef STBI_NO_GIF
06929    if (stbi__gif_info(s, x, y, comp))  return 1;
06930    #endif
06931 
06932    #ifndef STBI_NO_BMP
06933    if (stbi__bmp_info(s, x, y, comp))  return 1;
06934    #endif
06935 
06936    #ifndef STBI_NO_PSD
06937    if (stbi__psd_info(s, x, y, comp))  return 1;
06938    #endif
06939 
06940    #ifndef STBI_NO_PIC
06941    if (stbi__pic_info(s, x, y, comp))  return 1;
06942    #endif
06943 
06944    #ifndef STBI_NO_PNM
06945    if (stbi__pnm_info(s, x, y, comp))  return 1;
06946    #endif
06947 
06948    #ifndef STBI_NO_DDS
06949    if (stbi__dds_info(s, x, y, comp, NULL))  return 1;
06950    #endif
06951    
06952    #ifndef STBI_NO_PVR
06953    if (stbi__pvr_info(s, x, y, comp, NULL))  return 1;
06954    #endif
06955    
06956    #ifndef STBI_NO_PKM
06957    if (stbi__pkm_info(s, x, y, comp))  return 1;
06958    #endif
06959    
06960    #ifndef STBI_NO_HDR
06961    if (stbi__hdr_info(s, x, y, comp))  return 1;
06962    #endif
06963 
06964    // test tga last because it's a crappy test!
06965    #ifndef STBI_NO_TGA
06966    if (stbi__tga_info(s, x, y, comp))
06967        return 1;
06968    #endif
06969    return stbi__err("unknown image type", "Image not of any known type, or corrupt");
06970 }

06972 #ifndef STBI_NO_STDIO
06973 STBIDEF int stbi_info(char const *filename, int *x, int *y, int *comp)
06974 {
06975     FILE *f = stbi__fopen(filename, "rb");
06976     int result;
06977     if (!f) return stbi__err("can't fopen", "Unable to open file");
06978     result = stbi_info_from_file(f, x, y, comp);
06979     fclose(f);
06980     return result;
06981 }
06982 
06983 STBIDEF int stbi_info_from_file(FILE *f, int *x, int *y, int *comp)
06984 {
06985    int r;
06986    stbi__context s;
06987    long pos = ftell(f);
06988    stbi__start_file(&s, f);
06989    r = stbi__info_main(&s,x,y,comp);
06990    fseek(f,pos,SEEK_SET);
06991    return r;
06992 }
06993 #endif // !STBI_NO_STDIO
06994 
06995 STBIDEF int stbi_info_from_memory(stbi_uc const *buffer, int len, int *x, int *y, int *comp)
06996 {
06997    stbi__context s;
06998    stbi__start_mem(&s,buffer,len);
06999    return stbi__info_main(&s,x,y,comp);
07000 }
07001 
07002 STBIDEF int stbi_info_from_callbacks(stbi_io_callbacks const *c, void *user, int *x, int *y, int *comp)
07003 {
07004    stbi__context s;
07005    stbi__start_callbacks(&s, (stbi_io_callbacks *) c, user);
07006    return stbi__info_main(&s,x,y,comp);
07007 }

07030 /*
07031    revision history:
07032       2.15  (2017-03-18) fix png-1,2,4 bug; now all Imagenet JPGs decode;
07033                          warning fixes; disable run-time SSE detection on gcc;
07034                          uniform handling of optional "return" values;
07035                          thread-safe initialization of zlib tables
07036       2.14  (2017-03-03) remove deprecated STBI_JPEG_OLD; fixes for Imagenet JPGs
07037       2.13  (2016-11-29) add 16-bit API, only supported for PNG right now
07038       2.12  (2016-04-02) fix typo in 2.11 PSD fix that caused crashes
07039       2.11  (2016-04-02) allocate large structures on the stack
07040                          remove white matting for transparent PSD
07041                          fix reported channel count for PNG & BMP
07042                          re-enable SSE2 in non-gcc 64-bit
07043                          support RGB-formatted JPEG
07044                          read 16-bit PNGs (only as 8-bit)
07045       2.10  (2016-01-22) avoid warning introduced in 2.09 by STBI_REALLOC_SIZED
07046       2.09  (2016-01-16) allow comments in PNM files
07047                          16-bit-per-pixel TGA (not bit-per-component)
07048                          info() for TGA could break due to .hdr handling
07049                          info() for BMP to shares code instead of sloppy parse
